location: Denys the Decadent (Denys the Decadent's Camp)
name: 12-Step Meetings
description_book: 12-step meeting open to all recovery programs. AA, NA, OA, GA, SA, Alanon, etc.
description_web: Open meeting; all are welcome. 12-step meeting open to all recovery programs: AA, NA, OA, GA, SA, Alanon, etc.

name: Introduction to Spinning *Poi*
description_book: Learn some of the basic *poi* movements and terminology necessary to get you started.
description_web: In this one-hour workshop, you will learn some of the basic *poi* movements and terminology necessary to get you started. *Poi* spinning is a great low-impact workout that will help you to improve your coordination and give your fitness routine some "flare"! $20 Material Fee includes your choice of Home of Poi - Sock Poi and a storage pouch. Handout with class review & contacts. Refreshments are also served.
fee_itemization: $20.00 Material Fee covers handout, poi, and refreshments

name: Range Set-up
description_book: Volunteers are requested to help set up the Archery Range on Monday, July 27, starting at 9 am. Archery marshals and non-marshals alike are welcome.
description_web: Volunteers are requested to help set up the Archery Range on Monday, July 27, starting at 9 am. Archery marshals and non-marshals alike are welcome.

name: Heraldry Design Basics
description_book: What better way to get your device submission in shape for Herald's Point, than by learning about heraldry design basics.
description_web: What better way to get your device submission in shape for Herald's Point, than by learning about heraldry design basics. This class will include an introduction to device design, based on the SCA rules of Heraldry. Some one-on-one assistance will be provided.

name: Advanced Engraving
description_book: The continuation of the work begun in the beginning class. Hand-engraving on copper plate. Letters and design work.
description_web: The continuation of the work begun in the beginning class. Hand-engraving on copper plate. Letters and design work.

name: Anglo-Saxon Context: Late Roman World
description_book: Neighboring cultures inform us about the Anglo-Saxons. We'll focus on the late Roman world, both survivals of the Romano-British and Roman/Byzantine.
description_web: To understand Anglo-Saxons we need to understand the people with whom they interacted, what came before and after. This series of workshops looks at the surrounding cultures through the lens of their interaction with the Anglo-Saxons. This workshop focuses on the the continuing influence of Rome. We'll cover the Romano-British culture and the cultures of the Mediterranean: Lombard, Visigoth, and other heirs to the Roman Empire, especially Constantinople.

name: Bedtime Stories for Children
description_book: Nightly telling of stories for children.
description_web: 7 pm nightly: Stories and fables for children. All are welcome to attend; must have adult escort.

location: Denys the Decadent (Denys the Decadent's Camp)
name: 12-Step Meetings
description_book: 12-step meeting open to all recovery programs. AA, NA, OA, GA, SA, Alanon, etc.
description_web: Open meeting; all are welcome. 12-step meeting open to all recovery programs: AA, NA, OA, GA, SA, Alanon, etc.

name: *Études* 1 and 2 for Single Sword (Fencing)
description_book: For all levels and teachers. Drills focus on form, balance, movement and coordination. *Études* for drill; elements from drill used to work in groups.
description_web: For beginner and intermediate fencers and those who teach them. These drills will focus on form, balance, movement and coordination. *Étude*1 (first week) is more linear; *Étude* 2 (second week) adds off line/lateral movement. Emphasis will be on learning the *études* for home drill, as well as taking elements out of the drill for more focused work in groups.

name: Beginning Kumihimo
description_book: Part 1: Learn the basics of Japanese braiding using the modern foam disk. Students will learn a round, square and flat braid.
description_web: Part 1: Learn the basics of Japanese braiding using the modern foam disk. Students will learn a round, square and flat braid. Uses for, history and names of braids will be discussed. Students may bring own equipment if desired.
fee_itemization: total class is 10.00 if just handout 3.00

name: Thorsberg Trousers: Pants That Last!
description_book: Tired of repairing pants that rip in unmentionable places? Then you’ll love these pants based on trousers from an Iron Age burial!
description_web: Tired of repairing pants that rip in unmentionable places? Then you’ll love these pants based on trousers from an Iron Age burial! Learn what you’ll need to make them yourself: fabrics, seams, pattern, and construction.

name: Beginner Knitting
description_book: Learn how to cast on, knit, purl, and cast off. Feel free to bring your own needles and yarn.

name: Anglo-Saxon Context: Celts: Wales Ireland Scotland
description_book: Neighboring cultures inform us about the Anglo-Saxons. We'll focus on the Celtic kingdoms of Wales, Ireland and Scotland's interactions with England.
description_web: To understand Anglo-Saxons we need to understand the people with whom they interacted, what came before and after. This series of workshops looks at the surrounding cultures through the lens of their interaction with the Anglo-Saxons. This workshop focuses on the Celtic kingdoms of Wales, Ireland and Scotland: how they interacted with the English - and were changed by them.

name: Children's Dance: Branles and More!
description_book: It's never too early to learn to dance! Expect branles; other dances as time allows! (Any youth in attendance require a responsible adult present.)
description_web: It's never too early to learn to dance! Come learn dances fun for all ages. This class will have a focus on branles, both miming and tangle, but will include other dances as time allows! Parents are welcome and, indeed, encouraged to attend. For children under 12, Pennsic rules require a responsible adult to accompany them.

name: Intro to Woodworking
description_book: Introduction to woodworking with only hand tools. Includes modern SOPs and safe practices for the purposes of building medieval-style furniture.
description_web: Two half days Tuesday and Wednesday; an overview of hand wood work, with an opportunity to try things out. We will start on Tuesday morning with a chunk of a log and by noon we should have some boards or other furniture parts using wedges, axes, froes, drawknives, spokeshaves and wood planes. On Wednesday we will look at making joints, boring, and maybe a bit of carving. Covers saws, chisels, and planes. Extensive instructions on the selection, use and maintenance of all these tools will be covered. The class will be taught both first week and again second week. Students who cannot attend the whole class are encouraged to drop in or out at their convenience.

name: Fool School
description_book: Are you a fool or a fool wannabe? Come to Fool School to share and learn. Prepare a 5-minute skit to perform. All ages/experience levels welcome.
description_web:
Are you a fool or a fool wannabe? Come to Fool School to share and learn. Fools/performers of all types and experience levels are welcome. Jugglers, magicians, singers, freaks and geeks. Get help creating or honing a skit of no more than 5 minutes to perform in the Amphitheater Wednesday 8/6 6-7 pm.
You might even become a “Licensed Fool.” Performing is not mandatory.

name: Beautiful Neckline Finishing
description_book: Hands-on class. Learn how to finish a neckline based on extant examples from the 13th century. Technique uses a bias-cut strip.
description_web: Hands-on class. Learn how to finish a neckline based on extant examples from the 13th century. Technique uses a bias-cut strip and makes a beautifully finished neckline. If you have needle, thread and scissors, please bring them. If there is time remaining, we will also go over a seam finishing technique.

name: Ninja: Truth from Shadows
description_book: Dare you look into the shadows of history to find the truth? Come to discover both the legends and real history of Japan's famed assassins. New info!
description_web: Dare you look into the shadows of history to find the truth? Come to discuss and discover both legends and the real history of Japan's famed spies and assassins. This class will examine the romanticized image of the Ninja and discuss the actual history of the world's most famous spies.

name: Wool Spinning on Many Distaffs: Hands-On
description_book: Learn the use of the iconic distaff. Distaffs are not just for flax! Learn how to prepare wool to spin and mount it on various styles of distaffs.
description_web:
Learn the use of the iconic distaff. Distaffs are not just for flax! To a spinster, a distaff functions as a third hand, holding a large quantity of fiber in orderly condition as she pulls down fiber to fill her spindle. Come and learn about several types of distaff designs and how to mount wool prepared in various ways on them. Great for hot, sticky or windy weather. Keep the wool on the distaff, not on you!!!! Spinsters often find the evenness of their yarn improves when mounted on a distaff.  And if you walk around a lot…. 'porting your distaff with spindle tucked into the cross lacing is so easy. Improve your Pennsic spinning experience. Loaner spindles and distaffs are available for students who don't wish to purchase them.

I have just produced some YouTube videos on Medieval Spinning that you might enjoy before coming to Pennsic, but not required! http://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLjUCUOUGq_WC-sv2N_qfIhpJDi8LbR-9U, or just search YouTube for "missingspindle". Discussion of medieval spinning info is on my blog here: "missingspindle.blogspot.com"

name: Anglo-Saxon Medicine
description_book: The Anglo-Saxons used herbs, surgery, and magick to deal with chronic and acute illness and injury. What did they use, and what can we safely use now?
description_web: Anglo-Saxons' medicine included herbs, surgery, and magick. They dealt with  injuries, chronic and acute illness. Recent tests showed some receipts from their leech books effective, although clearly some remedies are better to read about than try. We'll look at sources, herbal remedies, healing magick, and other techniques (like surgery), who practitioners were, and what self treatment was like. You may find something you can use, you will find many things to amuse.

name: Italian Dance for English Feet: *Anello, Fedelta*
description_book: Don't let Italian dances intimidate you! Come to learn two simple Italian dances taught with the English Country dancer in mind.
description_web: Italian dances can often seem quite intimidating for dancers just getting steady on their English Country feet. Explore two of the more simple yet visually appealing Italian dances, *Anello* and *Fedelta*, taught with English Country terminology.

name: Set-up: Rehearsal and Class Tent
description_book: Set-up Rehearsal and Class Tent: signs, chairs, and other necessary Performing Arts properties for classes and events.
description_web: Set-up Rehearsal and Class Tent: signs, chairs, and other necessary Performing Arts properties for classes and events.

name: Weed Walk
description_book: Wild plant identification. Wear walking shoes and hat; leave from Univ. Point. Different teachers on different days; walk with us more than once!
description_web: Cooper's Lake abounds with medicinal and food plants that were used by various primitive and medieval cultures. Learn to identify them during a walk around the campsite. The walk will take place rain or shine. Please wear sturdy shoes and a hat. Meet at University Point for the start of the class. We have three wonderful new teachers this year, enabling us to offer this class more times!

name: Belly Dance for Girls and Teens
description_book: Basic belly dance for girls and teens. Parents may attend with children. Learn basic movements and some cultural background. All levels welcome
description_web: Basic belly dance for girls and teens. Parents may attend with their children. Teens are welcome to attend both this and my adult class. Learn fun easy-to-do basic movements of belly dance...along with the cultural historical background of belly dance. All levels of ability welcome.

name: Set-up: Performing Arts Tent
description_book: Set-up in Performing Arts Tent: stage decks and tops, stage back drop, curtains, backstage area, signs, lights, and other PA properties.
description_web: On Tuesday and Wednesday of Land Grab Week, we build the stage, hang curtains, rig the house and backstage lights, and set up the chairs. This starts at about 10 am each day and continues until we are done. Come help us make the tent into a theater worthy of the name!  Bring your cordless drills and other hand tools. On Tuesday we also set up the Amphitheater and the Performing Arts Rehearsal Tent.

name: Juggling 101 (Beginner)
description_book: Learn to juggle three balls in the simplest pattern. Equipment available for use or purchase.
description_web: The most basic 3-ball cascade juggling. Juggling balls will be made available for use by the class and may be bought afterward from the instructor.

name: Ships in the SCA Period: A Chronological Overview
description_book: A comprehensive overview of the development of ships in western Europe between 600 and 1600.
description_web: A comprehensive overview of the development of ships in western Europe between 600 and 1600.

name: HS Summer Math Help and Challenge Problems
description_book: Teenagers (and others)! Do you have summer math work? Algebra through AP calculus. Get some help, help one another, or try the challenge problems.
description_web: Teenagers (and others)! Do you have summer math work? Algebra through AP calculus. Get some help, help one another, or try the challenge problems. Don't make your parents have to remind you to open the book you carried to Pennsic. ;-)

name: Medieval Papercutting
description_book: History and technique of decorative papercutting from 6th-century China to 15th-century Germany.

name: *Zibaldone da Canal*: The Book of a 14th-C Trader
description_book: The daily life of a 14th-century man, geared towards the fun and insightful bits that animate. Also a great look at a contemporary view on Islam.
description_web: A look into the daily life of a 14th-century merchant named Canal, through diary and ledger, geared towards the fun and insightful bits that bring him to life. Watch him fail at learning algebra. Learn how he feels about Islam. You may never get a better look at the personal thoughts of someone who lived 600 years ago.

name: The Market Wallet: A Form of Period Luggage
description_book: The market wallet is an alternative to the shoulder bag in use from Anglo-Saxon to 19th-C Europe. Construction and period evidence will be discussed.

instructor: Lady Angharad verch Glyndwr O Llang
name: Basic Bookbinding
description_book: Basic binding of books, history, hands-on, practical application. Learn different stitches and page attachment; leave with a small bound book.
description_web: Basic binding of books, a bit of history, hands-on, and practical application. Participants will learn different types of stitching and page attachment, plus covers, and will leave with a small bound book and/or a girdlebook cover.

name: Designing and Building a Pavilion
description_book: An overview of pavilion styles, followed by detailed discussions of design considerations for several different styles.
description_web: This class will present an overview of medieval and Renaissance tent and pavilion styles, based on what we see in period portraits and in a few surviving examples. The presenters will discuss their experience in building a variety of pavilions. After the class period, students are welcome to visit several pavilions on-site to continue discussion of design details and challenges.

name: *Gracca Amorosa* for Beginners
description_book: Come learn *Gracca Amorosa*, one of the most popular 16th-C. *cascarde*. Dancers of all ages welcome. Prior dance experience helpful but not required.

name: Viking: The Next Step...
description_book: Taking your basic Viking/Norse to the next level. This class includes accessories and covers head to toe. Male and female.
description_web: Taking your basic Viking/Norse to the next level. How to make small changes to polish your overall Norse look. This class includes accessories and covers head to toe. Male and female attire will be covered. This is not a sewing or persona-specific class.

name: The Medievalist Abroad: What to See in Italy
description_book: A tourist itinerary of medieval attractions, based on extensive personal experience, starting with Venice, Florence, and Rome, and going on.
description_web: Medieval Italy is sadly neglected by tourism bureaus that emphasize classical and Renaissance attractions. This class will highlight some of Italy's many medieval glories, financed by a golden age of profiteering from the crusades and crusaders.

name: European Sword Dancing
description_book: An overview of hilt and point sword dances in period, and a chance to learn a more modern, though quite similar, version.
description_web: An overview of hilt and point sword dances in period, and a chance to learn a more modern, though quite similar, version.
fee_itemization: Handout. Materials are limited because I only have 12 "swords" to dance with.

name: Beginning *Repoussé* and Chasing
description_book: Hands-on class; will make a copper foil rose.
description_web: Hands-on class; will make a copper foil rose.

name: Middle Eastern Dancing for All Shapes and Sizes
description_book: If you love to shake your shimmy or want to try dancing for the first time, come out and join us.

name: Indian Kutchwork / Marash Embroidery I
description_book: Basic interlaced herringbone stitch: a complex multi-step stitch used primarily in northern Indian and Armenian embroidery dating from the 13th C.
description_web: Interlaced herringbone stitch is a complex multi-step stitch used primarily in northern Indian and Armenian embroidery dating from the 13th C. This class teaches the basics of layout and work from which more complex patterns can be built.
fee_itemization: Handout packet includes hoop, fabric, floss, needle, instruction, research CD

name: Exchequer 101
description_book: Were you told, “Just put expense A on line 15 – it’s easy!”? Have you ever been confused by SCA financial reports? Would you like to understand them?

name: Are You Wearing a Tablecloth? Greek Clothing!
description_book: Learn how to create Greek garb easily, accurately, and with style! Meet Greek style, form, and ideals for the easiest garb ever!
description_web: We all deal with hot weather in the summer. Learn how to do so easily, accurately, and with style! We will cover basic Greek style, form, and ideals, then go into fabrics, colors, trims, and accessories to create a great classical and cool look.

name: Historical Uses of Poisons
description_book: A rundown of the weaponization of poisons in history garnered from various resources.
description_web: A review of the weaponization of poisonous plants (and two rocks) as recorded in history. A summary garnered from various resources, the compilation paints a unique picture of warfare and weaponization techniques from several cultures.

name: Midrealm Youth A&S 50 Activity
description_book: Kids! Come by for a few minutes, sign your name to the list and help with the Midrealm Youth A&S 50 project! (You don't have to be from the Midrealm.)
description_web: Kids, Youth, and Teens! Come by for a few minutes, sign your name to the list, and help out with the Midrealm Youth A&S 50 project! (You don't have to be from the Midrealm, but you will learn a little about the Dragon Heraldry!) This is open to anyone old enough to hold a crayon and only takes as long as you want!

name: Heavy Metal Embroidery: Finnish Style!
description_book: A brief history about Finnish Iron Age Bronze Spirals and how to create the decorations yourself.

name: Penta Pentamere Dances
description_book: Learn five easy dances that require no more than two couples: Petite Rose, Montarde Bransle, Grene Gynger, Black Alman and Rufty Tufty.
description_web: Learn five easy dances that require no more than two couples: Petite Rose, Montarde Bransle, Grene Gynger, Black Alman and Rufty Tufty. Buy a step-by-step dance guide and the music if you want or download here. http://www.michiganleftturn.org/Penta-Pentamere-Dances.htm
fee_itemization:
$2 - Dance steps
$10 - 6 song CD
Purchase not required

name: Introduction to Harp
description_book: Offering a brief history of the harp and the chance to try one to see if you would like to pursue the harp further. I will have three harps with me.
description_web: If you have an admiration for the harp and wondered what it would be like to play one, this class offering will give you an opportunity to try one. A brief history of the harp is given plus I will have two extra harps for you to try to help you decide if the harp is an instrument you would like to pursue further.

name: Beginning Engraving
description_book: Hands-on class. Intro to tools, first cuts, graver control, hammer use.
description_web: Hands-on class. Intro to tools, first cuts, graver control. Student will learn both hand-held and hammer-struck engraving.

name: Pilgrim's Bag
description_book: Thought about carrying a pilgrim's bag? Free up your hands; keep your modern items out of sight. Learn how to make a cloth or leather pilgrim's bag.
description_web: Ever thought about carrying a pilgrim's bag instead of carrying a bulky basket? You can free up your hands, and it is a great way to keep your modern items out of sight. Learn how you can make a pilgrim's bag, out of cloth or leather.

name: Hounds Abound!
description_book: Interested in how hounds were kept? What were the different types of hounds? What is coursing? Come learn about all things canine!
description_web: Come learn about hounds in the Middle Ages! We'll be looking at different types of hounds, how they were cared for, how they were hunted and how they fit into everyday life.

name: Hand-Sewing 101
description_book: A discussion and hands-on of hand-sewing of garb, etc. This is not embroidery, but useful stitches. Please bring needle, thread and light cloth.

name: Pimp My Wine
description_book: Learn how to "Pimp My Wine" and turn everyday wine into a period-style hypocras full of spice and yumminess. Tastings so bring ID. Age 21 and over.
description_web: Just like "Pimp My Ride" takes an ordinary old car and turns it into a masterpiece, this class will show you how to turn your normal everyday wine into a period-style hypocras full of spice and yumminess. Alcoholic and non-alcoholic version will be available for sample during the class so please remember your ID. Age 21 and over.

name: Armored Rose: Lecture
description_book: Based on the book, "The Armored Rose", by Duchess Elina of Beckenham, OL, OP, OR, KSCA; a "must" for those who are or teach or fight women.
description_web: Based on the book, "The Armored Rose", by Duchess Elina of Beckenham, OL, OP, OR, KSCA. The class covers the physical, physiological and psychological differences between men and women and how these impact fighting, plus how to make the most of them. Tendons, adrenaline, hormones and society all have an impact. See how they play a part in changing the fight.

name: Beginner Dance: 15th-Century Italian A
description_book: Never danced before? No problem! This class will start with basic steps and patterns, and then teach fun, simple dances from 15th-century Italy.
description_web: Never danced before? No problem! This class will start with basic steps and patterns, and then teach fun, simple dances from 15th-century Italy.

name: 30 Seconds and A Capo
description_book: Convert your guitar into a lute! Includes a tutorial and examples of period tablature; feel free to bring your own instrument but it isn't required

name: The Beauty of Brevity
description_book: Speaking beautifully and inspirationally without taking hours to do it.
description_web: Speaking beautifully and inspirationally without taking hours to do it. We will be exploring resources that inspire us and, hopefully, you as well.

name: Intoduction to Labyrinths
description_book: Labyrinths wend through all of period. Learn the basic types and how to draw them. Explore their change over time. ”The Chalk Labyrinth Guy”, teacher.
description_web: It matters not if you are Tudor or Turk, Norseman or Nepalese, Breton or Borgia, labyrinths are a part of your world. Topics covered are "What *is* a labyrinth?" ; categories and types; how to draw one; and a whirlwind tour of labyrinths in period. From storytelling devices to dancing floors, from monster trap to heavenly road the labyrinth has meant many things to many peoples. Brought to you by "That Chalk Labyrinth Guy."

name: The Social: A Recurring Non-Activity
description_book: How can a small, weekly canton social activity turn into something pulling 40-50+ members from four states on a regular basis, and what's next?
description_web:
Modeled after something seen in the Canton of Whyt Whey some years ago, the Canton of Black Icorndall started a weekly "Canton Social" which has proven to be very successful in terms of general socializing, encouraging niche or not-quite-SCA (even non-SCA) activities as well as serving as a staging ground to relaunch a regional fighter practice, rekindle dance practice and more. It also serves as a good venue for newcomers with so much going on. Join us for a discussion of the model, our successes, some things to watch out for and more!

Learn what we've learned since starting to offer this class, and bring more ideas to the table!

name: Making a Glastonbury "Lite" Chair
description_book: Learn the tips and techniques behind a folding chair with Glastonbury-style arms.
description_web: Tired of the look and limited life span of Coleman chairs? Learn the tips and techniques you need to make a wooden folding chair with Glastonbury-style arms. It folds to 6" thick, holds up to 300 lbs. (my wife and I tested it), and can be decorated.

name: Beginner Dance: Branles A
description_book: Never danced before? No problem! We'll start with basic steps and patterns, and then introduce you to fun branles from 16th-century France.

name: Advanced *Repoussé* and Chasing
description_book: Intro to pitch block working and forming, plus tool and hammer use. Produce a copper letter amulet.
description_web: Intro to pitch block working and forming, plus tool and hammer use. Produce a copper letter amulet.

name: The Poleax Techniques of Paulus Hector Mair
description_book: Period poleax techniques that stress using the width of the ax in both defensive and offensive fashion applicable to SCA heavy list use.
description_web: Period poleax techniques that stress using the width of the ax in both defensive and offensive fashion applicable to SCA heavy list use.

name: Being in Tune in Period
description_book: An introduction to the sound of tuning schemes using ratios, as used in medieval and Renaissance music. I use recorded sounds.
description_web: This class is an introduction to pitch and tuning in period. A was not 440, and equal temperament was only a (not very useful) theory. There were choices that had to be made in tuning fixed-pitch instruments like organs, harps, and fretted instruments. We will examine the theory and hear examples of four versions of the musical scale and the differences between them. These scales include the two musical tunings most commonly used in the medieval and Renaissance periods: Pythagorean and ¼-comma meantone. There will be no arithmetic required.

name: Lunch Counters for Fun and Profit
description_book: Get the most out of your lunch counter and still make sure people are properly fed without having a lot left over while making money.
description_web: How to get the most out of your lunch counter and still make sure people are properly fed without having a lot left over while making money. Sample recipes, portioning, cost breakdown and budgets will be discussed.

name: Chainmaille for Beginners
description_book: An introduction to chainmaille. Students will learn European 4-in-1, Byzantine, and Half Persian 3-in-1.
description_web: This is a simple introduction to chainmaille. In total, there will be three weaves taught on three separate days (one weave per day). Weaves taught will be European 4-in-1, Byzantine, and Half Persian 3-in-1.

name: Sex in SCA Period
description_book: Not marriage, not birth, just sex. It's your Western Civ class with the juicy bits left in.
description_web: Not marriage, not birth, just sex. It's your Western Civ class with the juicy bits left in. From the illicit frescos of Pompeii to Aretino's invention of modern pornography. This year I will be adding a small section on sex crimes. Handouts are limited, but I will also have CDs of the material for $1.
fee_itemization: Printing fees for 30 pg handouts  including 7 color pages

name: Armored Rose: Field Class
description_book: On-the-field class teaching techniques from the Armored Rose lecture. Bring sword and shield. No armor needed. Covers stance and power generation.
description_web: Based on the book, "The Armored Rose", by Duchess Elina of Beckenham, OL, OP, OR, KSCA. The class covers the physical differences between men and women and how these impact fighting, and how to make the most of them. Best taken in conjunction with the lecture course, this is a physical demonstration where students and teachers will try out the techniques covered in the lecture.

name: Recorder Jam Session
description_book: Do you play the recorder? Would you like to play with others in a group setting? Read through music? Come join us. All ages welcome.
description_web: Do you play the recorder? Would you like to play with others in a group setting? Read through Renaissance literature? Come join us. In the 90-minute session we will start with beginner/easy reading and then move towards harder music. If you're a youth player, then come at the beginning. If you're more advanced, then come halfway through. Bring your instrument or use one of ours. There will be soprano recorders available at $6.00 each, and alto recorders for $12.00.
fee_itemization: $3 is music for the class.  There will be soprano recorders available at $6.00 each, and alto recorders for $12.

name: Henna Body Art for Beginners
description_book: From mixing paste from the best ingredients, to safety instruction and building your first designs, we will focus on the basics for great henna.
fee_itemization: $5 per henna cone provided to students. I sell mundanely at this rate.

name: *Chifting* to Sunset: Relaxing Belly Dance
description_book: End the day with Moon Salute, *taqsim* belly dance, *chiftitelli* rhythm and yoga for floor work. Bring yoga mat, shoes, and veil! All ages welcome.
description_web: Class includes *Chandra Namaskar* (Moon Salutation), *taqsim* belly dance, and yoga poses suitable for belly dance floor work. We will explore the *chiftitelli* rhythm with combinations and improvisation. A relaxing way to end the day and welcome evening. Please bring a yoga mat, shoes and a veil. All ages are welcome. Musicians are welcome!

name: Bedtime Stories for Children
description_book: Nightly telling of stories for children.
description_web: 7 pm nightly: Stories and fables for children. All are welcome to attend; must have adult escort.

name: Open Dancing
description_book: Join us all evening for dancing by request.

location: Denys the Decadent (Denys the Decadent's Camp)
name: 12-Step Meetings
description_book: 12-step meeting open to all recovery programs. AA, NA, OA, GA, SA, Alanon, etc.
description_web: Open meeting; all are welcome. 12-step meeting open to all recovery programs: AA, NA, OA, GA, SA, Alanon, etc.

name: *Études* 1 and 2 for Single Sword (Fencing)
description_book: For all levels and teachers. Drills focus on form, balance, movement and coordination. *Études* for drill; elements from drill used to work in groups.
description_web: For beginner and intermediate fencers and those who teach them. These drills will focus on form, balance, movement and coordination. *Étude*1 (first week) is more linear; *Étude* 2 (second week) adds off line/lateral movement. Emphasis will be on learning the *études* for home drill, as well as taking elements out of the drill for more focused work in groups.

location: Thunder Bird Atlatl  (Thunder Bird Atlatl Booth #?)
name: How to Make an Atlatl Dart
description_book: How to make an atlatl dart from start to cast. Limit of 4 students participating in each class.

name: Glass Day
description_book: Working with glass to make handmade beads. Torches will be set up for demonstration and use; a display will showcase the various styles created.

name: The Tournament: A Festival for All
description_book: Tournaments were a venue for spectators, musicians, dancers, cooks, heralds. In fact, they were a microcosm of the SCA in general. Join us to learn.
description_web:
In the SCA we often equate the word tournament to combat or competition ...
but that is just a small part of what tournaments were during most of the
Middle Ages. Non-combatant activities had a very important role and filled most of the time. Tournaments were a venue for spectators, musicians, dancers, cooks, heralds. In fact, they were a microcosm of the SCA in general. Join us to learn about ways to bring your persona's passion to the lists whether you are a fighter, consort, artist or herald... or stop by and share your experience with others.

Combat is not permitted in the University, but combatants will be there to
entertain and amuse the gallery as well as converse with and answer
questions for those who have interest in the martial aspect of tournaments.

name: Cheesemakers / Dairy Arts Day
description_book: Blessed are the Cheesemakers who make tasty bits. Come play with us and experience some tasty, tantalizing treats. See what you can make.
description_web: Blessed are the Cheesemakers who make tasty bits. Come play with us and experience some tasty, tantalizing treats. See what you can make and learn how cheese is made.

name: Intermediate Kumihimo
description_book: Part 2: Students will continue to learn more braids on foam disk. There will be four new braids taught in this class.
description_web: Part 2: Students will continue to learn more braids on foam disk. There will be four new braids taught in this class. Students will also learn how to finish braids in many different styles.
fee_itemization:
10.00 for materials & handout
3.00 for handout only

name: Lucet: Beyond Square Cord
description_book: You can make good square cord; what's next? Flat and multi-color cords. Bring your lucet. (We can slip a cord off and put it back on after class.)
description_web: You’re comfortable making square cord; what's next? We'll work on flat and multi-color cords. Please bring your lucet. We'll also demonstrate how to slip a cord off, and put it back on after class.
fee_itemization: (3) colors of floss on cards, and handout

name: HS Summer Math Help and Challenge Problems
description_book: Teenagers (and others)! Do you have summer math work? Algebra through AP calculus. Get some help, help one another, or try the challenge problems.
description_web: Teenagers (and others)! Do you have summer math work? Algebra through AP calculus. Get some help, help one another, or try the challenge problems. Don't make your parents have to remind you to open the book you carried to Pennsic. ;-)

name: Introduction to Hebrew Language
description_book: A discussion of Hebrew in the medieval period and introduction to the Hebrew alphabet.
description_web: Hebrew is an ancient tongue, and underwent many permuations throughout its history before its modern revival. We will discuss some of the evolutions of Hebrew from the Iron Age through the medieval period, who was learning and speaking this language, and why. We will also look at some Hebrew scripts, and go through basic pronunciation exercises.
fee_itemization: $1.50 to cover costs of printing the alphabet charts

name: Gardening for Beginners
description_book: Do you want to garden? Learn to grow your own food and herbs. We will discuss site choice, soils, sun, pollinators, pests, and more.
description_web: Do you want to garden, but don't know how? This class will cover the basics of how to grow your own food and herbs. We will discuss site choice, soils, sun, pollinators, pests, and more.

name: Small Silk Banner, 10" x 10"
description_book: Learn how to make a small silk banner; handouts available plus material list if you wish to make more. Limit of 12 participants. Others may watch.
description_web: Learn how to make a small silk banner using the Serti ('corral' the dye) style. There will be handouts, including a material list so you can make more banners/standards when you get home. Limit of 12 participants. Others may watch.

name: Anglo-Saxon Context: Franks Carolingia Merovingia
description_book: Neighboring cultures inform us about the Anglo-Saxons. We'll focus on the Merovingian, Carolingian and other Frankish interactions with England.
description_web: To understand Anglo-Saxons we need to understand the people with whom they interacted, what came before and after. This series of workshops looks at the surrounding cultures through the lens of their interaction with the Anglo-Saxons. This workshop focuses on the Merovingian, Carolingian, Holy Roman Empire, and other Frankish kingdoms, and how that interaction impacted the Anglo-Saxons.

name: ASHI Basic First Aid
description_book: Created to help students develop basic first aid knowledge, skills, and the confidence to respond. Cost is $15 for card only, $20 including books.
description_web: Basic First Aid was created to help students develop basic first aid knowledge, skills, and the confidence to respond. The program is an excellent choice for both the community and workplace setting, and is consistent with recommendations of the 2010 National First Aid Science Advisory Board and OSHA’s best practices for first aid training programs in the workplace. Class length: 5 hours. Cost is $15 for card only, $20 including books.
fee_itemization: Separate fee for card or course materials.

name: Introduction to Runes
description_book: Introduction to the *Futharc* and *Futhorc* runes for use in divination and magic (and *RúnValdr* q.v.) with resources for further study.
description_web: Runes are a system of writing that is now best known as a tool for divination, but has been more, from basic communication to magickal practice. This workshop will give an overview of what the runes have been and can be, and give you direction on how to proceed in your studies.

name: Children's Dance: Old English Dances
description_book: It's never too early to learn to dance! Come learn old English dances fun for all ages. (Any youth in attendance require a responsible adult present.)

name: Fool School
description_book: Are you a fool or a fool wannabe? Come to Fool School to share and learn. Prepare a 5-minute skit to perform. All ages/experience levels welcome.
description_web:
Are you a fool or a fool wannabe? Come to Fool School to share and learn. Fools/performers of all types and experience levels are welcome. Jugglers, magicians, singers, freaks and geeks. Get help creating or honing a skit of no more than 5 minutes to perform in the Amphitheater Wednesday 8/6 6-7 pm.
You might even become a “Licensed Fool.” Performing is not mandatory.

name: Teas and Why We Love Them!
description_book: Covers the history, the diversity and properties of the teas we love!
description_web: This class will cover the history, the diversity and properties of the teas we love!  We will cover the many kinds of tea, from white to black, from whole leaf to dusting, the many health benefits, and the preparation the many different kinds of teas! We will have a tea party to enjoy a few of the diverse kinds of teas available. Sorry, due to dietary restrictions, bring your own cookies! There will be some recipes and brewing instructions in the handout.
fee_itemization: 6 different types of teas to sample, cups and hot water, sweeteners, lemon and cream.

name: What Knights Worried About
description_book: In 1350, Geoffroi de Charny took the demoralized knights of France to school. See what Charny thought knights needed to re-learn about chivalry.

name: Breastfeeding and Babywearing Support Group
description_book: If you are pregnant or breastfeeding and would like mom support, please come. Bring the kids. IBCLC, La Leche leaders, LCs, counselors. Late is ok.
description_web: Breastfeeders and babywearers, unite. Come join us If you are a babywearer,  pregnant or nursing (any age child), if you are an exclusive pumper, or if you are a support person or educator. Everyone is welcome to come, hang out and learn about breastfeeding, babywearing and overcoming issues. Sometimes we all need help when we are working through issues like heat, growth spurts, teething, first foods and weaning, getting a good back carry. This is a casual group. If you have learned something about breastfeeding and babywearing, and you think it would benefit others, please feel free to share it. If you are an IBCLC, LC, Support Counselor, educator, La Leche League leader or associate, please come and provide your support. Bring your favourite baby carriers to show others. We can also talk about weaving carriers and traditional babywearing.

name: Beginning Tatting, Part 1
description_book: Tatting is a type of lacemaking. Supplies can be found at craft stores. Learn a craft that fits in a Ziploc bag, can be done in the car, or at court!
description_web: Tatting is a type of lacemaking. Supplies can be found at most craft stores. Learn a craft that fits in a Ziploc bag, and can be done in the car or at court! I will focus on learning how to make both parts of the double stitch flip every time, forming the double stitch and making a ring of double stitches.
fee_itemization: I provide prewound shuttles and a handout with directions and projects.

name: 10th-17th-C. Spindle Sticks and Whorls, Hands-On
description_book: Learn use of Viking, Anglo Norse and Netherlandish recreated spindle sticks and whorls, including 'tuning' spindle and whorl. Hands-on spinning.
description_web:
Hands-on spinning includes a selection of re-created Anglo Norse spindle sticks from Coppergate, Viking spindles from Norse settlements of the 10th-17th centuries (including North Atlantic Saga type), and Netherlandish spindles/*Raeren* whorls from the 16th-17th century also used in England. Some examples different than last year will be available to test and to buy. Instructor will teach 'tuning' whorls to spindle sticks and is particularly interested in the spinability of surviving spindle sticks with the 'belly bump' on the shaft. Tapered whorl holes that match tapered spindle sticks will be explored. Students will spin wool (provided) on these re-creations in class. All levels welcome, though this is not a beginners' class. Note that this class has 'loaner' spindle sticks available for those who don't want to purchase them, or bring your own and some wool to spin if we run out. 

I have just produced some YouTube videos on medieval spinning that you might enjoy before coming to Pennsic, but it is not required! http://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLjUCUOUGq_WC-sv2N_qfIhpJDi8LbR-9U, or just search YouTube for "missingspindle". And a blog on Viking /medieval spinning here: missingspindle.blogspot.com.
fee_itemization: Dependent on whether student uses loaner spindle or purchases spindles in price range from $20.00-$40.00

name: Sprang: Basics and Beyond
description_book: Open to beginners and to all who would like to expand to new techniques as well.
description_web: Learn a new thread manipulation skill! Open to beginners and to all who would like to expand to new techniques as well.

name: *RúnValdr*
description_book: In period, runes were very rarely used for divination, but there are many examples of runes being used for magic. A modern system for rune magick.
description_web: In period, runes were very rarely used for divination, but there are many examples of runes being used for magic. This is a system that shows, for example, how to use Norse or Anglo-Saxon runes to hear even at distance, or to awaken inanimate objects. This is a system of energy manipulation using runes and another set of symbols. This workshop introduces the symbols and what each of them is used for, and includes the attunement. It does *not* include introduction to runes. You may take this workshop without knowing the runes, but you will need to learn them to be able to use this system. You will be able to use this technique immediately.

name: Italian Dance for English Feet:*Bizzarria d'Amore*
description_book: Don't be intimidated by Italian dance! Join us for Negri's *Bizzarria d'Amore* using English Country Dance terminology.
description_web: Italian dances can seem intimidating for dancers just getting steady on their English Country feet. Negri's *Bizzaria d'Amore* is a simple Italian dance for couples that translates easily into ECD terminology. For as many couples as will in sets of two.

name: Tarot and other Card Games
description_book: A review of the card games previously taught, including the game of tarot. Practice playing them with an instructor's assistance.
description_web: This class will review the card games previously taught, including tarot. You can practice playing them with an instructor's assistance.

name: Storytelling Academy
description_book: Explore genres, tools, styles, and uses of storytelling. Cultural and medieval approaches, applications, performance coaching. New topics each day.
description_web: During this nine-day academy, students will gain knowledge about the history and techniques for storytelling both in the SCA and the modern world. Students may attend individual sessions or all of the academy. There will be guest teachers and time for students to practice and receive feedback. The academy will culminate in a student performance. No classes are repeated. The focus is on comfort, nurturing, and honing skills within the students’ capabilities. All levels are welcome. Students may pick up a class outline at the academy space, Minerva’s Spindle 158, where classes will also be listed on the message board. Seating is limited; feel free to bring your own chair.

name: Christmas (Music) in July
description_book: Music-reading session on period music for 12th Night or Wassail. Singers and instrumentalists welcome. Public domain music, handout, no charge.
description_web: Bring your singing voice or instrument to a music-reading session featuring SCA-period Christmas/Yule music for 12th Night or Wassail. Public domain music, handout provided, no charge. This class is a repeat from Pennsic 42 and 43.

name: Stick Weaving
description_book: Stick weaving is a simple, weft-based weaving method.
description_web: Stick weaving is a simple, weft-based weaving method. Great for making belts and straps. Upgradable to make everything from shawls to rugs. Sticks and string provided; take your work home with you.

name: How to Demonstrate Blacksmithing
description_book: A discussion for advanced to beginners on how to demonstrate blacksmithing in front of a crowd. Tips and tricks for a successful demo.
description_web: Discussion for advanced to beginners on how to do a successful demo. Tips and tricks on how to and not to make a fool of yourself for an entertaining and educational demonstration of blacksmithing.

name: Weed Walk
description_book: Wild plant identification. Wear walking shoes and hat; leave from Univ. Point. Different teachers on different days; walk with us more than once!
description_web: Cooper's Lake abounds with medicinal and food plants that were used by various primitive and medieval cultures. Learn to identify them during a walk around the campsite. The walk will take place rain or shine. Please wear sturdy shoes and a hat. Meet at University Point for the start of the class. We have three wonderful new teachers this year, enabling us to offer this class more times!

name: Silk Road Dance 101: Intro to Belly Dance
description_book: Part lecture, part dance class. All levels of ability welcome.
description_web: Part lecture, part dance class. Christy Fricks of *Sulukule* introduces you to the cultural historical background of the dance we call belly dance and teach you some of the basic movements you need to begin confidently belly dancing around the campfire. All levels of ability welcome.

name: Set-up: Performing Arts Tent
description_book: Set-up in Performing Arts Tent: stage decks and tops, stage back drop, curtains, backstage area, signs, lights, and other PA properties.
description_web: On Tuesday and Wednesday of Land Grab Week, we build the stage, hang curtains, rig the house and backstage lights, and set up the chairs. This starts at about 10 am each day and continues until we are done. Come help us make the tent into a theater worthy of the name!  Bring your cordless drills and other hand tools. On Tuesday we also set up the Amphitheater and the Performing Arts Rehearsal Tent.

name: How to Draw Manuscript Flora
description_book: If you passed kindergarten art class, you can draw a 14th-century French scroll.
description_web: If you passed kindergarten art class, you can draw a 14th-century French scroll. This class will break down the elements and have you leaving confident and ready to illuminate.

name: Juggling 201 (Intermediate)
description_book: Intermediate 3-ball juggling: going beyond the simple cascade. We will touch briefly on 4 and 5 balls as well.
description_web: Intermediate 3-ball juggling. Learn several basic tricks, such as crosses, snatches, and reverse cascade. We may work our way into basic 2-, 4-, and 5-ball juggling as they apply. Juggling balls will be available for use and purchase.

name: Game of Thrones: The Bayeux Tapestry
description_book: Discussion of the history and construction of the Bayeux Tapestry, followed by hands-on practice in the Bayeux techniques.
description_web: A discussion of the history and creation of the Bayeux Tapestry as well as a hands-on session where students will learn and practice the various stitches found in the Bayeux Tapestry. Hands-on session will be limited to 15 participants; however, the remainder of the class is open to any wishing to attend.
fee_itemization: Handout, embroidery hoop, needles, needle threader, wool embroidery floss.

name: Heraldry Design Basics
description_book: What better way to get your device submission in shape for Herald's Point, than by learning about heraldry design basics.
description_web: What better way to get your device submission in shape for Herald's Point, than by learning about heraldry design basics. This class will include an introduction to device design, based on the SCA rules of Heraldry. Some one-on-one assistance will be provided.

name: Beginner Knitting
description_book: Learn how to cast on, knit, purl, and cast off. Feel free to bring your own needles and yarn.

name: Beekeeping 101
description_book: So you want to start keeping bees. We've been through it and will tell you what to do, what not to do, and give you a few hard won tips.
description_web: So you want to start keeping bees. We've been through it and will tell you what to do, what not to do, and give you a few hard won tips.We will have equipment (but no bees) for you to play.

name: Pennsic Homes, Part 1 - Wagon Homes
description_book: Period carts and wagons, what adaptations work to make it a Pennsic camping/storage wagon. Includes some of my available resources.
description_web: A discussion of period carts and wagons, what adaptations work to make it a Pennsic camping/storage wagon. Includes some of my available resources. Also, why these are *not* necessarily 'Gypsy' wagons. There are many different uses, from kitchens or showers to sleeping to 'gracious living'. Also, various building materials that work or don't work, etc. A look at my wagons and some of my neighbors after the class, and a map of others who are willing to let you look.
fee_itemization: for a CD of the material

name: All About Branles
description_book: For those who have some orientation to Arbeau's branles, we'll be going over as much information about as many branles as we can get to in one class.
description_web: For those who have some orientation to Arbeau's branles, we'll be going over as much information about as many branles as we can get to in one class.

name: Introduction to Spinning *Poi*
description_book: Learn some of the basic *poi* movements and terminology necessary to get you started.
description_web: In this one-hour workshop, you will learn some of the basic *poi* movements and terminology necessary to get you started. *Poi* spinning is a great low-impact workout that will help you to improve your coordination and give your fitness routine some "flare"! $20 Material Fee includes your choice of Home of Poi - Sock Poi and a storage pouch. Handout with class review & contacts. Refreshments are also served.
fee_itemization: $20.00 Material Fee covers handout, poi, and refreshments

name: Fundamentals of Voice Production
description_book: Learn the basics of vocal technique. This is an active, participatory class for those who have never had a voice lesson.
description_web: Learn the basics of vocal technique. This is an active, participatory class for those who have never had a voice lesson. Those who can stand comfortably will be asked to do so for much of the class, but all the activities can be adapted to a seated position.

name: Enameling for Saxons
description_book: A persona-focused introduction to the technical and artistic aspects of the Anglo-Saxon-style enameling. Will have finished item.
description_web: A persona-focused introduction to the technical and artistic aspects of the Anglo-Saxon-style of enameling. If you have wire working tools, please bring them along. Will have finished item. Maximum of six participants.

name: Introduction to Monumental Brasses
description_book: An introduction to monumental brasses which will cover history of brasses, art and craftsmanship, types, historic workshops, evolution, rubbings.
description_web: An introduction to monumental brasses which will cover history of brasses, art and craftsmanship, types, historic workshops, evolution, rubbings.

name: Help Me, Tempus, You’re My Only Hope!
description_book: Two hours with Tempus, anything sewing. Trouble-shooting, problem-solving, garb problems diagnosed and solutions proffered. Maybe learn to sew...
description_web:
(Garb Troubleshooting/Q&A Workshop)
This is a trouble-shooting and problem-solving class; garb problems diagnosed and solutions proffered. Bring to the class garb that went “wrong” or garb that didn’t “work” for you. We'll talk; it can be fixed. If you don’t have the garb here, bring your questions; we’ll do our best to solve your garb troubles. We’ll talk about gussets and how to use your seam ripper, too. This class can go on longer if needed. Also, this class will be offered next year.

name: Researching on the Internet
description_book: How to use the Internet to find reliable, accurate information. If there is time we will try to solve individual research issues for the students.
description_web: How to use the Internet to find reliable, accurate information. If there is time, we will try to solve individual research issues for the students. Hints about how to use this info for documentation. Includes a handout of recommended URLs and techniques for locating more.

name: Henna 101
description_book: A hands-on beginner look at henna history, application, and design. Participants will receive an instructional handout and henna cone.
description_web: A hands-on beginner look at henna history, application, and design. Participants will receive an instructional handout and henna cone.

instructor: Mistress Arwen Evaine ferch Rhys ap Gwy
name: Traditional Norwegian Brewing
description_book: Ale and beer...the joy of life! We will trace the evolution and brewing techniques used in rural Norway from the earliest records. Recipes included.
description_web: Ale and beer: the joy of life! If one has bread, one also has beer, rich in vitamin B. We will explore the entire process from malting the grain to taking the first sip. Recipes, folklore, the tools used, brewing charms, and more will also be presented.

name: English Country Dance from the West
description_book: Come learn *Jack O'Lent*, an interesting, complex, and unusual English Country Dance for sets of three couples! *Stingo* will be added if time.
description_web: Come learn *Jack O'Lent*, a fun, complex, and *decidedly* non-typical English Country Dance for sets of three couples! *Stingo*, which is a little more typical but only so much so with a crazy fun last verse, will be added if time allows. This is an advanced class.

name: Tinsmithing
description_book: A basic but complete course in the fundamentals of tinsmithing. Students will make a glass-globed hurricane lamp, with hand tools.
description_web: A basic but complete course in the fundamentals of tinsmithing. Students will make a glass-globed hurricane lamp, with hand tools.
fee_itemization: Includes materials for project and handouts.

name: Intro to Egyptian-Style Group Improvisation
description_book: Learn Tribal Odyssey: Egyptian-based improvisational tribal-style with *beledi*-style combinations.
description_web: Rajni is a Certified Level 1 Tribal Odyssey dance leader, a group improvisational style developed by Kawakib of Fredericksburg, VA. In the words of Kawakib: “Tribal Odyssey uses natural posture and both sides of the body in combinations based primarily on Egyptian *beledi*-style movement. It's versatile enough to adapt to any size group.” Class will repeat to allow for several days of practice with a group, and will incorporate recorded Middle Eastern drumming as well as live music/ drumming as available. Learn moves that you and your dance friends can use at Pennsic haflas this year!

name: Mass Project
description_book: Hands-on look into the Mass as a musical form and its importance in Renaissance vocal music. Each day we'll study and rehearse a different movement.
description_web:
Hands-on look into the Mass as a musical form and its importance in Renaissance vocal music. Each day we'll study and rehearse a different movement, starting with early period *Kyrie* and ending with a mid-15th-century *Agnus Dei*. While no performance has been scheduled, it won't be ruled out. These sessions are sponsored by the Known World Choir.  
(Rehearsal Tent unless noted: 7/29@12pm; 7/30@5pm; 7/31@5pm; 8/2@2pm(*AMPI); 8/3@5pm)

name: Mixing Paints for Scribes: Shading and Highlights
description_book: An overview of basic color theory with a step-by-step process for mixing and applying gouache to show dimension using shadows and highlights.
description_web:
An overview of basic color theory with a step-by-step process for mixing and applying gouache to show dimension using shadows and highlights. This class is designed to help those scribes who may not have taken basic art classes and who seek to understand how light affects the way colors are interpreted by our eyes.
Paint and mixing tools provided, bring your own brushes, I will have a small number on hand to borrow.

name: Scribal Playtime
description_book: Open space for scribes/artists to work on projects, ask questions or discuss their art. Some community-shared materials may be available for use.
description_web: The Æthelmearc Scribal College pavilion will be open for scribes to work on projects, ask questions of experienced scribes or discuss their art. One-on-one instruction may be available if space and resources allow. Some community-shared materials such as Paint-a-Blanks may be available.

name: Throw Away Your Wristwatch: Basic and Advanced
description_book: Period methods of timekeeping. First 10 minutes teaches several ways to tell time. Last 40 minutes teaches you how to tell time anywhere, anytime.
description_web: Learn period methods of timekeeping to tell time day and night at Pennsic. Basic course (first 10 minutes) teaches several ways to tell time. Advanced course delves into the science and teaches more ways to tell time so you can tell time anywhere, anytime.

name: Intermediate Heraldic Research Roundtable
description_book: Take your heraldic research to the next level, or come to share your favorite sources and tricks. Intended for heralds of all levels.
description_web: Where do you go when the usual sources just don't have what you need? Have skills you'd like to pass on to newer heralds? Come share your favorite sources and research tips in a roundtable format. Intended for heralds of all experience levels. Handout provided.

name: Fun with Body Parts I: Relics
description_book: Miscellaneous body parts more precious than jewels? An irreverent look at the cult of the saints.
description_web: Miscellaneous body parts more precious than jewels? An irreverent look at the cult of the saints, a phenomenon which led to an international business in bones, daring thefts and major con jobs.

name: Use of Basic Silversmithing Tools
description_book: Silversmithing on a budget. Survey and demonstration of tools for use with nonferrous metals. Soldering and fusing demonstrations will be included.

name: Tarts, Shells, and a Pie from the 1549 *Banchetti*
description_book: Tart of milk, eggs, sugar and ginger, pastry shells of eggs and cheese, & a pie of marzipan, pine nuts and raisins from the 1549 Italian *Banchetti*.

name: *Chigi* Dances
description_book: Come learn dances from one of the earliest manuals of 16th-century Italian dances. All experience levels welcome.
description_web: Come learn dances from one of the earliest manuals of 16th-century Italian dances. All experience levels welcome. Possible dances: *Rose E Viole, Spagnioletta, Contra Passo*.

name: Board Games
description_book: This class will review board games previously taught and provide opportunities to practice with a knowledgeable instructor's assistance.

name: Weave and Sing
description_book: Join us for an afternoon of weaving and singing. Bring your loom and song books.
description_web: Join us for an afternoon of weaving and singing. Bring your loom and song books. Weave, sing or both.

name: The Pilgrimage Project
description_book: Learn the songs of our Pennsic Pilgrimage! Open to all! You may have heard us in past years. Take up your staff and join us. Period music provided.
description_web: For the past two years at Pennsic we have gone on Pilgrimage one afternoon of War Week, singing songs from the *Llibre Vermell of Montserrat* and the *Cantigas of Santa Maria*. Come learn these songs and consider joining us this year! All are welcome! Music provided. Date of Pilgrimage TBD, an afternoon during War Week.

name: Card-Weaving Basics
description_book: Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and, using cards, you will weave a trim strip.
description_web: Warp a loom and weave a small strap or trim piece. Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and weave a trim strip. Classroom loaner looms available or bring your own. Fee covers string and cards; take your work home with you.

name: Who Were the Cooks?
description_book: You’ve eaten food inspired by their recipes. But who were the cooks whose writings were popular in the MA?  A whirlwind tour of the culinary masters.
description_web: You’ve eaten food inspired by their recipes. Perhaps you’ve even read their cookbooks. But who were those cooks whose writings were popular in the Middle Ages? A whirlwind tour of some of those fascinating individuals!

name: Running an In-Persona and/or Authentic Encampment
description_book: An open discussion of how to run and participate in an in-persona and/or authentic encampment, for those who have done it or might like to try.
description_web: An open discussion of how to run and participate in an in-persona and/or authentic encampment, for those who have done it or might like to try.

name: Early Period Fire Starting
description_book: Introduction to basic fire starting, using flint and steel and natural items found in the local area. This is a hands-on class.
description_web: Introduction to basic fire starting using flint and steel along with natural items found in the local area. Primarily focused on Viking Era and how we can include this skill in our SCA and re-enactment settings. It will also include a history of primitive fire starting, what items were used, and how it has evolved. This is a hands-on class.

name: You Are What You Eat: Humoural Doctrine
description_book: An overview of the theory of balancing the human condition through food.
description_web: An overview of the theory of balancing the human condition through food.

name: Cordial Making: Basics
description_book: Cordials had their beginning prior to the Middle Ages. Alcohol was used to extract the flavors from herbs and spices to create treasured potions.
description_web: Cordials had their beginning prior to the Middle Ages when monks and alchemists went in search of a cure for man's many ills. They used alcohol to extract the flavors from herbs and spices. They discovered many wonderful potions treasured for their flavor. For the monks, their recipes became guarded secrets.

name: Planning a Feast
description_book: How to design a menu, figure out how much to cook, plan logistics, and everything else you need to consider to ensure a successful feast.

name: Quick and Easy Handmade Largesse
description_book: A discussion about largesse: why we should give it, why you should make it, and what options are out there. We will make a couple of examples.
description_web: A discussion about largesse: why we should give it, why you should make it, and what options are out there. We will make a couple of examples.
fee_itemization: Wire, beads, findings, ribbon, felt, thread

name: The *Draugar*: The Undead in Icelandic Sagas
description_book: The Walking Dead in the Sagas. An overview and discussion of revenants in Icelandic medieval literature.

name: Beginner Dance: Absolute Beginner A
description_book: Never danced before? This is the class for you! We’ll start from the very basics and soon you'll be on your way to the ball!
description_web: Never danced before? This is the class for you! We’ll start from the very basics and soon you'll be on your way to the ball!

name: Counted Work Not Displayed at the Met
description_book: The Metropolitan Museum has interesting embroideries rarely if ever seen by the public.
description_web: The Metropolitan Museum has interesting embroideries not displayed to the public, but I was able to photograph some, including a few reverse sides. Since the Met does not allow copies of the photos to be given out, the handout will include some charts instead. These items and fragments sometimes have interesting differences from those the public sees.

name: Telling Stories as Your Persona
description_book: How to tell stories in a way that creates the illusion of a period story being told to a period audience, along with a discussion of sources.
description_web: How to tell stories in a way that creates the illusion of a period story being told to a period audience, along with a discussion of sources.

name: Imperial Roman Hairstyling
description_book: How did the Romans do their 'dos?

name: Reinventing the Wheel
description_book: Why do we do things in the SCA the way we do them, and how could we do them differently? How can we stress the "Creative" part of our name?
description_web: Why do we do things in the SCA the way we do them, and how could we do them differently? How can we stress the "Creative" part of our name in the structure and planning of our events? Come prepared for active discussion and brainstorming!

name: Beginner Dance: 16th-Century Italian A
description_book: Never danced before? No problem! This class will start with basic steps and patterns, and then teach simple late 16th-century Italian dances.
description_web: Never danced before? No problem! This class will start with basic steps and patterns, and then teach simple late 16th-century Italian dances.

name: The First Inter-Kingdom Kite Flying
description_book: An afternoon of camaraderie and kites sponsored by the Great Dark Horde. Bring your own kite. (It doesn't have to be period.)
description_web: An afternoon of camaraderie and kites sponsored by the Great Dark Horde. Bring your own kite. (It doesn't have to be period.) The First Inter-Kingdom Kite Flying Gathering is open to everyone; however, children must be accompanied by an adult. Please keep your kite Family Friendly!

name: Bardic Coaching
description_book: Participants perform a piece of their choosing, 3 to 5 minutes long. They receive personal feedback and attention to enhance performance skills.
description_web: Participants perform a piece of their choosing, 3 to 5 minutes long. They receive personal feedback and attention to enhance performance skills. Any style of performance is acceptable.

name: The Poleax Techniques of Paulus Hector Mair
description_book: Period poleax techniques that stress using the width of the ax in both defensive and offensive fashion applicable to SCA heavy list use.
description_web: Period poleax techniques that stress using the width of the ax in both defensive and offensive fashion applicable to SCA heavy list use.

name: Make-and-Take Bog Dress
description_book: Learn some history; leave with a complete piece of lightweight garb with handmade fibulae, no sewing. Bring small pliers if you have them.
description_web: Learn some history; leave with a complete piece of lightweight garb with handmade fibulae, no sewing. Bring small pliers if you have them. Donations for materials gratefully accepted.

instructor: Lady Angharad verch Glyndwr O Llang
name: Basic Jewelry-Making, or How to Float a Pearl
description_book: Basics on design/recreation of jewelry including closures, spacing, double/triple strands, scalloping, extra adornments, fixing broken items.
description_web: Basics on design or recreation of jewelry including closures, spacing, double/triple strands, achieving scalloping, adding extra adornments, fixing a broken item, making a floating bead necklace, dropping a knot where you want it.
fee_itemization: Kit with wire, string, beads, trinkets, closures

name: Prostitution in SCA Period
description_book: History of prostitution, from the late Roman era to 1600 AD. Topics include contraception, garb, law, and the organization of brothels.
description_web: A survey of the history of prostitution, from the late Roman era to 1600 AD. We will be covering such topics as the formation of red light districts, brothel management, contraception, municipal laws, church law, and the garb and identification of a prostitute within this time period.

name: Four 15th-C Italian Dances You'll Want to Know
description_book: Covers some of the most common, yet infrequently taught, dances from 15th-century Italy: *Amoroso, Anello, Gelosia*, and *Rostiboli*.
description_web: This class will cover some of the most common, yet infrequently taught, dances from 15th-century Italy: *Amoroso, Anello, Gelosia*, and *Rostiboli*. We'll learn the basics, and then learn how to play with the stories that all of these dances tell.

name: Inkle Weaving Basics
description_book: Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and weave an inkle strip.
description_web: Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and weave an inkle strip. Classroom loaner looms available or bring your own.

name: *Niello*: The Making and Applying
description_book: *Niello* is an ancient enamel-like material, applied to silver and gold work as metal decoration.
description_web: *Niello* is an ancient enamel-like material, applied to silver and gold work as metal decoration. It is used for background and highlighting engraving work.

name: First Aid or CPR Challenges
description_book: Individuals can challenge to recertify by taking the written and physical tests. These will be ASHI challenges. Cost is $15 for card only.
description_web: Individuals can challenge to recertify by taking the written and physical tests. If the challenge is unsuccessful, the recommendation is for the full class. These will be ASHI challenges, unless other instructors can be found. Individual challenges take approximately 1 hour. Cost is $15 for card only.

name: Glass Painting
description_book: Learn "Basic Glass Painting", the same technique found to do wording and faces in churches. Also, **scribes**! Learn how to put words on glass.
description_web: Learn "Basic Glass Painting", the same technique found to do wording and faces in churches. Also, **scribes**! Learn how to put words on glass. You'll work on a small piece that will get fired onsite. If you've seen any stained glass scrolls given out in court, this is the method I use! (Scribes, please bring a nib holder.)
fee_itemization: Covers materials used and cost of printing.

name: Chainmaille for Beginners
description_book: An introduction to chainmaille. Students will learn European 4-in-1, Byzantine, and Half Persian 3-in-1.
description_web: This is a simple introduction to chainmaille. In total, there will be three weaves taught on three separate days (one weave per day). Weaves taught will be European 4-in-1, Byzantine, and Half Persian 3-in-1.

name: Stone Spinning Whorls Made with Simple Supplies
description_book: How to make a common stone spinning whorl with tools and stone available at hardware stores. It's easy, inexpensive and period!
description_web: The most common 11th-14th-century Anglo-Norse spindle whorls were made of various types of soft stone with a tapered, centered hole. While stone appears intimidating to work with, choosing the correct stone makes it fairly simple to do. This class will reveal the secrets to making stone whorls with standard hardware store stone and tools! As a spindle spinner, making your own whorls allows you to produce various weights and sizes.

name: Glass Fusing for Total Beginners
description_book: An intro to glass fusing, including some vocabulary associated with the art. Students will assemble a small piece to be fused on site.
description_web: This class, which covers introductory glass fusing, is very, very basic. It is geared toward total beginners with no glass experience. Students will learn basic terminology as well as assemble a small piece to be fused on site. If you are taking the Stained Glass Track, the piece you make in this class can be included in your final piece!

name: Bedtime Stories for Children
description_book: Nightly telling of stories for children.
description_web: 7 pm nightly: Stories and fables for children. All are welcome to attend; must have adult escort.

name: Carving Your Own Spindle Stick
description_book: How to carve a medieval spindle stick: 'belly',  tapered bottom, spindle top designs. **Demo only!** Learn how to size spindle to fit a whorl.
description_web: Demo and lecture on carving a wooden medieval spindle stick with simple tools.   In period, at least half of spindle sticks found have been hand-carved, not lathe-turned. You'll learn how to assess straight grain in wood, the best method of using a carving knife, alternative methods using a draw shave or spokeshave.  Difference between 'round' wood, riven wood and sawn lumber. How to choose a store-bought dowel and avoid the bad ones. Different weights of spindle sticks and their spinning properties with size of yarns made. Choose designs for top and bottoms of spindle sticks.

name: Open Dancing
description_book: Join us all evening for dancing by request.

location: Denys the Decadent (Denys the Decadent's Camp)
name: 12-Step Meetings
description_book: 12-step meeting open to all recovery programs. AA, NA, OA, GA, SA, Alanon, etc.
description_web: Open meeting; all are welcome. 12-step meeting open to all recovery programs: AA, NA, OA, GA, SA, Alanon, etc.

name: *Études* 1 and 2 for Single Sword (Fencing)
description_book: For all levels and teachers. Drills focus on form, balance, movement and coordination. *Études* for drill; elements from drill used to work in groups.
description_web: For beginner and intermediate fencers and those who teach them. These drills will focus on form, balance, movement and coordination. *Étude*1 (first week) is more linear; *Étude* 2 (second week) adds off line/lateral movement. Emphasis will be on learning the *études* for home drill, as well as taking elements out of the drill for more focused work in groups.

name: Youth Combat
description_book: Morning Youth Combat Session
description_web: Morning Youth Combat Session

name: Period Sauces and Mustards
description_book: Creation of period sauces and mustards.

name: Wireworkers Day
description_book: Wire weaving, bead wrapping and more.
description_web: Wire weaving, bead wrapping and more.

name: Leatherwork Day
description_book: A chance for leather workers of all skill levels to meet, share knowledge and work on projects as well as for novices to learn and ask questions.
description_web: Leatherwork Day is a place for leather workers of all skill levels to meet and share knowledge and work on projects, as well as a great learning opportunity for novices. Stop by any time to look around, ask questions, or just hang out and work on your own projects. We plan on being there from 9 to 5.

name: Japanese Archery
description_book: A historical prospective on Japanese archery.
description_web: A historical prospective on the history of archery in Japan. Will discuss the history and equipment.

name: Glass Cutting (and Basic Design)
description_book: Learn to cut glass or improve your technique as well as glass design basics. This is **required** for the Stained Glass Track. Wear closed-toed shoes!
description_web: You can't design a stained glass piece until you know how glass "thinks". So whether or not you have glass cutting experience, you can further your skills by taking this class!  And wear closed-toed shoes, please. This is a rolling-style class, meaning it **will not** take every person 1.5 hours, but as there are only 2 of us, and we have limited cutters and tools, each person will get about 10 minutes of one-on-one time to learn how to cut glass. This class is **required** for the Stained Glass Track being offered this year.
fee_itemization: Offsets the glass cut up during class.

name: So... You Want to Be Mayor?
description_book: In-depth discussion of the requirements, needs, and time commitment for the  position of Mayor of Pennsic War.

name: The Way of Saint James: Pilgrims to Santiago
description_book: We will examine the legends, history, battles, miracles, and lore of Spain's *Camino de Santiago*, in period and today, taught by former pilgrims.
description_web: We will examine the legends, history, and lore of the *Camino de Santiago*, with special emphasis on the nature of medieval pilgrimage, sites of special historic, religious, and cultural importance along the route, plus advice for planning and completing the pilgrimage today. Taught by former pilgrims. ¡Buen camino!
