name: Beginner Dance: Branles B
description_book: Never danced before? No problem! Start with basic steps and patterns, and then learn fun branles from 16th-century France.
description_web: Never danced before? No problem! This class will start with basic steps and patterns, and then introduce you to fun branles from 16th-century France.

name: Pennsic Children's Choir: Open Rehearsal
description_book: Pennsic Children's Choir is open to children up to age 11 who love to sing. We will be performing as part of the Thursday Known World Choirs Concert.
description_web: The Pennsic Children's Choir is open to children up to age 11 who love to sing. We will be performing as part of the Known World Choirs Concert on Thursday evening of War Week. (Dress rehearsal Thursday afternoon, 8/7, in the PAT; details TBA during regular rehearsals.) More information can be found here: https://sites.google.com/site/kwcpennsicchoir/home/pennsic-choir/pennsic-children-s-choir

name: PA Afternoon Series: European Music Exhibition
description_book: Come experience the history of composers and variety of music from the 11th-16th centuries. Bring your voices, instruments, and play along!
description_web: Come and enjoy an afternoon of European music. Experience the history of composers and a variety of instruments and vocal music from the 11th-16th centuries. Bring your voices, instruments, and play along!

name: Inkle Weaving Basics
description_book: Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and weave an inkle strip.
description_web: Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and weave an inkle strip. Classroom loaner looms available or bring your own.

name: Practice Safe Bardic Safe Practice
description_book: Bardic Safe Zone!  For first timers, rusty returners, nervous performers, and all seeking to enjoy a low-key bardic circle as performer or audience.
description_web:
(Formally known as "The Peerless Bardic Circle - the Tradition Continues")  Bardic Safe Zone!  Welcome, first timers, rusty returners, nervous performers, and all seeking to enjoy a un-intimidating, low-key bardic circle as performer or audience! We invite all those new and exploring the bardic arts: singers, songwriters, poets, storytellers of all levels including apprentices, journeymen; and also anyone who may want to come listen and enjoy the gathering in the shade of the park. No judging rubrics; a few Peers have been known to sneak in, in disguise. If you want to learn more about bardic circles and what they're all about, come to Lucia's "Bardic Circles 101" class in AS9, Saturday, 8/1, at 11 am.
Hosted by THL Lucia Elena Braganza at Runestone Park.

name: Basic *Ka-Kha-Ga-Gha*
description_book: Written forms, pronunciations, and usage of *Devanagari* script used by Hindi, Sanskrit and other Indic languages.
description_web:
Written forms, pronunciations, and usage of *Devanagari* script used by Hindi and other North Indian languages. While the focus of this class is on Hindi usage, the characters and pronunciation are nearly identical for others. There will be examples in Hindi.
1st hour: Basic characters and pronunciation.
2nd hour: Vowels and half-letters; more if time and student interest allow.

name: Scribal Playtime
description_book: Open space for scribes/artists to work on projects, ask questions or discuss their art. Some community-shared materials may be available for use.
description_web: The Æthelmearc Scribal College pavilion will be open for scribes to work on projects, ask questions of experienced scribes or discuss their art. One-on-one instruction may be available if space and resources allow. Some community-shared materials such as Paint-a-Blanks may be available.

name: Eight Essential Knots for the SCA Camper
description_book: Hands-on class on how to tie eight basic and important knots that can make your camping life easier and safer.
description_web: Hands-on class on how to tie eight basic and important knots that can make your camping life easier and safer.

name: BYOB Rapier Spear Construction
description_book: Learn how to build a rapier spear using your pre-existing rapier blade. Class size is not limited, but there will be a limit of 5 rapier spears built.
description_web: Learn how to build a rapier spear using your pre-existing rapier blade. Class size is not limited, but there will be a limit of 5 rapier spears built. If you wish to have a rapier spear built, please show up to the class with a rapier blade that is at least 36 inches or longer that has a metric 6 mm thread on the tang.
fee_itemization:
Poplar dowel rod	$7.00
1.25 End Cap	$9.00
M6 threaded insert	$2.00
1/4-20 brass insert	$2.00
1/4-20 grub screw	$2.00
1.5 aluminum tubing	$8.00

name: Period Islamic Cooking
description_book: A description of a wide range of recipes from period Islamic cookbooks, along with a discussion of the available sources.
description_web: A description of a wide range of recipes from period Islamic cookbooks, along with a discussion of the available sources.

name: Heels and Toes: Knit Stockings in Period
description_book: Knit stockings do exist in period in Europe and the Middle East. We'll review examples and discuss some unique heel and toe shapings. Bring knitting!

name: Introduction to Beginning Period Cookery
description_book: Want to cook in period but don’t know where to start? No problem! For beginners who want a quick intro to some basics of modern period cookery.
description_web: Want to cook in period, but don’t know where to start? Your apartment doesn't have a handy open fireplace? No idea what an *eyroun* is or where to buy one?  No problem! This class is designed for those beginners who have never cooked a period recipe before but want a quick introduction into some of the basics of modern period cookery.

name: Cold Water Dyeing
description_book: A hands-on beginning dye class. Experiment with three period dyes and several mordants. Modern safety precautions will be followed.
description_web: A hands-on beginning dye class, where we will experiment with three period dyes and several mordants. Madder and walnut will be two of the dyes used. We will go over fiber preparation, mordants and a little bit of history on the three dyes. I recommend wearing older clothing.
fee_itemization: Wool yarn for embroidery; dye and mordant; handout

name: Some Simple Period Sauces
description_book: There will be a tasting of various sauces, and a hands-on demonstration on how to make a simple sauce.
description_web: A brief class on the theory and practice of making and using medieval sauces, with particular emphasis on the vinegar- and breadcrumb-based sauces. There will be a tasting of various sauces, and a hands-on demonstration on how to make a simple sauce.

name: Beginner Dance: Pavan and Galliard
description_book: All beginner dancers welcome! Learn skills for improvised 16th-century Italians. (Jumping optional!)
description_web: All beginner dancers welcome! Learn how to walk (and jump!) with style and rhythm; then use these skills for improvised dances of the 16th century.

name: Introduction to *Go*
description_book: A basic introduction to the Japanese game of *Go*.
description_web: A basic introduction to the Japanese game of *Go*.

name: Pennsic Archery Champions Practice/Tryouts
description_book: All archers wishing to make the Pennsic Archery Champions Teams should attend these practices.
description_web: All archers wishing to be on the Pennsic Archery Champions Teams should attend these practices. See either the East Kingdom Captain General or the Midrealm Archer General for more details.

name: Advanced *Repoussé* and Chasing
description_book: Intro to pitch block working and forming, plus tool and hammer use. Produce a copper letter amulet.
description_web: Intro to pitch block working and forming, plus tool and hammer use. Produce a copper letter amulet.

name: A Brief History of the Hammered Dulcimer
description_book: An introduction to the dulcimer with a little hands-on activity if time allows.
description_web: A brief introduction to the hammered dulcimer from its origins to its final fade from grace in the eyes of the nobility. There will be hands-on activity if time allows.

name: Afternoon Youth Combat
description_book: Afternoon Youth Combat
description_web: Afternoon Youth Combat

name: *Mira Calligraphiae Monumenta*: A Masterful Model
description_book: An overview of this virtuoso model book of calligraphy, written in 1561-62 by one Renaissance master and illuminated 30 years later by another.
description_web: Calligraphers gush when describing this virtuoso model book of calligraphy, written in 1561-62 by one Renaissance master and illuminated 30 years later by another. Find out why it’s so amazing and what it offers SCA scribes.

name: Developing Your Japanese Persona
description_book: Designed to take an individual through the process of building and fully developing any Japanese persona.
description_web: Designed to take an individual through the process of building and fully developing any Japanese persona. Focuses on thinking through back story to add realism to one's SCA identity. Good for newcomers and old hands alike.

name: Spined Thread-Wrapped Buttons
description_book: Participants will make their own button, made of a wooden core and wrapped in thread.
description_web: Buttons made of a wooden core, wrapped in silk thread, have been identified in 16th-century clothing across a variety of regions, including Italy, England, Turkey and Persia. These buttons are seen in clothing of both sexes, and are evident on (though not exclusive to) sleeves, doublet fronts, overgowns and sweet bags. Attendees will be taught to make their own button with materials provided.

name: Are You Wearing a Tablecloth? Greek Clothing!
description_book: Learn how to create Greek garb easily, accurately, and with style! Meet Greek style, form, and ideals for the easiest garb ever!
description_web: We all deal with hot weather in the summer. Learn how to do so easily, accurately, and with style! We will cover basic Greek style, form, and ideals, then go into fabrics, colors, trims, and accessories to create a great classical and cool look.

name: Stitches from Altenburg
description_book: *Opus Teutonicum* embroidery. Discussion, project using stitches found on extant textiles (*Altenburg an der Lahn* Convent). All skill levels welcome.
description_web: A brief overview of five extant textiles from *Altenburg an der Lahn* Convent.  Looking at German linen on linen white work embroidery, its techniques and uses.  Followed by a hands-on tutorial and take-home project using chain and interwoven herringbone stitches.
fee_itemization: kit with take home project - linen cloth, thread and needles for a project utilizing the stitches learned in class.

name: Create Reproduction Artifacts from Wire
description_book:
Demonstration of techniques using basic tools to create historic wire-based
clothing accessories: hook and eye, eyelet rings, pins.
description_web:
Demonstration of techniques using basic tools to create historic wire-based
clothing accessories: hook and eye, eyelet rings, pins.

name: Designing and Building a Pavilion
description_book: An overview of pavilion styles, followed by detailed discussions of design considerations for several different styles.
description_web: This class will present an overview of medieval and Renaissance tent and pavilion styles, based on what we see in period portraits and in a few surviving examples. The presenters will discuss their experience in building a variety of pavilions. After the class period, students are welcome to visit several pavilions on-site to continue discussion of design details and challenges.

name: Armored Rose: Field Class
description_book: On-the-field class teaching techniques from the Armored Rose lecture. Bring sword and shield. No armor needed. Covers stance and power generation.
description_web: Based on the book, "The Armored Rose", by Duchess Elina of Beckenham, OL, OP, OR, KSCA. The class covers the physical differences between men and women and how these impact fighting, and how to make the most of them. Best taken in conjunction with the lecture course, this is a physical demonstration where students and teachers will try out the techniques covered in the lecture.

name: Easy ECD for All Experience Levels
description_book: Not only a beginner class, this is for anyone who would like to learn more in depth. Includes *Gathering Peascods, Half Hannikin, Sellenger's Round.*
description_web: Not only a beginner class, this is for anyone who would like to learn English Country Dance as reconstructed directly from Playford, and not necessarily as done in current tradition. Includes *Gathering Peascods, Half Hannikin, Sellenger's Round.*

name: Tarl's Little Pole-Arm Tourney
description_book: Welcome to the 10th anniversary of the Little Pole-Arm Tourney! Tourney is open to all authorized fighters, using Pennsic-legal pole-arms only.
description_web: Welcome to the Tarl's Little Pole-Arm Tourney, 10th Anniversary Edition! Hard to believe all the fun started a decade ago! The tourney is open to all authorized fighters of any skill level. Beginners and Old Hands alike are encouraged to come and celebrate the joy and fun that is The One True Weapons Form! Pole-arms must conform to Pennsic weapon standards. The tourney is fought in a bear-pit format with multiple lists to maximize the fun. There will be two 45-minute sessions, with a small break in between. So grab a pole-arm or three and fight for Honor and Fun!

name: Pennsic Youth Choir: Open Rehearsal
description_book: The Pennsic Youth Choir is open to ages 12 - 18 to learn period vocal music and performing as part of the Known World Choirs Concert.
description_web: The Pennsic Youth Choir Choir is open to youth ages 12 - 18 who enjoy learning and singing period vocal music *a cappella*. We will be performing as part of the Known World Choirs Concert on Thursday evening of War Week. (Dress rehearsal Thursday afternoon, 8/7, in the PAT; details TBA during regular rehearsals.) More information can be found here:  https://sites.google.com/site/kwcpennsicchoir/home/pennsic-choir/pennsic-youth-choir

name: Tarl's Little Pole-Arm Tourney
description_book: Welcome to the 10th anniversary of the Little Pole-Arm Tourney! Tourney is open to all authorized fighters, using Pennsic-legal pole-arms only.
description_web: Welcome to the Tarl's Little Pole-Arm Tourney, 10th Anniversary Edition! Hard to believe all the fun started a decade ago! The tourney is open to all authorized fighters of any skill level. Beginners and Old Hands alike are encouraged to come and celebrate the joy and fun that is The One True Weapons Form! Pole-arms must conform to Pennsic weapon standards. The tourney is fought in a bear-pit format with multiple lists to maximize the fun. There will be two 45-minute sessions, with a small break in between. So grab a pole-arm or three and fight for Honor and Fun!

name: Pennsic Party University
description_book: Here several seasoned instructors wish to make sure you have the best bog and swamp party etiquette around. We want you safe, happy and respectful!
description_web: This class is to attempt to show newcomers (to Pennsic, or the bog/swamp) how to deal with nightlife in the louder parts of Pennsic. We call this a primer for the lake after dark. We'll cover various topics, including Open Bar Etiquette; Visiting Other Camps; Tipping; Romance, Courting, and Your Significant Other; Chaperoning; Party Safety; **Hydrate**!; Love Your Feet; and How to Play the Game.

name: Open Stage Shakespeare Night On The Green
description_book: Welcome back Open Stage Shakespeare night! Bring your favorite Shakespeare work to share while you enjoy an evening *al fresco* with The Bard!
description_web: Pennsic Performing Arts bids you welcome back Open Stage Shakespeare night! This year on the green of the Amphitheater all are welcome to bring a favorite Shakespeare sonnet or two, monologue under 5 minutes, or short scene (under 10 min.) to perform. Sign in with the hosts night of the show. Come enjoy an evening *al fresco* in company with the Bard!

name: The Elizabethan Stage Jig
description_book: We will discuss the Stage Jig: short comic drama that featured music and singing, and often included dancing. We will read and discuss an example.
description_web: At the end of the sixteenth century, audience members at the Globe Theater (or one of the other London theaters) might be treated to a Stage Jig after watching a play. A Stage Jig was a short comic drama that featured music and singing, and often included dancing. The jigs were often bawdy and farcical, and might be libelous as well. This class will discuss the Stage Jig and we will read an example of one from the period. At the end of the class, we will explore the possibilities for performing Stage Jigs in the SCA.

name: First Aid or CPR Challenges
description_book: Individuals can challenge to recertify by taking the written and physical tests. These will be ASHI challenges. Cost is $15 for card only.
description_web: Individuals can challenge to recertify by taking the written and physical tests. If the challenge is unsuccessful, the recommendation is for the full class. These will be ASHI challenges, unless other instructors can be found. Individual challenges take approximately 1 hour. Cost is $15 for card only.

name: Tri-Kingdom Bardic Showcase
description_book: This is the yearly Bardic Showcase.This year it includes East, Æthelmearc and Midrealm. Six performers from each kingdom will perform.
description_web: This is the yearly Bardic Showcase. This year it includes East, Æthelmearc and Midrealm. Six performers from each kingdom will perform.

name: Introduction to Runes
description_book: Introduction to the *Futharc* and *Futhorc* runes for use in divination and magic (and *RúnValdr* q.v.) with resources for further study.
description_web: Runes are a system of writing that is now best known as a tool for divination, but has been more, from basic communication to magickal practice. This workshop will give an overview of what the runes have been and can be, and give you direction on how to proceed in your studies.

name: Bedtime Stories for Children
description_book: Nightly telling of stories for children.
description_web: 7 pm nightly: Stories and fables for children. All are welcome to attend; must have adult escort.

name: Open Dancing
description_book: Join us all evening for dancing by request.

name: *i Verdi Confusi*
description_book: Players' Patchwork returns with hilarious antics of *Commedia all'Improvviso*! Of Course! It All Makes Sense Now!
description_web: Players' Patchwork returns with hilarious antics of *Commedia all'Improvviso*! Of Course! It All Makes Sense Now! **Show contains adult-themed content**.

name: Bellatrix: Individual Session
description_book: Individuals or small groups with Duke Paul, covering any martial topic. **Contact Duke Paul** at paul@bellatrix.org **to schedule** date/time.
description_web: **Time/date not firm.** One to two hours with Duke Paul for individuals or small groups, covering any martial topic. **Contact Duke Paul** at paul@bellatrix.org to **schedule actual date/time**.

name: Yoga for Dancers, Fighters, or Pretty Much Anyone
description_book: Yoga to help us through the rigors of war--regardless of our activities. Please bring a mat or towel and dress for modesty.
description_web: Yoga to help us through the rigors of war--regardless of our activities. Please bring a mat or towel and dress for modesty. Children may attend with a parent/guardian if they both participate.

location: Denys the Decadent (Denys the Decadent's Camp)
name: 12-Step Meetings
description_book: 12-step meeting open to all recovery programs. AA, NA, OA, GA, SA, Alanon, etc.
description_web: Open meeting; all are welcome. 12-step meeting open to all recovery programs: AA, NA, OA, GA, SA, Alanon, etc.

name: Rehearsal (Closed): KWP
description_book: Space in use.
description_web: Space in use.

name: *Commedia dell'Arte* for Youth
description_book: Hands-on class giving the description and history of *Commedia*, before having the youth create and eventually perform their own skit. Ages 13-17.

name: Populace Archery War Point Practice
description_book: Come to the Archery Range; practice the War Point shoots from 9-11 am during War Week except for Wednesday, August 5.
description_web: All archers can come to the Archery Range and practice the War Point shoots from 9 am to 11 am during War Week except Wednesday, August 5th, when the range is closed except for Archery Champions.

name: Enameled Jewelry Day
description_book: All day hands-on demo of both period and out-of-period methods of creating enameled jewelry for beginners, and a few tricks for more advanced student.
description_web: This will be an all day hands-on demo of both period and out-of-period methods of creating enameled jewelry. Will be covering methods for the absolute beginner plus a few tricks for the intermediate level student. Material cost of $8.

name: Beautiful Neckline Finishing
description_book: Hands-on class. Learn how to finish a neckline based on extant examples from the 13th century. Technique uses a bias-cut strip.
description_web: Hands-on class. Learn how to finish a neckline based on extant examples from the 13th century. Technique uses a bias-cut strip and makes a beautifully finished neckline. If you have needle, thread and scissors, please bring them. If there is time remaining, we will also go over a seam finishing technique.

name: Quick and Easy Handmade Largesse
description_book: A discussion about largesse: why we should give it, why you should make it, and what options are out there. We will make a couple of examples.
description_web: A discussion about largesse: why we should give it, why you should make it, and what options are out there. We will make a couple of examples.
fee_itemization: Wire, beads, findings, ribbon, felt, thread

name: Dots
description_book: Intermediate bead-making class. Come learn all the fun things you can do with dots!

name: The Humoral Doctrine
description_book: An explanation of the origins and structure of the prevailing doctrine of health in the medieval and Renaissance period.

name: Wool Spinning on Many Distaffs: Hands-On
description_book: Learn the use of the iconic distaff. Distaffs are not just for flax! Learn how to prepare wool to spin and mount it on various styles of distaffs.
description_web:
Learn the use of the iconic distaff. Distaffs are not just for flax! To a spinster, a distaff functions as a third hand, holding a large quantity of fiber in orderly condition as she pulls down fiber to fill her spindle. Come and learn about several types of distaff designs and how to mount wool prepared in various ways on them. Great for hot, sticky or windy weather. Keep the wool on the distaff, not on you!!!! Spinsters often find the evenness of their yarn improves when mounted on a distaff.  And if you walk around a lot…. 'porting your distaff with spindle tucked into the cross lacing is so easy. Improve your Pennsic spinning experience. Loaner spindles and distaffs are available for students who don't wish to purchase them.

I have just produced some YouTube videos on Medieval Spinning that you might enjoy before coming to Pennsic, but not required! http://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLjUCUOUGq_WC-sv2N_qfIhpJDi8LbR-9U, or just search YouTube for "missingspindle". Discussion of medieval spinning info is on my blog here: "missingspindle.blogspot.com"

name: Medieval-Style Mustards
description_book: Learn to make your own mustard using period ingredients and methods.
description_web: Mustard was the main condiment of the Middle Ages. Using ingredients documented for period sauces, students will blend their own mustard sauces, as well as learning about medieval/Renaissance spices and ingredients.

name: Medieval Pinwheels
description_book: Depicted in illuminations of the 15th and 16th centuries. Fun for adults and children. To make one, basic hand tool use required.
description_web: Based on illuminations, pinwheels were a common toy of the 15th and 16th centuries. We will examine the various styles of pinwheels and make one to take home. Fun for adults and children. Children should be accompanied based on their tool-using skills.

name: ASHI CPR Pro for the Professional Rescuer
description_book: Designed for individuals in the healthcare or professional rescuer field who are required to have a professional-level basic life support training.
description_web: CPR Pro for the Professional Rescuer program is designed for individuals in the healthcare or professional rescuer field who are required to have a professional-level basic life support training. Students learn how to recognize a life-threatening emergency, how to provide basic life support and what to do in case of an airway obstruction or choking. ASHI's CPR Pro for the Professional Rescuer has been approved for training for Emergency Medical Services personnel and is accepted by the National Registry of Emergency Medical Technicians (NREMT). Class length: 7 hours. Cost is $15 for card only, $20 including books.
fee_itemization: Separate fee for certification card or course materials.

name: Gathering of the Louds
description_book: Shawms, sackbuts and curtals - oh my! The traditional gathering of loud instruments for group ensemble playing continues. Not for beginners....
description_web: Shawms, sackbuts and curtals - oh my! The traditional gathering of loud instruments for group ensemble playing continues. Not for beginners.... Bring music if you have any ensemble pieces you might like to try. Bring a chair.

name: Children's Dance: More Fun Dances!
description_book: It's never too early to learn to dance! Come learn dances fun for all ages. (Any youth in attendance require a responsible adult present.)
description_web: It's never too early to learn to dance! Come learn dances fun for all ages (Any youth in attendance require a responsible adult present.) This class will teach some early and some late dances in our period, from 15th-century Italy to 17th-century English country dances.

name: Vigil (Fort - EAST TURRET)
description_book: Vigil time-slot holder.

name: St. Sebastian's V Archery Shoot
description_book: The novelty archery shoot hosted by the Kingdom of Atlantia.

name: Opening Ceremonies: In Front of Fort
description_book: Opening Ceremonies: In front of Fort or in Great Hall if raining.
description_web: Opening Ceremonies: In front of Fort or in Great Hall if raining.

name: Family Stick Weaving
description_book: Family-oriented stick weaving. Youth welcome with parent or guardian.
description_web: Family-oriented stick weaving. Youth welcome with parent or guardian. Stick weaving is a simple, weft-based weaving method. Great for making belts and straps. Upgradable to make everything from shawls to rugs. Fee covers sticks and string; take your work home with you.

name: Beginning Scribal Track
description_book: Four-day scribal arts beginner track. Topics Include layout, calligraphy and painting. Must attend all 4 days. Kit provided. No experience necessary.
description_web: If you ever wanted to try the scribal arts, now is your chance. The Scribal Beginner Track will introduce you to the tools of the trade, design elements, layout, outlining, painting and calligraphy. We'll create a scroll from beginning to end. No experience necessary and a beginner kit is included with the class cost.

name: Hard Cheese Is Easy
description_book: Most societies throughout history have found ways to turn milk into curds. This  hands-on class will help you to learn to make your own cheese.
description_web: Almost every society throughout history has developed a way to turn some kind of milk into curds. In this hands-on class we will take milk through the essential steps so you may come away with skills in place and an understanding of the cheesemaker's art so that you can continue to make your favorite cheese at home.

name: Fool School
description_book: Are you a fool or a fool wannabe? Come to Fool School to share and learn. Prepare a 5-minute skit to perform. All ages/experience levels welcome.
description_web:
Are you a fool or a fool wannabe? Come to Fool School to share and learn. Fools/performers of all types and experience levels are welcome. Jugglers, magicians, singers, freaks and geeks. Get help creating or honing a skit of no more than 5 minutes to perform in the Amphitheater Wednesday 8/6 6-7 pm.
You might even become a “Licensed Fool.” Performing is not mandatory.

name: How Not to Make a 14th-Century Dress
description_book: Learn about some common mistakes in making a 14th-century fitted dress, and how to avoid them.
description_web: Learn about some common mistakes in making a 14th-century fitted dress, and how to avoid them. Students are invited to contribute stories and suggestions from their own experience as well.

name: Medieval Business Practices
description_book: Explore how modern accounting practices evolved following the changes in business during the Middle Ages and Renaissance.
description_web: The most basic accounting techniques used by businesses worldwide today had their start in 12th- and 13th-century Europe, and continued being refined throughout the Renaissance. This class teaches about the sweeping changes in trade that made this evolution necessary...and also changed the face of Europe.

name: Roman Wire and Bead Jewelry
description_book: Examine Roman jewelry artifacts that can be recreated by using simple materials and tools.
description_web: Examine Roman jewelry artifacts that can be recreated by using simple materials and tools. Kits and handouts available. Students encouraged to bring needle-nose pliers and wire cutters.

name: Two Partners Are Better Than One!
description_book: A few of the 15th-century Italian dances for three people: *Belfiore, Gioioso in Tre*, and *Vita di Cholino*.
description_web: Three is my favorite number, and several of my favorite dances are for three people! Come learn 15th-century Italian dances for three: *Belfiore, Gioioso in Tre*, and *Vita di Cholino*. All steps will be taught, and these dances are fairly easy to learn.

name: Period Card Games: *Losing Loadem*
description_book: Do you like to play cards? Come learn to play this late-period, trick-avoidance card game.
description_web: Looking for something to pass the time at events? Do you like to play cards? Come learn to play this late-period card game based on a reconstruction from Francis Willughby’s A Volume of Plaies (~1665).

name: Armoured Champions: Unbelt, Belt, Matched, Century
description_book: The order is Unbelts, Belts, Matched, and then Century Champions.
description_web:
Armored Champions Battles: Unbelt/Belted/Matched/Century
10:00am Unbelted: 40 vs. 40 to the last fighter
11:00am Belted: 30 vs.30 to the last fighter. Crowns may not fight. Heirs may.
12:00pm Matched: 30 fighters, may not have participated in either the Belted or Unbelted Champions Battles. Alternating sides choose the number to send out from 1-5; opposing side must match. Crowns may not fight. Heirs may.
1:00pm Century: Format as traditional Allied Champions’ battle.  
100-foot by 200-foot field with 30-foot “resurrection boxes” in opposite corners.
45-minute, timed-release resurrection battle. Clock stops for medical holds only. Clock does **not** stop for flag reset. Flags and flag staves to be provided by Principal Kingdoms. Staves must be made of rattan or fiberglass. Flags **must** be held over the head during transportation to the base for the point to be valid.  *This battle is made up of the fighters from the previous three battles of the day.* Fighters are allowed to be replaced during the battle, but once out, they may not return.
• Resurrections are every 2 minutes.

name: Storytelling Academy
description_book: Explore genres, tools, styles, and uses of storytelling. Cultural and medieval approaches, applications, performance coaching. New topics each day.
description_web: During this nine-day academy, students will gain knowledge about the history and techniques for storytelling both in the SCA and the modern world. Students may attend individual sessions or all of the academy. There will be guest teachers and time for students to practice and receive feedback. The academy will culminate in a student performance. No classes are repeated. The focus is on comfort, nurturing, and honing skills within the students’ capabilities. All levels are welcome. Students may pick up a class outline at the academy space, Minerva’s Spindle 158, where classes will also be listed on the message board. Seating is limited; feel free to bring your own chair.

name: Pennsic Choir: Open Rehearsal
description_book: The Pennsic Choir welcomes all interested singers! Songs in honor of the 500th anniversary of the Coronation of François I of France.
description_web: The Pennsic Choir welcomes all interested singers! This year's concert features songs of the early to mid-16th century in honor of the 500th anniversary of the Coronation of François I of France. Singing in the Pennsic Choir is an intense and rewarding experience. We rehearse two hours each day for a week, then perform a concert on Thursday evening of War Week. The ability to read music and sight-sing is helpful, but not required if you learn the music in advance. Sheet music and audio tracks are available online now at https://sites.google.com/site/kwcpennsicchoir/home/pennsic-choir/pennsicxliiichoirs

name: Rapier Bear Pit Tourney
description_book: A no-frills classic bear pit. Three passes, winner stays, three fights maximum. Everyone welcome. Fight until you drop. Lots of prizes!
description_web: Nothing fancy here: a classic bear bit tourney. Three passes, winner stays, three fights maximum. Every skill level welcome. Bring your best, and fight until you can't fight any more. Prize for 1st, 2nd, and 3rd place. If you've ever felt like you didn't get enough fencing in at Pennsic, here's your answer.

name: Weed Walk
description_book: Wild plant identification. Wear walking shoes and hat; leave from Univ. Point. Different teachers on different days; walk with us more than once!
description_web: Cooper's Lake abounds with medicinal and food plants that were used by various primitive and medieval cultures. Learn to identify them during a walk around the campsite. The walk will take place rain or shine. Please wear sturdy shoes and a hat. Meet at University Point for the start of the class. We have three wonderful new teachers this year, enabling us to offer this class more times!

name: The Minimalist Bard Book
description_book: Discussion of the top 20 songs/song types for any bard's book.
description_web: Discussion of the top 20 songs/song types for any bard's book. Whether you are around a campfire, performing for royalty, joining in a competition, or singing in the shower, these few pieces will have you ready for anything, bardically speaking.

name: Beginning Drumming
description_book: The basic rhythms used most often in drum circles and music within the SCA. A 4-part class that teaches different rhythms each day. BYO drum.
description_web:
Learn the basic rhythms used most often in drum circles and music within the SCA. This is a 4-part class that teaches different rhythms each day. BYO Drum.
Day 1- *Saidi, Beladi, Maqsum*
Day 2- *Chiftitelli, Masmoudi*
Day 3- *Ayub, Malfouf*
Day 4- *Kashlimah* and other strange stuff

name: Rehearsal (Closed): Pennsic *Commedia* All Stars
description_book: Space in use.
description_web: Space in use.

name: Archery Populace War Point
description_book: Archery Populace War Point
description_web: All archers young and old are encouraged to come and lend their support to their kingdom's efforts, and to display their skill at archery. There will be three challenging populace shoots to test skills. Each Kingdom will be competing to earn the three War Points for each shoot.

name: The Minister of the Lists Survival Kit
description_book: Tournament formats, creating and stocking your bag of tricks, the importance of communication, preparation tips and more.
description_web: Tournament formats, creating and stocking your bag of tricks, the importance of communication, preparation tips and more. Come share your knowledge and experience with other List Ministers from all Kingdoms.

name: Beginning Glass Bead Making
description_book: Join us to learn how to make glass beads. This class is a hands-on, beginning course.
description_web: Join us to learn how to make glass beads using a hot head propane fueled torch. We will discuss how these beads were made in period and their significance. This is a hands-on class and all materials and equipment will be provided for use during this class. Required: hair pulled back; closed toe shoes; clothing appropriate for working with a flame, i.e., no hanging sleeves or bodice parts.

name: Basic 14th-Century Tablet-Woven Edge
description_book: How to work a basic tablet-woven braid directly onto a garment edge (gown center-front, buttoned sleeve, side of pouch, etc.).
description_web: One method of finishing edges, particularly load-bearing ones, in the 14th century was to tablet-weave a cord and sew it onto the piece as you worked. This sounds far more intimidating than it really is, even if you haven't picked up a set of tablets heretofore. There will be hands-on kits for 10 attendees; spectators are welcome.

name: How to Run a Successful Event
description_book: Want to be an event steward? Want to be a better event steward? This class covers all aspects of running a new or an old event!
description_web: Whether you are brand new to running SCA events, or have already run a variety of events, this class will help you plan more effectively to make your event a success and keep you from losing your mind! Topics that will be discussed will including budgets, staffing, sites, and Royalty, as well creating a Vision for your event, and creating meaningful and exciting activities.

name: Divination: Palm and Face Reading
description_book: Divination based on examination of the human body, especially via palmistry and the asian art of face reading.
description_web: Divination based on examination of signs on the human body, especially via palmistry and the asian art of face reading. To reduce the instructor’s out-of-pocket expenses, all students are requested to bring at least one hand and one face to class.

name: Gruit in Late-Period English Ale
description_book: Learn how the English flavored beer before hops became widely accepted.
description_web: Before hops became popular in England, ale was flavored with proprietary blends of herbs, spices, or weeds. We will investigate some of the more common blends in use from the 14th through 16th century in the British Isles. Some tasting of gruit ales may be available.

name: Harp Techniques
description_book: Historical info and techniques: Improve strength, speed, tone, musicality. Useful for all harpers, beginner to advanced. Chairs may not be available
description_web: Techniques to improve strength, speed, tone and musicality. Historical information about harps, the men and women who played them, and their music. Useful for all harpers, complete beginner to advanced. Learn how to get more out of your instrument and practice time, as well as practical approaches to performing. This is one of a 3-part course. We will build on information from each class, but students are not required to attend all three. Feel free to contact teacher in advance if you know you'll miss one. Chairs may not be available. Please bring chairs/harpstands if possible.
fee_itemization: Exercises for use in class, during Pennsic, and afterward. Reading music, counting, fingering, etc.

name: Introduction to Pavan and Galliard
description_book: Suitable for beginners, this class offers a walk-through of the pavan and galliard, two improvisational dances from the 16th century.
description_web: Suitable for beginners, this class offers a walk-through of the pavan and galliard, two improvisational dances from the 16th century. The pavan is extremely low-impact, but the galliard can rather unforgiving on one's knees and ankles. It can be modified somewhat to reduce impact, however. Please consider wearing close-fitting shoes, such as turn shoes, jazz oxfords, Keds, or ballet slippers, as tennis shoes or boots will impede movement. (In a pinch, you could go barefoot or in socks, but you'll want to be careful of splinters on the wood floor.)

name: Arts and Sciences Display
description_book: Sunday, August 2nd, 1:00 - 6:00 pm.
description_web:
Sunday, August 2nd
Artisans Set up: 12:30 pm - 1:00 pm
A&S Display: 1:00 - 6:00 pm
(Take down after 6:00 pm.)
Come and be part of the awesome display of craftsmanship from the Known World!
Pennsic 44 brings the 18th annual display of the talents and knowledge of the Known World's Artisans and Craftspeople. The variety and scope of work are always a wondrous spectacle of artistic talents and scientific skills. 

The display is not a competition. Bring your completed items, works-in-progress, research, and discussion material so that you may share, inspire, and enrich our Society. See what others in your field are working on, discover a new passion, make new contacts, and most importantly, have fun! 

I look forward to seeing you and your works. 

Lady Adele Lochlane
A&S Display Coordinator

name: Lucet Basics
description_book: Make a square cord and a two-color cord.
description_web: Make a square cord and a two-color cord. Classroom loaner lucets available or bring your own. No fee. String provided.

name: Intro to 6-on-2 Chainmail
description_book: This type of chainmail was prevalent in period across multiple cultures. All materials provided but bring two pairs of pliers.
description_web: Intro class for 6-on-2 chainmail prevalent throughout period across multiple cultures. All materials necessary to complete class project provided but bring two pairs of standard box nose pliers if you have them. Tools are available for those who don't have them on a first-come first-served basis.
fee_itemization: Sufficient hand-turned & cut aluminum rings, 12ga 5/8 in diameter, to complete class project.

name: The Battle of Bannockburn, June 23 and 24, 1314
description_book: What were the reasons behind the battle? Who were the principle protagonists? What really occurred, and what was the aftermath?

name: Hair Braiding I
description_book: Hair braiding for beginners: simple three-strand braid and French braid. Bring someone to braid their hair and a brush.
description_web: Hair braiding for beginners: simple three-strand braid and French braid. Bring someone to braid their hair and a brush. Limit 10 participants. Longer lengths encouraged. If there is enough interest, I will think about doing Hair Braiding II in the future!

name: Ministerials: AoA for Service
description_book: The ministerials were Holy Roman folks who got and held arms by virtue of their usefulness as administrators. Learn more about these overlooked folks.
description_web: Many assume that one received and held noble rank because of their use in war, or for holding lands. Not necessarily true! The ministerials were Holy Roman folks who got and held arms by virtue of their usefulness as administrators of empires, duchies and all. Learn more about these overlooked folks and how a non-combatant SCAdian can be just as fitting and proper as a noble as any fighter.
fee_itemization: One handout of notes plus bibliography

name: Wire-Wrapped Jewelry
description_book: Learn the basics of wire-wrapped jewelry and make a bracelet or medallion hanger. Bring tools and materials if you have them.
description_web: Learn the basics of wire-wrapped jewelry and make a bracelet or medallion hanger. Please bring tools, wire and beads if you have them. There will be some tools available to borrow and some to purchase at cost.

name: Bardic 101 (So I Want to Be a Bard, Um, What Next)
description_book: Some advice on getting started as a bard, from basic information to performance tips, and how to find pieces to perform.

name: Richard III, Death and  Discovery
description_book: In 2012 the mortal remains of King Richard III were discovered under a car park in Leicester. This is about his death, discovery and re-interment .
description_web: Return of the King. In 2012 the mortal remains of the last warrior King of England to die in battle were discovered under a car park in Leicester. This is about the king's death, discovery and re-interment .

name: Brewing Sugars: Simple and Complex
description_book: A brief discussion of the various sugars available to the brewer, how they react with yeast, and what characteristics they impart.
description_web: This is a discussion of simple sugars, starches, and fibers that the average brewer may encounter in the development of recipes and the preparation of ingredients. We will look at conversion of starches to fermentable sugars, how yeast breaks down sugars during fermentation, and some techniques for use of different sugar compounds. Note that the instructor is **not** a scientist, but some limited science is inevitable.

name: Divination: Omens, Portents, Astrology
description_book: Divination using omens, signs, and portents found in nature, with emphasis on the queen of the divinatory arts: astrology.
description_web: Divination using omens, signs, and portents found in nature, with emphasis on the queen of the divinatory arts: astrology.

name: Newcomers' Tent
description_book: So, you're new to the SCA? What do you do? Where do you go? Stop in here at the Newcomer's Tent! We have answers and are here to help!
description_web: So, you're new to the SCA? What do you do? Where do you go? Stop in here at the Newcomers' Tent! We have answers and are here to help! Come meet with newcomer guides from around the Knowne World and learn about the endless possibilities.

name: 15th-Century Italian Dance Beginner: Part 1
description_book: No experience necessary. Dances will include *Anello, Amoroso, Petit Riens, Rostiboli*.

name: Beginning *Repoussé* and Chasing
description_book: Hands-on class; will make a copper foil rose.
description_web: Hands-on class; will make a copper foil rose.

instructor: Viscountess Kamiilah al Sudanii um Zoom
name: Beginning Middle Eastern Dance
description_book: Covering the basic movements that this lovely art form is based on, including drills! Intermediate and Advanced welcome. I'll make it harder for you!
description_web: Covering the basic movements that this lovely art form is based on, including drills! Intermediate and Advanced welcome. Kamiilah will add layers and make it harder for you!

name: Rehearsal (Closed-PAT): *i Sebastiani*
description_book: Space in use.
description_web: Space in use.

name: A Blacksmith's Double Chamber Bellows
description_book: A display of the inner workings of a two-chamber blacksmith's bellows, including the valves and how they are made.
description_web: A display of the inner workings of a two-chamber blacksmith's bellows, including the valves and how they are made. Will also have descriptions of how the skin is attached and pattern-making of the whole process.

name: Making Your Own Soapstone Glass Molds
description_book: Join us to learn to make and use soapstone molds for your glass working. Advanced glass working methods required.
description_web: In period, people could not order cool glass molds or tools from the local Internet website. Instead, they made their own. Come and learn how to make and use your own soapstone glass molds! This class is recommended for those already comfortable with basic beadmaking.

name: Sing We And Chant It: Madrigal and *A Capella* Jam
description_book: Meet-and-greet optional practice session for audience participation, "Sing We and Chant It" Madrigal and *A Capella* Jam.
description_web:
Meet-and-greet optional practice session for audience participation, "Sing We and Chant It V", Madrigal, Part Song, and A Capella Jam, Monday, 8/4, at 6:00 pm in the Performing Arts Tent. All are welcome to come and make joyful music! Music will be available to share, or bring your own! (Material fee optional for a folder of this year's jam music)
Hosts:  THL Lorelei Skye, Mistress Gianetta Andreini da Vicenza, Professor Pieter van Doorn
2015 current song list available here - please let us know if you have any suggestions to add to the mix!
https://docs.google.com/document/d/1N-pkg9zLigl06DTqzfQ9EM-7dZeALQl-oGxgSWDIL6s/edit?usp=sharing
fee_itemization: Photocopy fee for public domain music handouts.

name: Creating a Sampler of Medieval Pigments
description_book: Create your own sampler using historical pigments.
description_web: Create your own sampler using historical pigments.

name: Juggling 101 (Beginner)
description_book: Learn to juggle three balls in the simplest pattern. Equipment available for use or purchase.
description_web: The most basic 3-ball cascade juggling. Juggling balls will be made available for use by the class and may be bought afterward from the instructor.

name: Beginning Bobbin Lace
description_book: A 3-part class teaching basic stitches as well as how to prepare bobbins, start and end a project, and construct a pillow. Please attend all sessions.
description_web: A 3-part class teaching basic stitches as well as how to prepare bobbins, start and end a project, and construct a pillow. We will start (and hopefully finish!?!) a bookmark. Please plan to attend all 3 sessions. Material fee will include a lace making pillow, bobbins, pins, thread, and pattern.
fee_itemization: bobbin lace pillow, bobbins, thread, pins, pattern

name: Helping at Herald's Point: Not Just for Heralds!
description_book: We need more help at Herald's Point than just Heralds! We need artists, exchequers, colorists, etc. We have ice cream and phone chargers!
description_web: We need more help at Herald's Point than just Heralds! We need artists, exchequers, colorists, etc. We have ice cream and phone chargers! Possible tour of Herald's Point at the end of class depending on weather conditions.

name: Hand-Tied Pearl Necklaces
description_book: Have you often admired the necklaces of pearls and gemstones worn in the portraits? Come learn about these necklaces and make your own.
description_web: Have you often admired the necklaces of pearls and gemstones worn in the portraits of the nobility and royalty? Come learn about these necklaces and make your own. This technique creates a durable and elegant necklace and adds that finishing touch to your finest garb.

instructor: Master Dani of the Seven Wells
name: The Heavy Plow
description_book: History teachers say that the invention of the heavy plow was significant in European history but seldom go into details. This class does.
description_web: History teachers say that the invention of the heavy plow was significant in European history, but seldom go into details. This class does. How was it different and how did it make a difference - and how did it mold medieval society?

name: Retaining Teenagers
description_book: Known World Survey results of teenagers and what it takes to retain them. Will cover a wide range of concerns and topics.

name: The Art of Making the Medieval Bed
description_book: Coverlets, foot sheets--how do these items make a proper medieval bed? This class will examine the pieces and let you practice on a scale model.

name: Throw Away Your Wristwatch: Basic and Advanced
description_book: Period methods of timekeeping. First 10 minutes teaches several ways to tell time. Last 40 minutes teaches you how to tell time anywhere, anytime.
description_web: Learn period methods of timekeeping to tell time day and night at Pennsic. Basic course (first 10 minutes) teaches several ways to tell time. Advanced course delves into the science and teaches more ways to tell time so you can tell time anywhere, anytime.

name: Women, Music and Dance in *Commedia* Scenarios
description_book: Analyze *Commedia dell'Arte* in scope with other performing arts of the Renaissance such as courtly dance, theater, and bardic arts.
description_web: Have you ever wondered how *Commedia dell'Arte* influenced other performing arts of the Renaissance? Caroso, an Italian dance master, and other artisans alluded to *Commedia dell'Arte*. This class will feature related research and roundtable discussion about *Commedia dell'Arte* in scope with other performing arts of the Renaissance. New material has been added to the class based on analysis of the book, "Music and Women of the *Commedia dell'Arte* in the Late Sixteenth Century" by Anne MacNeil.

name: History of Drinking: Common Medieval Drinks
description_book: History of drinks, how they affected society and culture. Includes samples and recipes of common drinks found in the Middle Age and SCA. Over 21 only.
description_web: A look at the history of drinks, especially those in the between 3rd-16th centuries and how they affected society and culture. Class will include samples (and recipes) of the most common drinks found in the Middle Ages (and in the SCA). No instruction on brewing provided. Over 21 only.

name: Viking Civil Engineering: Theory and Practicum
description_book: A survey of large-scale archaeological features in the Viking landscape. Learn about their metrology, and survey for a scale circular fortress.
description_web: A survey of large-scale archaeological features in the Viking Age landscape of Scandinavian-controlled areas. First hour is lecture: Learn about evidence for metrology, and construction of defensive barriers, canals, bridges, and fortifications. Second hour is hands-on, with surveying exercise on laying out a scale version of a circular fortress.

name: The Cornett and the Serpent: Renaissance Brass?
description_book: Made of wood, played with a brass-type mouth piece and fingered like a recorder. A hands-on discussion about the cornett and serpent.
description_web: Once a favorite of composers and now obscure, the cornett is a musical instrument with a trumpet-type mouth piece that is made of wood and fingered like a recorder. The larger serpent, which filled the need for a bass instrument, is a late-period ancestor of the modern tuba. Are they brass or woodwind? Join in for a hands-on discussion about these instruments, information on where to buy, and how to play. Several instruments will be available to try. Bring a chair.

name: 15th-Century Italian Dance Beginner: Part 2
description_book: No experience necessary. Dances to include *Petit Rose, Belfiore, Ballo del Fiore, Marchesana*.

name: *Xiang-qi* for Beginners (Chinese Chess)
description_book: A 90-minute class in how to play *Xiang-qi* (Chinese Chess). History, rules, strategy and tactics; enough time left for students to play afterwards.
description_web: A 90-minute class in how to play *Xiang-qi* (Chinese Chess). History, rules, strategy and tactics; enough time left for students to play afterwards.

name: *Kumihimo* Basics
description_book: *Kumihimo*: cord braiding on a disk.
description_web: Kumihimo: cord braiding on a disk. Make a basic round cord. Disk and string provided; take your work home with you.

name: Beginning Engraving
description_book: Hands-on class. Intro to tools, first cuts, graver control, hammer use.
description_web: Hands-on class. Intro to tools, first cuts, graver control. Student will learn both hand-held and hammer-struck engraving.

name: Beginning Celtic Knotwork
description_book: Using 5-dot technique, students will be able to create knotwork. We'll look at examples and see patterns used. You get handout, pencils, graph paper.

name: The Pierogi
description_book: Open discussion on some origin theories, history of and recipe versions of the pierogi (Polish dumpling).
description_web: Open discussion on some origin theories, history of and recipe versions of the pierogi (Polish dumpling). It's a standard Polish food deeply rooted in the culture of Poland and its proud people.

name: Mass Project
description_book: Hands-on look into the Mass as a musical form and its importance in Renaissance vocal music. Each day we'll study and rehearse a different movement.
description_web:
Hands-on look into the Mass as a musical form and its importance in Renaissance vocal music. Each day we'll study and rehearse a different movement, starting with early period *Kyrie* and ending with a mid-15th-century *Agnus Dei*. While no performance has been scheduled, it won't be ruled out. These sessions are sponsored by the Known World Choir.  
(Rehearsal Tent unless noted: 7/29@12pm; 7/30@5pm; 7/31@5pm; 8/2@2pm(*AMPI); 8/3@5pm)

name: Temple Rings and Tortoise Shell Brooches
description_book: Did the Norse and Slavic people hang out in the Viking Era? Come find out more. Extant examples from recent digs to be discussed.
description_web: Come learn about the differences, similarities and cross cultural instances between the Norse (Viking) cultures, the Western Russian Slavic Tribes and what later became the Rus, focusing on the 8-10th centuries. Extant examples (male and female) from many recent archaeological digs will be discussed.

name: Silversmithing
description_book: Students will make a pendant using cabochon semi-precious stones, sterling silver sheet and wire. Techniques include forming, hard soldering, finish.
description_web: Students will make a pendant using cabochon semi-precious stones which would have been available in period, and sterling silver sheet and wire. The processes include forming, silver soldering, and finishing and bezel setting
fee_itemization: Stones, silver sheet, bezel wire, loop wire, sol and custom cut stones (all vary in price by piece) but an average of $40 for all combined.

name: Norse Maternity and Nursing Garb
description_book: Discussion of how to deal with pregnancy and nursing garb issues in period clothing. Ideas based on period finds.

name: History and Symbolism of the Unicorn Tapestries
description_book: An examination of "The Hunt for the Unicorn", 15th-century Flemish tapestries widely regarded as the best example of tapestries of the age.
description_web: Join us for an examination of "The Hunt for the Unicorn", 15th-century Flemish tapestries widely regarded as the best example of tapestries of the age. Why does the unicorn lack ears in one tapestry? What happened to the pieces of the fifth tapestry? Where are they now? All these and more will be answered.
fee_itemization: Full color, line drawing and plant key copies of all the tapestries with corresponding plants highlighted.

name: Garbing a Gentlewoman: 16th-C Florentine Fashion
description_book: Introduction to 16th-C fashion in Florence, Italy. A review of the garments that make up a well-dressed lady's wardrobe, with pointers to get started.
description_web: An introduction to 16th-century upper class fashion in Florence, Italy. We will review the garments that make up a well-dressed lady's wardrobe, as well as discuss sources of information for patterning and sewing your own. Handouts will include images of extant garments, paintings, and reproductions.

name: Scandalously Practical: Italian Drawers
description_book: A delicate conversation about an indelicate subject: underwear. We'll discuss the origins of the garment, references in period and construction.
description_web: A delicate conversation about an indelicate subject: underwear. Several pairs of Renaissance Italian "trousers" are found in museums around the world. We'll discuss the origins of the garment, plus references in period and construction techniques using both period and modern patterning.

name: Norse Poetry Overview
description_book: Talk like Egil Skalagrimson! We will go over rhythm and alliteration, how to write in Norse verse. We'll talk about the ways poetry was used.
description_web: Iambic pentameter got you down? Want to know what exactly a “ring giver” is? Do you want to write a line that ends with "silver?" Are you a fan of Egil Skalagrimson (who isn't?)? Come on over, and we’ll go over the basics of Viking poetry. I will explain how Norse poetry alliterates, talk about the types and ways Norse poetry was used, and go over poetic devices such as *kennings*. We'll then discuss style and format, and the specific forms Norse poetry takes. Whether you want to try your hand at writing it, or just want a better appreciation of the form, stop by!

name: Geometric Garment Construction
description_book: We'll discuss how clothing can be constructed from simple geometric shapes, based on extant garments from various parts of SCA period.
description_web: This class will discuss how clothing can be constructed from simple geometric shapes, based on extant garments from various parts of SCA period. Strategies for fitting and sizing to the individual will be discussed.

name: Historic Rapier Roundtable
description_book: A roundtable discussion on ideas, pitfalls, issues, and other topics surrounding the use of period rapier manuals in SCA rapier and C&T.

name: Newcomers' Social
description_book: New to the SCA? Come join us for some light refreshments and get to know our Chatelaines and other newcomers in this casual venue.
description_web: New to the SCA? Is this one of your first events? Come join us for some light refreshments and get to know our Chatelaines and other newcomers in this casual venue.

name: Intro to Traditional Filipino Martial Arts
description_book: An Introduction to Filipino stick fighting patterns and concepts (including footwork, angles and distance) and their relation to SCA combat.
description_web: The Filipino martial arts go by the names *Arnis, Escrima*, and *Kali* and have a rich history. They primarily involve the use of single and double short sticks in their techniques, but concepts and skills can also be translated to knife and empty hand work. This seminar will provide an introduction to Filipino stick fighting and will give a hands-on experience in the patterns and concepts related to this art including footwork, angles, and distance while fighting. We will also relate these concepts and techniques to SCA combat (fencing and heavy list).

name: Beginner Dance: Absolute Beginner B
description_book: Never danced before? This is the class for you! We’ll start from the very basics and soon you'll be on your way to the ball!
description_web: Never danced before? This is the class for you! We’ll start from the very basics and soon you'll be on your way to the ball! No partners required.

name: KW Baronial Archery Championship Tournament
description_book: The Known World Baronial Archery Championship Tournament, hosted by the Barony of Roaring Wastes.
description_web: The Known World Baronial Archery Championship Tournament, hosted by the Barony of Roaring Wastes, Sunday, Aug 2, 2 pm to 4 pm, on the Archery Range.

name: Henna Party
description_book: Come and explore the world of henna body art! All materials and instruction are provided. Children welcome with responsible adult.
description_web: Come and explore the world of henna body art! All materials and instruction are provided. Children are welcome when accompanied by a responsible adult.
fee_itemization: Henna powder (approximately 1 kilo), mylar cone applicators, Scotch tape, packing tape, plastic baggies, lemon juice, tea tree essential oil, geranium essential oil, watercolor pencils, paper towels, cotton balls, witch hazel, bamboo skewers

name: Pennsic Children's Choir: Open Rehearsal
description_book: Pennsic Children's Choir is open to children up to age 11 who love to sing. We will be performing as part of the Thursday Known World Choirs Concert.
description_web: The Pennsic Children's Choir is open to children up to age 11 who love to sing. We will be performing as part of the Known World Choirs Concert on Thursday evening of War Week. (Dress rehearsal Thursday afternoon, 8/7, in the PAT; details TBA during regular rehearsals.) More information can be found here: https://sites.google.com/site/kwcpennsicchoir/home/pennsic-choir/pennsic-children-s-choir

name: PA Afternoon Series: *Commedia* Experience
description_book: Come experience *Commedia dell'Arte*! Meet the characters and the actors behind them and learn to act in comic masked style.
description_web: Come experience *Commedia dell'Arte*! Meet the characters and the actors behind them and learn to act in comic masked style (movement, vocalization, express funny ideas). Experienced actors/directors from several well-known *Commedia dell'Arte* troupes will guide you if you're new, or give you free advice that's definitely worth the price to veteran performers!

name: Making, Care and Feeding of Your Thrown Weapons
description_book: How to design and make basic weapons and how to keep them in good condition with a minimum of tools.
description_web: How to design and make basic weapons as well as how to keep them in good condition. This teaches more than how to make weapons pass inspection, but also how to extend their life and improve performance with a minimum of tools.

name: Using Psychographics in SCA Event Planning
description_book: A look at what psychographs are and how they can be applied to SCA event planning.
description_web: A look at what psychographs are and how they can be applied to SCA event planning.

name: Jewish Folktales
description_book: A review of Jewish folktales and motifs from Biblical times through 1600.

name: Men's Clothing in Anglo-Saxon England
description_book: A brief introduction to men's clothing in Anglo-Saxon England including period-appropriate fabrics and colours.
description_web: A brief introduction to men's clothing in Anglo-Saxon England including period-appropriate fabrics and colours.

name: Archaeological Textiles: Context and Provenance
description_book: This class will look at textiles that have been recovered from numerous archaeological excavations from around Europe and the Mid-East.
description_web: This class will look at textiles and textile production tools that been recovered from archaeological excavations, the structures and the fibers and tools used in their production. Sites include Northern Europe, British Islands, the Mediterranean and the Middle East prior to the Middle Ages.

name: Decorative Seams in Early Britain and Scandinavia
description_book: See pictorial and archaeological evidence for decorative seam finishings in early Britain and Scandinavia to discover how they were actually used.
description_web: You’ve seen them, you’ve loved them, but what is the actual evidence for decorative seam finishings in the early British and Scandinavian world? We will look at the pictorial and archeological evidence for seam treatments to discover how they were used and why. Please bring examples of your favorites and their sources!

name: Leadership Theory
description_book: Applying an academic leadership scale to SCA groups.
description_web: We will discuss an academic model of leadership developed for the U.S. Navy admiralty, and the implications of situational leadership styles on the speed, cost, quality, and institutional impact of decision-making processes.

name: Bardic Collegium #1: Welcome Home
description_book: Finally returned from the town run and ready to get back into the swing of all things bardic? This is our annual Meet and Greet. Come one, come all!
description_web: Finally returned from the town run and ready to get back into the swing of all things bardic? This meeting of the Collegium is for all bards and those who want to be bards - storytellers, singers, poets, all! Come to see who is here this year, meet new people, and renew old friendships, maybe even find a mentor for this War.

name: Period Drinking Songs
description_book: Sing a variety of period songs about drinking from across Europe, including easy unison and rounds, as well as harmony with up to four parts.
description_web: Learn to sing a variety of period songs about consuming alcoholic beverages from across Europe. The songs vary in difficulty from easy unison and rounds to harmony with up to four parts, so anyone can participate. Music will be available to take with you. If you have heard of the Pennsic Drinking and Singing Walk or the *Hymni Bacchi*, this is the music we sing.

name: Interkingdom Brewers Guild Competition
description_book: Brewers and vintners: Have your beverages evaluated by experts from across the Known World. Up to two entries per category. Over 21 only.
description_web: An opportunity for brewers and vintners to have their beverages evaluated by experts from across the Known World. Up to two entries per category (wine/mead, beer, cordials/others) per participant. IKBG masters are asked to help judge. Entrants are responsible for the temperature/condition of their beverage(s) as it may be some time before a particular beverage is judged. Documentation is encouraged. Over 21 only.

name: Interkingdom Brewers Guild Roundtable
description_book: This roundtable is designed to serve as both a place to discuss period beverages as well as hang out for the IKBG. Over 21, please.
description_web: This roundtable is designed to serve as both a place to discuss period beverages as well as hang out until your beverage is called to be judged with the IKBG. It is being held in conjunction with the IKBG. All entrants are asked to wait in this area. Someone will come call you when your entry is ready to be judged. Please bring something to do/drink/discuss until your entry is called. Over 21 only.

name: Leaves of Laughter: Comic Theatre Workshop
description_book: A participatory workshop introducing late-medieval improvisational Japanese comic theatre. We'll script short plays for performance later in the week.
description_web: A participatory workshop introducing late-medieval improvisational Japanese comic theatre. Participants will be introduced to stock characters, theatrical devices, and comic theory. We will read several play synopses and script a short play for performance later in the week.

name: Beginner Dance: English Country B
description_book: Easy English Country Dances for two or three couples. No partner required; all steps will be taught.

name: Known World Novice Championship
description_book: Fighters from all over the Known World, with 2 years or less experience since their primary authorization, test their skills against each other.

name: Known World Baronial Archer Champions Tourney
description_book: Calling all baronial archer champions to join us for a friendly competition. Bring a small patch representing your barony (1.5-2" dia.).
description_web:
Calling all baronial archer champions to join us for our Second Annual Known World Baronial Archer Champions Shoot-Off. This is a friendly competition among all current baronial archer champions. Open to Shire, Canton, Riding, Marche champions, as well.

No pre-registration is required. 

Participants, please bring a small patch representing your barony (1.5-2" diameter) to donate toward the prize.

Note: We will also be doing a tournament for all youth baronial champions at the same time, so please encourage your youth champions to come out. Same request: Please bring a small patch representing your barony to use toward the prize.

name: Happy Japanese Games
description_book: Leisure games of Japan will be discussed. Reproductions of each game will be available to play for the duration of class.
description_web: Leisure games of Japan will be discussed. Reproductions of each game will be available to play for the duration of class. May not be appropriate for small children; some game pieces can be a choking hazard.

name: Pennsic Archery Champions Practice/Tryouts
description_book: All archers wishing to make the Pennsic Archery Champions Teams should attend these practices.
description_web: All archers wishing to be on the Pennsic Archery Champions Teams should attend these practices. See either the East Kingdom Captain General or the Midrealm Archer General for more details.

name: Advanced Engraving
description_book: The continuation of the work begun in the beginning class. Hand-engraving on copper plate. Letters and design work.
description_web: The continuation of the work begun in the beginning class. Hand-engraving on copper plate. Letters and design work.

name: Folk Tunes of the Elizabethan Era
description_book: Learn to sing some broadside ballads and tunes collected by Thomas Ravenscroft.
description_web: Learn to sing some Elizabethan music, including various broadside ballads and tunes collected by Thomas Ravenscroft, the first collector and publisher of folk music.

name: Beyond Lucet Basics
description_book: Variations, loops, and monkey wrenches.
description_web: Starts with a basic refresher class for everyone. We then proceed to variations, loops, and monkey wrenches. Classroom loaner lucets available or bring your own. String provided.

name: "By the Book" Tournament
description_book: Historical fencing tourney. Memorize Marozzo, review Ridolfo, study Saviolo, for the third annual tournament where book worms can be winners!
description_web: A historical fencing tourney; memorize your Marozzo, review your Ridolfo and study your Saviolo, for the third annual tournament where book worms can be winners! Period fencing forms and period dress as seen in the manuals will bring you success. As always, lavish prizes will be bestowed upon the competitor with the most wins, the best dressed, and the one who best adheres to the style of a given master.

name: Afternoon Youth Combat
description_book: Afternoon Youth Combat
description_web: Afternoon Youth Combat

name: Creating a Flourished Hand by Bocskay
description_book: Recreate an ornate hand developed by Georg Bocskay based on folio 82 in the *Mira Calligraphiae Monumenta*. Students can create own examples.
description_web: Learn how to recreate a very ornate hand developed by Georg Bocskay based on folio 82 in the *Mira Calligraphiae Monumenta*. Students will have a chance to create their own examples.

name: Target Archery Marshals' Meeting
description_book: All target archery marshals should meet in the marshals' tent on the Archery Range. Repeats on Aug 2, 4 pm, for those who missed Friday's meeting.
description_web: There will a target archery marshals' meeting in the marshals' tent on the Archery Range on Friday, July 31, at 4 pm. There will also be an archery marshals' meeting on Sunday, August 2, at 4 pm, for all those marshals who did not or could not make the meeting on Thursday.

name: Off-Grid Solutions for Disability Support
description_book: Off-grid power solutions: class and discussion. Please bring a power adapter or clear picture. Solutions for specific needs will be created.

name: Resubs, Appeals, and Requests for Reconsideration
description_book: If your or your submitter's heraldic submission has been returned, what's the next step?
description_web: When a name or armory submission is returned, submitters have several options: resubmitting, sending an appeal, and requesting reconsideration. This class will discuss how to read and interpret a return decision, the differences between the options and when to use them, and resources that can help. In addition, we will discuss other administrative actions, such as heraldic wills, transfers, and permissions to conflict, as well as what is needed to use the grandfather clause and legal name allowance.

name: Meet-the-Dance-Faculty Social
description_book: All are invited to meet the faculty and staff who make the School of European Dance happen! There will be light refreshments and a group picture.
description_web: Everyone is invited to meet the people who make the Pennsic School of European Dance happen! This event is open for all students and dancers to meet this year's faculty and staff, and is another social event for our faculty and experienced dancers. We encourage all to attend. Light refreshments will be provided and a group picture of staff and teachers will be taken.

name: Pennsic Youth Choir: Open Rehearsal
description_book: The Pennsic Youth Choir is open to ages 12 - 18 to learn period vocal music and performing as part of the Known World Choirs Concert.
description_web: The Pennsic Youth Choir Choir is open to youth ages 12 - 18 who enjoy learning and singing period vocal music *a cappella*. We will be performing as part of the Known World Choirs Concert on Thursday evening of War Week. (Dress rehearsal Thursday afternoon, 8/7, in the PAT; details TBA during regular rehearsals.) More information can be found here:  https://sites.google.com/site/kwcpennsicchoir/home/pennsic-choir/pennsic-youth-choir

name: Rehearsal (Closed): KWC Chorulus Pennsicus
description_book: Closed Rehearsals, by Audition Only.
description_web:
Closed Rehearsals by Audition Only; FYI Only. Director, Lord Cailin mac Andreis.
Chorulus Pennsicus information available here: https://sites.google.com/site/kwcpennsicchoir/home/pennsic-choir/chorulus-pennsicus

name: Beginning *Bhangra*
description_book: This high-energy dance hails from Punjab, India. It is joyful and celebratory, and a great way to stay in shape. Also included will be meditation.

name: Mask Performance and Mumming
description_book: Brief overview of historical performances using masks, practice exercises using masks, and (weather permitting) a field trip "in character".
description_web: Masked performers appeared in a number of countries in medieval and Renaissance Europe, in mummings, masques and other performances. After an overview describing such performances, the class will practice performing in masks. (Masks will be available, or feel free to bring your own!) Weather permitting, the class will make a short field trip "in character" (wearing the masks) down a Pennsic thoroughfare.

name: Engineering the Dream: SCA Event Planning
description_book: Discussion of the nuts and bolts of event planning: site selection, budgeting, activities, schedules and staffing to help people design fun events.
description_web: Discussion of the nuts and bolts of event planning: site selection, budgeting, activities, schedules and staffing to help design fun events. Plan on 1 to 1.5 hours depending on the amount of discussion and Q&A. Master Gunnar has served as an event steward for local, kingdom and Known World events.

name: Hand-Sewing Eyelets
description_book: Take your garb up a notch! Learn to use an awl and hand-sew eyelets to finish your bodice or to make lacing points.
description_web: Take your garb up a notch! Metal grommets don't have the look and they result in less-durable clothing. Come learn how to use an awl and needle to hand-sew your own eyelets.

name: *Renga*: Linked Poetry, Part 1
description_book: Part 1: A survey on the history and creation of the traditional Japanese poetic form.
description_web: Part 1: A survey on the history and creation of the traditional Japanese poetic form.

name: SRM Moot
description_book: Roundtable discussion with the Society Rapier Marshal Master Laertes McBride
description_web: Roundtable discussion with the Society Rapier Marshal Master Laertes McBride

name: Asian Persona Tea
description_book: A meet and greet for Asian personas. Come and share your experiences and learn from one another over a cup of tea. Bring something on which to sit.

name: Recorder Jam Session
