description_web: This class traces the evolution of Jewish names from the simple names in the Bible, through the Babylonian Diaspora, the Greco-Roman and Talmudic period, and the Middle Ages (European and Arabic forms) to the modern form of Given Name and Surname. Name forms in a number of times and cultures will be discussed. The course is intended to be useful to both heralds dealing with clients and to those interested in creating their own period persona name.
fee_itemization: The fee represents the cost of printing the 18-page handout.

name: Very Basic Hand-Stitching
description_book: Learn the basic stitches and practice them in class. Please bring scissors if you have them. I will provide material to practice.
description_web: I will show some of the very basic stitches of hand-sewing: running stitch and whip stitch among others. With this, you should be able to finally start that hand-sewing project you have always dreamed about. I will provide material for up to 50 people per class to have something to practice on.

name: Nalbinding Heels
description_book: Socks are common nalbinding artifacts. Learn several variations for completing heels, regardless of the stitch you use. Must know at least one stitch.
description_web: Socks are some of the most common nalbinding artifacts. Learn several variations for completing heels, regardless of the stitch you use. Students should be comfortable with at least one stitch. Needle and yarn will be provided.

name: What Makes a God? Key Aspects in Myth
description_book: The underlying lessons of pre-Christian Norse and Irish myth are conveyed through the gods' associations and character traits.

name: The Cubic and Quartic Equations (European Version)
description_book: A look at how equations of the third and fourth degree were solved in 16th-century Italy.

instructor: Lady Angharad verch Glyndwr O Llang
name: Basic Bookbinding
description_book: Basic binding of books, history, hands-on, practical application. Learn different stitches and page attachment; leave with a small bound book.
description_web: Basic binding of books, a bit of history, hands-on, and practical application. Participants will learn different types of stitching and page attachment, plus covers, and will leave with a small bound book and/or a girdlebook cover.

name: How to Card-Weave Letters and Designs
description_book: Weave letters, numbers, designs! Bring a loom warped with 14, 22, or 42 cards, A&B in one color, C&D in a contrasting color. Observers welcome.
description_web: Learn to weave letters, numbers, or your own designs using the double-faced weaving technique! To fully participate, bring a loom warped with 14, 22, or 42 cards, A&B in one color, C&D in a contrasting color, all S or Z threaded, and shuttle in either color. Fewer cards are easier to work with and recommended for beginners. Observers welcome, or bring one loom and share with a friend. Several looms will be provided for observers to try out the technique.
fee_itemization: copying costs for 19 page color handout + 7 page pattern package

name: Make a St. Birgitta Coif
description_book: Come make a simple linen coif appropriate for all classes of women from the 13th-15th centuries. Recommended: knowledge of basic hand-sewing.

name: Known World Chirurgeonate Meeting
description_book: All past, current and future members of the Chirurgeonate are invited to meet and discuss the current status of the Chirurgeonate and forward plans.
description_web: All past, current and future members of the Chirurgeonate are invited to meet and discuss the current status of the Chirurgeonate and forward plans.

name: From Bees to Booze (Advanced)
description_book:
Mead 303: Prepare for Competition.

A hybrid Instruction/Forum format.  Not really for beginners, but open to all.
description_web: This class is meant for those wishing to produce a product for competition, whether they're going for Populace Choice, or being judged by their peers. We will cover some of the documentation required, some suggestions for aging and refining your brew and, after working through some of the basics, we'll open it up into a forum to pool and share experiences and knowledge.

name: *Fioretti, Groppi* in 6-Beat Galliard Variations
description_book: 6-beat galliard patterns (*scempie mutanze*) featuring *fioretti* and *groppi* from Compasso's 1560 work, *Ballo della Gagliarda*. Intermediate level.
description_web: We will explore 6-beat galliard patterns (*scempie mutanze*) featuring *fioretti* and *groppi* from Compasso's 1560 work, *Ballo della Gagliarda*, and a few other books. We'll review basic galliard information, but experience with 16th-century Italian is extremely helpful. Please wear close-fitting shoes, such as turn shoes, jazz oxfords, Keds, or ballet slippers, as chunky tennis shoes or boots will impede movement. (Socks or bare feet are also OK.) The class will be high-impact and aerobic.

name: Tuchux Charity Tournament
description_book: The Tuchux annual random weapon bear-pit style tournament
description_web: The Tuchux annual random weapon bear pit-style tournament. All proceeds from this year's tournament and silent auction will go to the American Kidney Fund:  www.kidneyfund.org.

name: Spinners Anonymous, a.k.a Spinning for Cat-Herders
description_book: All spinners welcome to trade tips, learn technique and practice supported and drop spinning, with stone or clay whorl spindles; child-friendly camp.
description_web: Wanted to take a spinning class, but couldn't find a sitter? Made it to that class, but want more practice with an experienced spinner? All spinners of all levels are invited to take part in this practicum on using the medieval spindle with clay or stone whorls for supported and drop spinning. Bring your own or use mine!  Spindles, whorls, wool and hand distaffs available. Cotton and flax spinning may also be discussed if there is an interest. Children are welcome to come play with mine while you play with fiber! Located in cool, shaded E-28 block.

name: Pennsic Youth Choir: Open Rehearsal
description_book: The Pennsic Youth Choir is open to ages 12 - 18 to learn period vocal music and performing as part of the Known World Choirs Concert.
description_web: The Pennsic Youth Choir Choir is open to youth ages 12 - 18 who enjoy learning and singing period vocal music *a cappella*. We will be performing as part of the Known World Choirs Concert on Thursday evening of War Week. (Dress rehearsal Thursday afternoon, 8/7, in the PAT; details TBA during regular rehearsals.) More information can be found here:  https://sites.google.com/site/kwcpennsicchoir/home/pennsic-choir/pennsic-youth-choir

name: Card-Weaving Basics
description_book: Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and, using cards, you will weave a trim strip.
description_web: Warp a loom and weave a small strap or trim piece. Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and weave a trim strip. Classroom loaner looms available or bring your own. Fee covers string and cards; take your work home with you.

name: Rehearsal (Closed): KWC Chorulus Pennsicus
description_book: Closed Rehearsals, by Audition Only.
description_web:
Closed Rehearsals by Audition Only; FYI Only. Director, Lord Cailin mac Andreis.
Chorulus Pennsicus information available here: https://sites.google.com/site/kwcpennsicchoir/home/pennsic-choir/chorulus-pennsicus

name: Very Basic Belly Dancing
description_book: We will be working on the very basics of belly dancing, no previous experience needed.

name: Klaus Störtebeker and The Victual Brotherhood
description_book: The little known story of a band of privateers who fought for freedom.

name: Introduction to Combat Archery
description_book: Learn the basics of combat archery. Covers the basics of combat archery: what equipment you need, the rules and basic tactics.
description_web: Have you ever wanted to be a part of the action on the battlefield, but didn't want to swing a sword? Have you ever wanted to shoot back at that pesky archer who keeps killing you? Give combat archery a try. The class will cover the basics of combat archery: what equipment you need, the rules, and basic tactics.

name: Arabic  101
description_book: To have knowledge on the very basic foundations of the Arabic language.

instructor: Lady Aranwen verch Rhys ap Gwalter
name: Introduction to Trade Beads.
description_book: Discussion of the creation of a trade bead, where it may have traveled, and what it may have been used for. Handout supplied.

name: *Renga*: Linked Poetry, Part 2
description_book: Part 2: A writing practicum.
description_web: Part 2: A writing practicum.

name: Olive Tasting and Discussion: 4 Medieval Cures
description_book: A tasting panel of several historic olive cures, and a discussion of many others. If you've been curing olives, bring some of your own!
description_web: A tasting panel of several historic olive cures, and a discussion of many others. If you've been curing olives, bring some of your own! We'll talk about how to use different curing methods to achieve different flavors.

location: Budgardr if they are there, otherwise Enchanted Ground.  (W09)
name: Period Portable Furniture You Can Make
description_book: Three chairs, two tables, and a bed, all based on period designs.
description_web: Three chairs, two tables, and a bed, all based on period designs. At least one chair, one table, and the bed are simple enough so that someone with only basic tools and no expertise should be able to make them.

name: Mass Project
description_book: Hands-on look into the Mass as a musical form and its importance in Renaissance vocal music. Each day we'll study and rehearse a different movement.
description_web:
Hands-on look into the Mass as a musical form and its importance in Renaissance vocal music. Each day we'll study and rehearse a different movement, starting with early period *Kyrie* and ending with a mid-15th-century *Agnus Dei*. While no performance has been scheduled, it won't be ruled out. These sessions are sponsored by the Known World Choir.  
(Rehearsal Tent unless noted: 7/29@12pm; 7/30@5pm; 7/31@5pm; 8/2@2pm(*AMPI); 8/3@5pm)

name: *Cantore Borealis*
description_book: A "pick up" choir formed during Pennsic that practices all week. Organized by Ban Ollamh Orlaith Ballach Ingen Fhlainn, OL, of Northshield.
description_web: A "pick up" choir formed during Pennsic. Ban Ollamh Orlaith Ballach Ingen Fhlainn, OL, of Northshield, organizes music, rehearsals and performers. Note: If you're interested in performing, find her in Northshield populace camping for an audition.

name: Elizabethan Pike Drill
description_book: Learn the art of pike drill from Gardiner's Company. Bring gloves and any Elizabethan armor you have. Some loaner gear may be available. All welcome.
description_web: Learn the manly art of pike drill from Gardiner's Company of the London Trayned Bandes. All are welcome. Bring gloves and any other Elizabethan armor you have.  Some loaner helms may be available. Gardiner's Company uses a modified *de Gheyn* drill. Class will be at 3 pm and **not** 5 pm.

name: The Colorful History of Japanese Tea
description_book: A brief history of tea in Japan and the quirky, opinionated, long-suffering people who transformed it: medicine to meditation, status symbol to art.

name: Viking Age Tablet Weaving: Archeological Evidence
description_book: A survey of the major finds of tablet weaving from Norse sites like Birka, Oseberg, Mammen, Elisenhof, Snartemo and Eura. 40-page handout.
description_web: A brief survey of the major finds of tablet weaving from Norse and neighboring sites, including Birka, Oseberg, Mammen, Elisenhof, Evebo, Snartemo, Eura and others. 40-page handout is available.

name: Sing We And Chant It V: Madrigal and Part-Song Jam
description_book: Come all who enjoy part-singing to sing along for an evening of madrigal, part-song, and *a capella* favorites performed by you, The Audience!
description_web:
Come one and all who enjoy madrigal and polyphony / part-singing to sing along for an evening of part-song and *a capella* favorites performed by you, The Audience! THL Lorelei Skye returns as your hostess, along with conductors Mistress Gianetta Andreini da Vicenza, Professor Pieter van Doorn, and other guests - for an evening of musical variety. Come and make joyful music, or sit and enjoy the harmony of multiple *a capella* voices!  (Some music will be available to share, or bring your own!) Optional meet-and-greet and rehearsals Friday and Sunday; look in the class listings for more information. You do not need to attend a practice to participate in the Jam.  
2015 Song List available online:  https://docs.google.com/document/d/1N-pkg9zLigl06DTqzfQ9EM-7dZeALQl-oGxgSWDIL6s/edit?usp=sharing

name: Known World Cadet Kegger
description_book: This is the party thrown by the cadets of Æthelmearc in celebration of the Children's Hospital of Pittsburgh, our annual charitable fund recipient.
description_web: Party from 7-10pm. This is the party thrown by the cadets of Æthelmearc in celebration of the Children's Hospital of Pittsburgh, our annual charitable fund recipient.

name: Efenwealt Wystle Comedy Music - Amphitheater
description_book: Can't wait for ʺWhose Line Doth it Beʺ to get your giggle-fit started? Let Efenwealt's goofy songs help you ease into the appropriate mood.
description_web: Can't wait for ʺWhose Line Doth it Beʺ to get your giggle-fit started? Let Efenwealt's goofy songs help you ease into the appropriate mood.

name: Whose Line Doth It Be? Performance in Amphitheater
description_book: The improv comedy show where anything can happen! Audience members should bring seating. Would-be contestants selected from the Audition at 4 PM.
description_web: Welcome to 'Whose Line Doth It Be?', the improv comedy show where anything can happen! Audience members should bring seating. Would-be contestants must attend the Audition at 4 pm. *Some material may be inappropriate for children under 12*.

name: The Vienna, Munich and Hallstatt Museums
description_book: This slide presentation looks at artifacts from the museums of Munich, Germany, and Vienna and Hallstatt, Austria, taken in Spring 2014.
description_web: This slide presentation looks at artifacts, mostly textiles, textile tools and jewelry from the museums in Munich, Germany, and Vienna and Hallstatt, Austria, while attending NESAT conference in 2014. Included are slides of textiles and pottery from Hallstatt dating to 700 to 1,000 BCE.

name: Stone Spinning Whorls Made with Simple Supplies
description_book: How to make a common stone spinning whorl with tools and stone available at hardware stores. It's easy, inexpensive and period!
description_web: The most common 11th-14th-century Anglo-Norse spindle whorls were made of various types of soft stone with a tapered, centered hole. While stone appears intimidating to work with, choosing the correct stone makes it fairly simple to do. This class will reveal the secrets to making stone whorls with standard hardware store stone and tools! As a spindle spinner, making your own whorls allows you to produce various weights and sizes.

name: The Poor Man's Bible
description_book: A pictorial look at how the Bible and the Roman Catholic Church influenced the making of stained glass windows during the medieval period.
description_web: Find out why stained glass windows were sometimes called the Poor Man's Bible. A pictorial look at how the Bible and the Roman Catholic Church influenced the making and evolution of stained glass windows during the medieval period. Stained glass windows were a reflection of the community and also conveyed the political, social, and religious views of the time.

name: Bedtime Stories for Children
description_book: Nightly telling of stories for children.
description_web: 7 pm nightly: Stories and fables for children. All are welcome to attend; must have adult escort.

name: *Muhekian*: The Taste of Tea
description_book: Enjoy the taste of tea under the night sky. Please wear Japanese or loose-fitting clothes with white socks or *tabi*, and bring a fan if you have one.
description_web: Enjoy the taste of tea under the night sky. Please wear Japanese or loose-fitting clothing with white socks or *tabi*, and bring a fan if you have one. Please do not wear any jewelry or weapons in the tea room.
fee_itemization: cost of tea and sweets - 12 per sitting.

name: State Dinner - Midrealm Royal (By Invitation Only)
description_book: State Dinner - Midrealm Royal (By Invitation Only)

name: Youth Combat Pole Arm Tourney
description_book: The Second Youth Combat Pole Arm Tourney! Rules will be available at the Marshals' Tent.
description_web: Second Year! Come enter the Youth Combat Pole Arm Tourney! Details and Rules will be available at the Youth Combat Marshals' Tent.

name: The Debatable Choir
description_book: The award-winning Debatable Choir presents a program of medieval and Renaissance choral music by several famed composers.
description_web: The award-winning Debatable Choir presents a program of medieval and Renaissance choral music by such famed composers as Thomas Morley, Jacobus Gallus Handl, Philippe Verdelot, Giovanni Croce, and Orlando di Lasso. Which song has lyrics written by the infamous Niccolo Machiavelli? Come to the concert to find out!

name: Carving Your Own Spindle Stick
description_book: How to carve a medieval spindle stick: 'belly',  tapered bottom, spindle top designs. **Demo only!** Learn how to size spindle to fit a whorl.
description_web: Demo and lecture on carving a wooden medieval spindle stick with simple tools.   In period, at least half of spindle sticks found have been hand-carved, not lathe-turned. You'll learn how to assess straight grain in wood, the best method of using a carving knife, alternative methods using a draw shave or spokeshave.  Difference between 'round' wood, riven wood and sawn lumber. How to choose a store-bought dowel and avoid the bad ones. Different weights of spindle sticks and their spinning properties with size of yarns made. Choose designs for top and bottoms of spindle sticks.

name: Bards in the Beehive
description_book: Period music with a twist! Like traveling musicians, bringing music from Antiquity to Elizabethan along with original works, SCA and more.
description_web: Period music with a twist!  In the spirit of the traveling musicians, we perform period music from Antiquity to Elizabethan along with SCA folk, Irish and original works.

name: Southern Elegance
description_book: The Italians, bastions of style, set the fashions of centuries of dance. Come delight in the elegance of Italian-inspired dance.

name: *i Genesii*
description_book: *i Genesii*: Love! Money! Greed! Sex! Murderation! Overwhelming beauty! Underwhelming intelligence! Terrible poetry!
description_web: Love! Money! Greed! Sex! Murderation! Overwhelming beauty! Underwhelming intelligence! Terrible poetry! All in one magnificent *Commedia dell'Arte* show, as only *i Genesii* can do! Join us for an evening of wondrous wackiness, fabulous funniness, and tenuous tastefulness! *Show Contains Adult-Themed Content*.

name: Bellatrix: Individual Session
description_book: Individuals or small groups with Duke Paul, covering any martial topic. **Contact Duke Paul** at paul@bellatrix.org **to schedule** date/time.
description_web: **Time/date not firm.** One to two hours with Duke Paul for individuals or small groups, covering any martial topic. **Contact Duke Paul** at paul@bellatrix.org to **schedule actual date/time**.

name: Bellatrix: Individual Session
description_book: Individuals or small groups with Duke Paul, covering any martial topic. **Contact Duke Paul** at paul@bellatrix.org **to schedule** date/time.
description_web: **Time/date not firm.** One to two hours with Duke Paul for individuals or small groups, covering any martial topic. **Contact Duke Paul** at paul@bellatrix.org to **schedule actual date/time**.

name: Yoga for Dancers, Fighters, or Pretty Much Anyone
description_book: Yoga to help us through the rigors of war--regardless of our activities. Please bring a mat or towel and dress for modesty.
description_web: Yoga to help us through the rigors of war--regardless of our activities. Please bring a mat or towel and dress for modesty. Children may attend with a parent/guardian if they both participate.

location: Denys the Decadent (Denys the Decadent's Camp)
name: 12-Step Meetings
description_book: 12-step meeting open to all recovery programs. AA, NA, OA, GA, SA, Alanon, etc.
description_web: Open meeting; all are welcome. 12-step meeting open to all recovery programs: AA, NA, OA, GA, SA, Alanon, etc.

name: Six Guards of *Capoferro*
description_book: A choreographed drill based on six guards of *capoferro*, intended to be broken into components focused learning. Intermediate level.
description_web: This drill is intended as a teaching tool for those students of Italian rapier and instructors. It is a wonderful way to practice muscle memory and build good habits in form and slow work.

name: Youth Combat
description_book: Morning Youth Combat Session
description_web: Morning Youth Combat Session

name: Rehearsal (Closed): KWP
description_book: Space in use.
description_web: Space in use.

name: Set-up: Amphitheater
description_book: Set-up Amphitheater: Check grounds, set up signs, pathways, and prepare space for classes and events.

name: *Commedia dell'Arte* for Youth
description_book: Hands-on class giving the description and history of *Commedia*, before having the youth create and eventually perform their own skit. Ages 13-17.

name: Populace Archery War Point Practice
description_book: Come to the Archery Range; practice the War Point shoots from 9-11 am during War Week except for Wednesday, August 5.
description_web: All archers can come to the Archery Range and practice the War Point shoots from 9 am to 11 am during War Week except Wednesday, August 5th, when the range is closed except for Archery Champions.

name: Embroidery Day
description_book: All things designed and wrought with a needle: embroidery, whitework, blackwork, tapestry, stump work and more. Displays, demonstrations and teaching.
description_web: All things designed and wrought with a needle: embroidery, whitework, blackwork, tapestry, stump work and more. Displays, demonstrations and teaching. Day organized by Lady Jaqueline de Molières.

name: Herbcraft and Apothecary Day
description_book: Spend the day making various recipes from the SCA period. Items will include cosmetics, hygiene, and household cleaning recipes.
description_web: Join us for Herbcraft and Apothecary Day on Artisan's Row this year. The plan is to spend the day making various recipes from the SCA period. Items will include cosmetics, hygiene, and household cleaning recipes.

name: Paternoster Day
description_book: Explore this interesting art. Paternosters and prayer beads exist in most cultures and yet take very different forms. See the variety and make one.

name: Beginning Kumihimo
description_book: Part 1: Learn the basics of Japanese braiding using the modern foam disk. Students will learn a round, square and flat braid.
description_web: Part 1: Learn the basics of Japanese braiding using the modern foam disk. Students will learn a round, square and flat braid. Uses for, history and names of braids will be discussed. Students may bring own equipment if desired.
fee_itemization: total class is 10.00 if just handout 3.00

name: Late Period Cross Sititch and Variations
description_book: Examines how cross stitch was used, alone and with other stitches, plus a brief look at long-armed cross and reversible cross stitch.
description_web: Examines examples of extant pieces and images, as well as how cross stitch was used, alone and with other stitches, plus a brief look at long-armed cross and reversible cross stitch.

name: Basic Knitting
description_book: For beginners or someone who needs to brush up on basic skills.
description_web: Learn to cast on, plus two stitches. Basic knit and purl will be covered. Please bring a skein of yarn, worsted weight, and a pair of needles in size 9 to 11.
fee_itemization: Fee includes handout, a skein of yarn and a pair of needles.

name: Reconstructing Archaeological Textiles
description_book: In this 2-part, hands-on class, students weave several reconstructions of textiles from archaeological context. Fee includes use of loom and yarn.
description_web: In this 2-part, hands-on class, students will weave several reconstructions of textiles from archaeological context, illustrating structure, fibers and tools used, and time involved in creating textiles prior to industrialization. Use of loom and all supplies for completing samples included in class fee.
fee_itemization: handouts, supplies for completing woven samples

name: Viking Era Wool: Its Production and Use
description_book: Learn about the evolution of wool, wool types and sheep. Participate in hands-on demos of how wool was processed and used in period.
description_web: This class will be a mix of discussion and demonstration, and will include hands-on components. Discussion will cover the evolution of wool, wool types (to aid in understanding archaeological texts) as well as sheep breeds descended from animals spread across Northern Europe by the Vikings. Following the discussion there will be a demonstration portion of the class showing how wool was processed and manufactured in the Viking age. During this time students will get to handle many different types of wool. The last hour of the class will offer the opportunity to try to comb, spin or weave fibers. There will be combs and spindles to test out different types of wool as well as a miniature warp-weighted loom for weaving.

name: Pilgrim's Bag
description_book: Thought about carrying a pilgrim's bag? Free up your hands; keep your modern items out of sight. Learn how to make a cloth or leather pilgrim's bag.
description_web: Ever thought about carrying a pilgrim's bag instead of carrying a bulky basket? You can free up your hands, and it is a great way to keep your modern items out of sight. Learn how you can make a pilgrim's bag, out of cloth or leather.

name: Round and Round It Goes
description_book: After a brief history of rounds, there is class participation singing 8-10 period and SCA filk rounds. A class handout and a music CD are available.
description_web: After a brief history of rounds sung in period, there will be class participation learning 8-10 rounds of period origin, period themes, and SCA filk. A class handout and a music CD are available.
fee_itemization: A pamphlet of lyrics and music($2), plus a CD of the melodies($2) for a total of $4 if both are purchased.

name: Viking Navigation and the Sunstone
description_book: Early navigation methods up through Viking times, plus the use of sunstones. What the History Channel's 'Vikings' series almost got right - sort of.
description_web: The methods of navigation employed by the Viking navigators are slowly being verified by archaeological evidence. However, the search for answers goes on. This class will present early navigational aids based on discussions with two of the experts in this field: Soren Thirslund's research on the 'Viking Compass' at the Danish National Maritime Museum, and Leif Karlsen's and our own research into sunstones. The published works of Thirslund and Karlsen are available from the Viking Ship Museum in Roskilde, Denmark. We provide hands-on demonstrations and primary source documentation of these authors’ navigation theories.

name: Family Felting Fun
description_book: Have fun with your kids, cool off and learn a skill. My daughters and I will help you and your kids try your hands at felting wool onto bars of soap.
description_web: Have fun with your kids, cool off and learn a skill. My daughters and I will help you and your kids try your hands at felting wool onto bars of soap. Making craft projects out of wool can be a great activity for families with kids of all ages. Felt is like the play dough of fiber arts. After you get started, the possibilities are endless.

name: Medieval Pinwheels
description_book: Depicted in illuminations of the 15th and 16th centuries. Fun for adults and children. To make one, basic hand tool use required.
description_web: Based on illuminations, pinwheels were a common toy of the 15th and 16th centuries. We will examine the various styles of pinwheels and make one to take home. Fun for adults and children. Children should be accompanied based on their tool-using skills.

name: Lucet: Beyond Square Cord
description_book: You can make good square cord; what's next? Flat and multi-color cords. Bring your lucet. (We can slip a cord off and put it back on after class.)
description_web: You’re comfortable making square cord; what's next? We'll work on flat and multi-color cords. Please bring your lucet. We'll also demonstrate how to slip a cord off, and put it back on after class.
fee_itemization: (3) colors of floss on cards, and handout

name: ASHI Basic First Aid
description_book: Created to help students develop basic first aid knowledge, skills, and the confidence to respond. Cost is $15 for card only, $20 including books.
description_web: Basic First Aid was created to help students develop basic first aid knowledge, skills, and the confidence to respond. The program is an excellent choice for both the community and workplace setting, and is consistent with recommendations of the 2010 National First Aid Science Advisory Board and OSHA’s best practices for first aid training programs in the workplace. Class length: 5 hours. Cost is $15 for card only, $20 including books.
fee_itemization: Separate fee for card or course materials.

name: Medieval Music Notation: Introduction
description_book: Read lots of examples in facsimile, discussing problems as they arise. Bring melody instruments you play fluently, e.g., recorder, fiddle, voice.
description_web:
Reading medieval music in modern notation imposes modern notions of measure, phrasing, and tonality. Reading it in the original notation allows us to get closer to the composer's intentions and the head-space of a medieval performer, and can help achieve those elusive, magical “medieval moments”. We'll spend most of the class reading examples, discussing problems as they arise.  F, G, and C clefs in various places, long note values, unbarred music, C.O.P. ligatures, *musica ficta*, and perhaps “minor coloration". 

Bring melody instruments you play fluently, such as recorder, gamba, fiddle, voice (if you have good pitch memory), etc. If you have multiple sizes of your instrument, please bring them (e.g., SATB recorders).

Each session of the class will use different examples, so feel free to attend both.

name: Beginning Reed Baskets
description_book: Learn the fundamentals of making a reed basket; make and take a small basket utilizing a wooden base technique.
description_web: Students will learn the fundamentals of making a reed basket. Individuals will make and take a small basket utilizing a wooden base technique.

name: Dancing for Kids by a Kid
description_book: Come learn a mix of Benjamin`s favorite dances. (Any youth in attendance require a responsible adult present.)
description_web: Come learn some of Benjamin`s favorite dances. Those he will teach are expected to include *Ly Bens, Petite Vriens*, and some bransles.

name: Beginning Archery Classes: 12 and Under
description_book: To all younger archers: Come to the archery range on Aug 3 and Aug 4 to be instructed in the art of archery, 9 am to 10 am
description_web: To all younger archers: Come to the archery range on Aug 3 and Aug 4 to be instructed in the art of archery, 9 am to 10 am. You must be 12 or under to participate.

name: Intro to Woodworking
description_book: Introduction to woodworking with only hand tools. Includes modern SOPs and safe practices for the purposes of building medieval-style furniture.
description_web: Two half days Tuesday and Wednesday; an overview of hand wood work, with an opportunity to try things out. We will start on Tuesday morning with a chunk of a log and by noon we should have some boards or other furniture parts using wedges, axes, froes, drawknives, spokeshaves and wood planes. On Wednesday we will look at making joints, boring, and maybe a bit of carving. Covers saws, chisels, and planes. Extensive instructions on the selection, use and maintenance of all these tools will be covered. The class will be taught both first week and again second week. Students who cannot attend the whole class are encouraged to drop in or out at their convenience.

instructor: Lady Nina Amaya of Bright Hills
name: Kids' Dance: *Rajasthani*
description_book: Boys and girls, ages 4 (with parent) to 100, come learn a dance to a song from India. Bring two scarves or one large skirt if you can. Come have fun!

name: Stick Weaving
description_book: Stick weaving is a simple, weft-based weaving method.
description_web: Stick weaving is a simple, weft-based weaving method. Great for making belts and straps. Upgradable to make everything from shawls to rugs. Sticks and string provided; take your work home with you.

name: The Lady Rapier Community Tournament
description_book: This tournament is being hosted by the Lady Rapier community! Bring your best to this tournament! Prizes for prowess and more.
description_web: This tournament was once hosted by the Lady Rapier Community, and is now being hosted again by the same group! Bring your best fighting game to this tournament. There will be an opening challenge round, then a round robin with lots of fighting, and then a finals to be determined for the final prize. There will be fantastic prizes for prowess, courtesy, and for period attire.

name: Beginning Scribal Track
description_book: Four-day scribal arts beginner track. Topics Include layout, calligraphy and painting. Must attend all 4 days. Kit provided. No experience necessary.
description_web: If you ever wanted to try the scribal arts, now is your chance. The Scribal Beginner Track will introduce you to the tools of the trade, design elements, layout, outlining, painting and calligraphy. We'll create a scroll from beginning to end. No experience necessary and a beginner kit is included with the class cost.

name: Taking the Pain Out of Period Pigments
description_book: Basic period pigments and problems/solutions mixing and using them. Studio time for practice.
description_web: This is a discussion of the nature of period pigments and problems/solutions mixing them with binders and using them to illuminate. It is participatory with studio time to use the materials discussed.
fee_itemization: $10 for handout and use of period pigments/scroll quality papers

name: Food Lab - Bread Day
description_book: The Medeival Food Lab will be hosting an entire day of bread-making and baking classes, utilizing an oven made by other students on site.
description_web: The Medeival Food Lab will be hosting an entire day of bread-making and baking classes, utilizing an oven made by other students on site. Topics will include flat bread, matzoh, sourdough and large scale production as well as a discussion on communal bread baking through out period. Check the listing outside Æthelmearc Royal for a breakdown of the class schedule.
fee_itemization: Donations will be taken to help defray the cost of running the Food Lab.

name: Fool School
description_book: Are you a fool or a fool wannabe? Come to Fool School to share and learn. Prepare a 5-minute skit to perform. All ages/experience levels welcome.
description_web:
Are you a fool or a fool wannabe? Come to Fool School to share and learn. Fools/performers of all types and experience levels are welcome. Jugglers, magicians, singers, freaks and geeks. Get help creating or honing a skit of no more than 5 minutes to perform in the Amphitheater Wednesday 8/6 6-7 pm.
You might even become a “Licensed Fool.” Performing is not mandatory.

name: Avoiding Frequent Causes of Submission Return
description_book: When you (or a client) submits a name or device, there are some basic rules that will help ease your way through the process.

name: Chatelain Roundtable
description_book: Calling all Chatelains: Come to this roundtable hosted by the Midrealm Kingdom Chatelaine.
description_web: Sharing ideas regarding recruitment and membership retention is important for our continued success as a Society. As Chatelains, we are marketers, recruiters - and our product is the SCA. Let's talk about different strategies and techniques that work and how to make our recruiting efforts more successful!

name: YHQL YLGL YLFL: Cryptography and Cryptanalysis
description_book: Need to keep information secret? Use a cipher! A look at period methods of making and breaking codes.

name: Mastering Pleatwork: Advanced 16th-C Techniques
description_book: Experienced pleatworkers (smockers) are invited to join me to discuss advanced methods of creating and securing pleats used in 16th-century Europe.
description_web: Experienced pleatworkers are invited to join me to discuss advanced methods of creating and securing pleats used in 16th-century Europe. Includes a review of my in-depth research on imagery and techniques, as well as a variety of reproduction pleatwork to touch and feel. After I present my research and experimentation, I will open the floor for discussion and practice. Participants will also have an opportunity to practice some of the more complicated stitches if they wish.

name: Baba Yaga, the Arch-Villainess of Russian Folklore
description_book: Baba Yaga is a common character in Russian fairy tales. We will discuss the diverse roles she plays, and look into the origins of the character.
description_web: Baba Yaga is a common character in Russian and Eastern European fairy tales. We will discuss the diverse roles she plays, and look into the origins of the character. (Some familiarity with Russian folklore is helpful, but not really required.)

name: The Shady Valley of Bizarre Love
description_book: We'll be doing two dances, *Ombrosa Valle* from Caroso, and *Bizzarria d'Amore* from Negri, according to the teacher's current reconstructions.
description_web: We'll be doing two dances, *Ombrosa Valle* from Caroso, and *Bizzarria d'Amore* from Negri, according to the teacher's current reconstructions.

name: Morris Games
description_book: We will teach Nine Man's Morris and other games of that family (which include the modern tic tac toe).
description_web: We will teach Nine Man's Morris and other games of that family (which include the modern tic tac toe).

location: Good Friends Camp (N-01, usually on St. Lawrence)
name: 16th-Century Ledger Binding
description_book: All-day class; learn to make a 16th-century limp (no wood) binding using the ledger stitch. No prior experience required; some embroidery.
description_web: An all-day class where students learn to make a 16th-century limp (no wood) binding using the ledger stitch. A half-hour lunch break will be allowed. All binding tools will be loaned by the instructor. No prior bookbinding experience needed, but it does help. It also helps to know some embroidery skills.
fee_itemization: Fee includes leather for the cover, a hand-out, paper, and linen thread.

name: Armoured Bridge Battle
description_book:
Three 20-minute battles. Victory: possession of 2/3 bridges at time. Possession determined at the 2/3rd distance 
mark. CA & Siege 1 & 3rd battles.
description_web:
Three 20 minute battles, 1 point per battle
• Victory: possession of 2 out of 3 bridges at time. Possession is determined at the 2/3rd distance mark.
• 3 bridges in each battle plus a ford that may be constructed during the battle. Bales for building a ford will be located behind the start line on each side with enough provided to build a 90-foot ford.
• Bridges are 27 feet wide by 90 feet long.
• Starting line is 100 feet from ends of bridges.
• At time, only those on the bridge are left alive. Those remaining fight to the last man. Battle may not break out into the open field after time or support other bridges.
• Siege and archery in first and third battles. Tubular and siege ammo may be gleaned.
• Archers have free movement but may not shoot between bridges. Shooting between bridges and the ford is allowed.
• Siege engines will deploy at 50 feet from bridge end line and may move north-south along the line as required during the battles.

name: Storytelling Academy
description_book: Explore genres, tools, styles, and uses of storytelling. Cultural and medieval approaches, applications, performance coaching. New topics each day.
description_web: During this nine-day academy, students will gain knowledge about the history and techniques for storytelling both in the SCA and the modern world. Students may attend individual sessions or all of the academy. There will be guest teachers and time for students to practice and receive feedback. The academy will culminate in a student performance. No classes are repeated. The focus is on comfort, nurturing, and honing skills within the students’ capabilities. All levels are welcome. Students may pick up a class outline at the academy space, Minerva’s Spindle 158, where classes will also be listed on the message board. Seating is limited; feel free to bring your own chair.

location: PA Tent, Backstage (St. Lily's Commons (in University))
name: On Being a Prop Person
description_book: Have you ever wanted to work behind the scenes of the theater? Come and learn all the hats a prop person wears!  Meet backstage of the PA Tent.
description_web: Have you ever wanted to work behind the scenes of the theater? Come and learn all the hats a prop person wears: making, maintaining, tips, tricks, and pointers! Rehearsals for the Pennsic play *The Merchant of Venice* start at 8:30 am Mon-Thu at the Performing Arts Pavilion. Find the prop person and see how it's done! We'll keep it quiet, since this is during rehearsals. Look for the lady with the light blue-and-white baldric. Meet backstage of the PA Tent.

name: Pennsic Choir: Open Rehearsal
description_book: The Pennsic Choir welcomes all interested singers! Songs in honor of the 500th anniversary of the Coronation of François I of France.
description_web: The Pennsic Choir welcomes all interested singers! This year's concert features songs of the early to mid-16th century in honor of the 500th anniversary of the Coronation of François I of France. Singing in the Pennsic Choir is an intense and rewarding experience. We rehearse two hours each day for a week, then perform a concert on Thursday evening of War Week. The ability to read music and sight-sing is helpful, but not required if you learn the music in advance. Sheet music and audio tracks are available online now at https://sites.google.com/site/kwcpennsicchoir/home/pennsic-choir/pennsicxliiichoirs

name: How to Demonstrate Blacksmithing
description_book: A discussion for advanced to beginners on how to demonstrate blacksmithing in front of a crowd. Tips and tricks for a successful demo.
description_web: Discussion for advanced to beginners on how to do a successful demo. Tips and tricks on how to and not to make a fool of yourself for an entertaining and educational demonstration of blacksmithing.

name: Weed Walk
description_book: Wild plant identification. Wear walking shoes and hat; leave from Univ. Point. Different teachers on different days; walk with us more than once!
description_web: Cooper's Lake abounds with medicinal and food plants that were used by various primitive and medieval cultures. Learn to identify them during a walk around the campsite. The walk will take place rain or shine. Please wear sturdy shoes and a hat. Meet at University Point for the start of the class. We have three wonderful new teachers this year, enabling us to offer this class more times!

name: Beginning Drumming
description_book: The basic rhythms used most often in drum circles and music within the SCA. A 4-part class that teaches different rhythms each day. BYO drum.
description_web:
Learn the basic rhythms used most often in drum circles and music within the SCA. This is a 4-part class that teaches different rhythms each day. BYO Drum.
Day 1- *Saidi, Beladi, Maqsum*
Day 2- *Chiftitelli, Masmoudi*
Day 3- *Ayub, Malfouf*
Day 4- *Kashlimah* and other strange stuff

name: Creating Pigments - Period Style
description_book: How pigments were created in period plus modern alternatives and methods for creating a reasonable facsimile of a period palette.
description_web: A brief discussion, using period and modern resources, about how pigments were created in period plus a discussion and demonstration of modern alternatives and methods for creating a reasonable facsimile of a period palette. Includes studio time to experiment with tools and materials as well as sample painting using the pigments.

name: Rehearsal (Closed): Pennsic *Commedia* All Stars
description_book: Space in use.
description_web: Space in use.

name: Archery Populace War Point
description_book: Archery Populace War Point
description_web: All archers young and old are encouraged to come and lend their support to their kingdom's efforts, and to display their skill at archery. There will be three challenging populace shoots to test skills. Each Kingdom will be competing to earn the three War Points for each shoot.

name: Making your **Second** Garb
description_book: Moving up from the fold-over tunic, add just a few small, easy steps, and you can have something much, much nicer to wear. Beginners welcome!
description_web: OK, you've folded over the fabric and stitched up the sides. Now you're going to events regularly and you'd like to make something that fits a little better and looks a little nicer, but is still easy to make. Learn a method that will save fabric, use all straight seams and look great on any shape. Also appropriate for a first project.

name: Commenting on Letter of Intent
description_book: Heraldic letters of intent (in and out of kingdoms) can always benefit from both  trained and less-experienced, commenters. How can you help?
description_web:
Commenting on letters of intent: How I learned to stop worrying and love heraldry.
Heraldic letters of intent (in and out of kingdoms) can always benefit from both trained and less-experienced commenters. We will discuss how to provide helpful commentary. For heralds or aspiring heralds.

name: GUDFR LQYLFWXV! Codes and Secret Communications
description_book: Want to know how to send battle plans securely to others? Want to express your love to someone without prying eyes or crack codes? Updated this year!
description_web: Want to know how to send battle plans securely to other commanders? Want to express your love to someone without prying eyes? Come talk about how messages were hidden in period, and see some of the methods used. Learn how some of the codes were broken as well. Handout includes practice codes to break and quick methods/formulas you can use at War.

name: Hosen Before Brosen
description_book: Create a pattern for making single-leg footed hosen which were worn by numerous cultures in the SCA period.
description_web: Create a pattern for making single-leg footed hosen which were worn by numerous cultures in the SCA period. Additional instruction will be given on construction techniques and variations in style and length.
fee_itemization: One-half yard of fabric per student.

name: Foods for Trail and Sail: Viking Provisions
description_book: Food preservation was essential to survival during Nordic winters and long sea voyages. Learn how food spoilage was prevented during the Viking era.
description_web: Food preservation was essential to survival during long Nordic winters, on trading journeys and for long sea voyages of exploration and settlement. Learn how food spoilage was prevented during the Viking era. You may find ideas that will enable you to leave that cooler behind!

name: The Development of Music through Acoustics
description_book: We will discuss the development of vocal and instrumental music in relation to changing architecture, new instrumentation, and musical principles.
description_web: We will discuss the development of vocal and instrumental music in relation to changing architecture, new instrumentation, and musical principles.

name: Divination: Scrying and Intuition
description_book: Divination via access to your subconscious intuition. Scrying and vision-seeking plus physical ideomotor systems such as pendulums and dowsing.
description_web: Divination via access to your subconscious intuition. Scrying and vision-seeking plus physical ideomotor systems such as pendulums and dowsing. How to hack your own nervous system to access information you didn't even know you had.

name: Half-Linings Considered Harmful
description_book: This class will examine fashion fabric, lining, and construction choices for the Gothic (late-14th-century) fitted dress.
description_web: This class will examine fashion fabric, lining, and construction choices for the Gothic fitted dress. Particular attention is paid to preferred choices as recorded in primary sources, and alternative options that acknowledge the widely variant needs of a lady of the Society from those of her ancestress.

name: Scandalously Practical: Italian Drawers
description_book: A delicate conversation about an indelicate subject: underwear. We'll discuss the origins of the garment, references in period and construction.
description_web: A delicate conversation about an indelicate subject: underwear. Several pairs of Renaissance Italian "trousers" are found in museums around the world. We'll discuss the origins of the garment, plus references in period and construction techniques using both period and modern patterning.

name: Harp Techniques
description_book: Historical info and techniques: Improve strength, speed, tone, musicality. Useful for all harpers, beginner to advanced. Chairs may not be available
description_web: Techniques to improve strength, speed, tone and musicality. Historical information about harps, the men and women who played them, and their music. Useful for all harpers, complete beginner to advanced. Learn how to get more out of your instrument and practice time, as well as practical approaches to performing. This is one of a 3-part course. We will build on information from each class, but students are not required to attend all three. Feel free to contact teacher in advance if you know you'll miss one. Chairs may not be available. Please bring chairs/harpstands if possible.
fee_itemization: Exercises for use in class, during Pennsic, and afterward. Reading music, counting, fingering, etc.

name: *Basse Danses*
description_book: Burgundian *basse* (or low) dance is a mystery to many but it is easy to learn and fun to do.
description_web: Burgundian *basse* (or low) dance is a mystery to many but it is actually a very simple and elegant form that is found in some of the earliest sources and continued in a similar style for many years. There are three patterns that will prepare you to do most of the dances in this genre. Once these three patterns are gained you will simply combine them in sets to perform this most elegant and graceful of dances.

name: Card-Weaving Basics
description_book: Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and, using cards, you will weave a trim strip.
description_web: Warp a loom and weave a small strap or trim piece. Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and weave a trim strip. Classroom loaner looms available or bring your own. Fee covers string and cards; take your work home with you.

instructor: THL Don Po Silvertop the Rogue
name: Known World Rapier Cadet Tournament
description_book: Open to those who are sponsored by a person who has a peerage or high level award for rapier. Format: traditional double elim tourney.
description_web: Come join rapier combatants from across the Known World in the second annual Cadet Tournament. This tournament will be open to those who are sponsored by a person who has a rapier peerage or kingdom’s high award for rapier. This includes the Order of Defense, Order of the White Scarf, Order of the Bronze Ring, Order of the Golden Rapier, The Dragon's Steel, The Order of Thorbjorn's Hammer, The Order of the Queen's Blade, and The Meridian Order of the Blade or equivalent award. A person may sponsor more than one entrant. Sponsors will be required to sign in their cadet, or send a letter of entrance. If you need a sponsor, we will find one for you. This will be a traditional double elimination tournament. Each bout shall be fought to a single kill. Double kills will be re-fought one time. On the second double kill, “Dead is dead!” The finals will be fought best two out of three. All bouts shall be fought with default Pennsic rules.

name: Intro to 6-on-2 Chainmail
description_book: This type of chainmail was prevalent in period across multiple cultures. All materials provided but bring two pairs of pliers.
description_web: Intro class for 6-on-2 chainmail prevalent throughout period across multiple cultures. All materials necessary to complete class project provided but bring two pairs of standard box nose pliers if you have them. Tools are available for those who don't have them on a first-come first-served basis.
fee_itemization: Sufficient hand-turned & cut aluminum rings, 12ga 5/8 in diameter, to complete class project.

name: *Saz* Workshop
description_book: Workshop for beginner and experienced *saz* players.
description_web: Basic techniques and melodies for beginners. Traditional long-neck and short-neck playing techniques. Experienced *saz* players are encouraged to share insights, techniques, and more complex melodies.

name: Adventure with Sourdough
description_book: Learn how to grow and maintain sourdough culture used to bake bread in period. Take home some starter for your own baking.
fee_itemization: To cover cost of handout, bread and starter.

name: *De Lapidibus*
description_book: A class on gemstones, taught in (Muslim) persona, based on period sources.
description_web: A class on gemstones, taught in (Muslim) persona, based on period sources.
fee_itemization: no materials, probably a one page handout.

name: Helping at Herald's Point: Not Just for Heralds!
description_book: We need more help at Herald's Point than just Heralds! We need artists, exchequers, colorists, etc. We have ice cream and phone chargers!
description_web: We need more help at Herald's Point than just Heralds! We need artists, exchequers, colorists, etc. We have ice cream and phone chargers! Possible tour of Herald's Point at the end of class depending on weather conditions.

name: Pelican and Protégé Meet Up
description_book: A meet up for Pelicans and their protégés to have some fun and get to meet others from across the Known World! Please join us!

name: Lunch Counters for Fun and Profit
description_book: Get the most out of your lunch counter and still make sure people are properly fed without having a lot left over while making money.
description_web: How to get the most out of your lunch counter and still make sure people are properly fed without having a lot left over while making money. Sample recipes, portioning, cost breakdown and budgets will be discussed.

name: Spanish Geek Meet and Greet
description_book: Calling all Spanish personas! Let's get together, share resources and talk. Bring books, snacks and yourself.
description_web: Calling all Spanish geeks! Do you have a Spanish persona? Whether you are a Laurel, or just getting started, let's get together, talk, share resources, ideas and our love of all things Spanish. Bring books, pictures, resources and questions.

name: Reproduce Glass Beads Using Archeological Reports
description_book: Learn how to find and use archaeological reports to reproduce glass beads and bead strings found in graves at excavation sites.
description_web: Learn how to find and use archaeological reports to reproduce glass beads (and other early period items) found in graves at excavation sites. These reports provide a wealth of information that is not available from museum or other websites. The focus of this presentation will be on Anglo-Saxon excavation reports and how I have used those reports to reproduce historic glass beads and necklaces. However, artisans interested in other early period items and crafts  should find this presentation valuable.

name: Baltic-style Patterned Warp-faced Weaving
description_book: Workshop-style class: Learn how to create a pattern, warp, and weave using the techniques and materials specific to this type of patterned weaving.
description_web: This class will focus on learning how to create a pattern using the techniques and materials specific to this type of patterned weaving and how to warp it onto a loom of any type. Graph paper and pencils/colored pencils will be provided for creating patterns. Participants should bring a loom (inkle loom, tape loom, box loom, small rigid heddle, belt loom) to warp up using the pattern created and begin to weave using pickup techniques. Prior inkle/rigid heddle weaving experience suggested. A narrow selection of yarn will be available.

name: Through the Poetic Prism: The Kenning in Old Norse
description_book: Looking at the kenning, the very interesting metaphor form used in Anglo-Saxon and Old Norse poetry.

name: Loo-Braided Purse Strings: It Takes **Two**
description_book: Advanced: two-person purse strings for cloth purses, 12-17 C. Will start with a refresher on a single braid pattern before pairing braiders together.
description_web:
Drawstring cloth purses from the 12th-17th centuries often used two braided silk purse strings to pull them open and closed. These strings were made with silk finger loop braided lengths made by two braiders working side-by-side. The pair of purse strings were then inserted into the tops of the cloth purses in a special method that avoided the use of a casing.  
We will be hands-on in this class, pairing braiding students up to learn the cooperative braiding method used. While this class is not for beginners, the first 20 minutes will start with a warm-up/refresher of the single braid patterns before pairing braiders together. 

We will be using the doubled version of No. 2, *Pursestringe- 3 Bos Reed, 2 Bos White*-C.1600, 1630 OR No. 5, *A Lace Baston* - C.1475; *A Stringe that Every Edge Shall Keepe His Collor* -C.1600. Found in CA 108 or on the web at www.fingerloop.org. 

We will have handouts in class to detail and explain the joining moves not covered in CA 108. The class will start with a warm-up in braiding this 'round' braid as single braiders, then proceed to pairing up braiders to make a 'real' purse string. We have left extra braiding time for completion of one or two purse strings to make and take, hopefully. Embroidery thread/crochet cotton provided, or bring your own. Silk is used in the originals (mainly reeled silk), but embroidery thread is best to learn on if you are not totally proficient.

name: Norse and Rus Women's Head Coverings
description_book: How did the Valkyries knot their hair like the pendants? What about temple rings? Bring a scarf or fabric to learn how to wrap/adorn your hair.
description_web: Explore possible hair knots, braids, wraps and coverings derived from extant images of Scandinavian Norse (Viking) and Rus/Slavic tribal women. Bring a scarf or a long piece of material to learn how to wrap your hair. (This class will not cover the British Isles caps or Western Scandinavia.)

name: Inside the Persona: Japanese Monk
description_book: Interviews with exceptional SCA personas. Today's guest will be Kuji Kaoni Musashi, a *Yamabushi monk: warrior, magician, jack-of-all-trades holy man.
description_web: First in a series, interviewing personas who are richly developed and integrated into their SCA activities Our first guest is Kuji Kaoni Musashi, a *Yamabushi* monk: warrior, magician, priest. There will be an in persona presentation, then an interview, James Lipton-style.

name: Matthew Paris: 13th-Century Chronicler
description_book: Matthew Paris is a famous 13th-century chronicler. This class will introduce him and his works for those interested in the 13th century.
description_web: Matthew Paris is a famous 13th-century chronicler. This class will introduce him and his works for those interested in the 13th century.

name: Newcomers' Tent
description_book: So, you're new to the SCA? What do you do? Where do you go? Stop in here at the Newcomers' Tent! We have answers and are here to help!
description_web: So, you're new to the SCA? What do you do? Where do you go? Stop in here at the Newcomers' Tent!  We have answers and are here to help! Come meet with newcomer guides from around the Knowne World and learn about the endless possibilities.

name: Parson's Farewell & Whirligig
description_book: These are more interesting English country dances and make good performance pieces. Some prior dance classes needed.

location: Guild of Limners (dir. across from Big Cooper Store (Old Barn's open side))
name: Penmaking 102: Quills, Bamboo, Phragmites
description_book: If you want to write, you're going to at least need a pen - and you need to make your own - from a pen, a bamboo point or a tiny "brush".
description_web: Classes will start with cutting a proper quill from a goose feather, then go on to cutting one from bamboo or using stiff grass to lay ink (not *paint*!) down as if using a tiny brush.

name: Beginning *Repoussé* and Chasing
description_book: Hands-on class; will make a copper foil rose.
description_web: Hands-on class; will make a copper foil rose.

name: KW Choir Open Auditions: *Chorulus Pennsicus*
description_book: Known World Choir open auditions for anyone interested in trying out for KW's select choir, *Chorulus Pennsicus".
description_web: Known World Choir open auditions for anyone interested in trying out for Known World Choir's select choir, *Chorulus Pennsicus*.

name: Rehearsal (Closed): *Sans Nomen* Dress Rehearsal
description_book: Space in use.
description_web: Space in use.

name: Middle Eastern Dancing for All Shapes and Sizes
description_book: If you love to shake your shimmy or want to try dancing for the first time, come out and join us.

name: Intermediate Middle Eastern Drumming: 6/8 and 12
description_book: Add to your rhythm repertoire with rhythms played in 6 and 12. Moroccan and Persian 6/8 and Chaka 12 are covered, with variations. Beginners welcome.

name: Intro to Celtic Knotwork: 5-Dot Technique
description_book: This is an intro class to get you started down the rabbit hole to creating beautiful Celtic knotwork for any use you can imagine.
description_web: This is an intro class to get you started down the rabbit hole to creating beautiful Celtic knotwork for any use you can imagine. If you have ever wanted to create your own knotwork design for illumination, embroidery, leatherwork, wood carving, bone carving, or just because it is fun, this is the class for you.

name: Rehearsal (Closed): *i Sebastiani* - Amphitheater
description_book: Space in use.
description_web: Space in use.

name: On the Shapes and Signs of Written Music
description_book: An in-persona class on the development of music notation. No instruments needed.
description_web: In ancient times, a musician was expected to learn his tunes by rote, but music of today is so complex that it must be written down. Writing music also enables it to travel from place to place, and from time to time, without being carried by a skilled musician. We'll discuss the inventions of Guido, Franco, Philippe de Vitry, Johannes Ciconia, and others that enable us to write music and read it without ever having heard it. *In-persona class*.

name: Resources for In-Period (Documentable!) Names
description_book: Not yet chosen an SCA name? Don't know where to look for ideas? Online resources are available to help you research an in-period, documentable name.
description_web: Not yet chosen an SCA name? Don't know where to look for ideas? Online resources are available to help you research an in-period, documentable name.

name: Silversmithing
description_book: Students will make a pendant using cabochon semi-precious stones, sterling silver sheet and wire. Techniques include forming, hard soldering, finish.
description_web: Students will make a pendant using cabochon semi-precious stones which would have been available in period, and sterling silver sheet and wire. The processes include forming, silver soldering, and finishing and bezel setting
fee_itemization: Stones, silver sheet, bezel wire, loop wire, sol and custom cut stones (all vary in price by piece) but an average of $40 for all combined.

name: Researching on the Internet
description_book: How to use the Internet to find reliable, accurate information. If there is time we will try to solve individual research issues for the students.
description_web: How to use the Internet to find reliable, accurate information. If there is time, we will try to solve individual research issues for the students. Hints about how to use this info for documentation. Includes a handout of recommended URLs and techniques for locating more.

name: Known World Historians Meet and Greet
description_book: A meet and greet for Known World historians at all levels, official or unofficial, to discuss ways to preserve our history.
description_web: This a meet and greet opportunity for Known World historians at all levels, official or unofficial, to come together to discuss and share ways to preserve our history.

name: Constructing a 14th-Century *Pourpoint*
description_book: Covering construction techniques, resources, and patterning recommendations.

name: Crumhorn Consort
description_book: Intermediate/advanced group music session for players of the "soft" double-reeds: crumhorns, cornamusen, dolzaines, etc. Sheet music provided.
description_web: Bring out your "buzzy" instruments and play through a set of 15th- and 16th-century pieces. Attendees will take home a packet of sheet music good for crumhorns and similar instruments; feel free to bring appropriate songs to share (in multiple copies, please).

name: *Gishiki*: Court and Polity in Medieval Japan
description_book: A discussion of court procedure, rank, title, and office. An introduction to Japanese etiquette. Includes a beginner's guide to Japanese governance.
description_web: A discussion of court procedure, rank, title, and office. An introduction to Japanese etiquette. Includes a beginner's guide to Japanese governance.

name: Easy Gresley Dances
description_book: These are the easiest Gresley dances I know: *New Year, Rawty, Roye*, and *Oringe*. These are relatively new and fun to do. From 1500 England.
description_web: The dances in this class are from the recently discovered Gresley manuscript. They include *New Year, Rawty, Roye* and *Oringe*. These are the easiest Gresley dances I know. The manuscript was discovered in 1995. They are from 1500 England but they are quite different from Playford ECD.

name: Period Card Games: *Karnoffel*
description_book: Do you like to play cards? Come learn to play this oldest identifiable European card game (1426 reference).
description_web: Looking for something to pass the time at events? Do you like to play cards? Come learn to play this oldest identifiable European card game (1426 reference). We will be using cards with German suits.

name: Rapier Village Battle
description_book: Resurrection town battle with resource collection. Victory: Best of three runs, or best score after 90 minutes total, whichever comes first. No RBGs.
description_web:
This will be a resurrection town battle with resource collection.
• The resources in question are nine banners. The first team to score five banners wins that round.
• Victory: Best of three runs, or best score after 90 minutes total, whichever comes first. Scoring occurs when the banners are collected and delivered to a point diagonally opposite of the resurrection points.
• Banner must be carried in one hand that is otherwise empty of weapons. A fighter may not fight with multiple weapons/secondaries in a single hand. Individuals carrying a banner must move no faster than a walk.
• If a banner bearer is killed, they must stop until relieved of the banner by a living fighter from either army. They shall adopt the standard dead posture (holding their weapon hilt-up above their head), and shall not speak beyond the standard short phrase upon their death.
• Resources will be reset by the marshals during a general hold when all resources are collected.
Both teams will also reset to their resurrection points at this time.
• All holds will be local save in the event of a medical emergency or a reset of resources. Only a medical hold will stop the clock.
• If, at the end of 90 minutes, the score is tied, a 15-minute sudden-death, no resurrection tiebreaker will be held. The first team to score wins the battle
• RBGs will **not** be used.
• Death From Behind will be allowed.

name: Vocal Techniques for Singers, Bards, Storytellers
description_book: Learn proper breathing, vocal exercises, projection techniques, and how to care for your voice.
description_web: Learn proper breathing, vocal exercises, projection techniques, and how to care for your voice. Singing and public speaking involve your whole body. Learn to do it the right way so you can do it for a lifetime!

name: Exploring Medieval Poetry
description_book: A basic poetry writing class looking at various types of poetry used in the Middle Ages. We will write a poem and look at documentation.
description_web: This class will take a brief look at some of the easier kinds of medieval poetry, review when, by whom and how they were used, and how they can be used in the SCA. Participants will be asked to write a brief poem in a style of their choice. Those who wish may perform the poem. This is a very basic class in poetry with a look at short form documentation. Some references will be provided.

name: Beginning Engraving
description_book: Hands-on class. Intro to tools, first cuts, graver control, hammer use.
description_web: Hands-on class. Intro to tools, first cuts, graver control. Student will learn both hand-held and hammer-struck engraving.

name: Script Analysis
description_book: Toss away your modern calligraphy book! Learn how to analyze a script directly from your source and recreate it on your own page.

name: Scroll Personalization Without Modernization
description_book: Learn techniques to create scrolls that will have a personalized touch without losing the period aspects of original manuscript pages.
description_web: Ever want to make a scroll special for the recipient but didn't want to do something so modern that it doesn't look like it came out of a manuscript or even out of history? In this class students will learn techniques to create scrolls that will have a personalized touch without losing the period aspects. We will touch on how to come up with personalization ideas and decide what elements to add/subtract to and from period manuscript illuminations as well as how to inhabit an illumination with images of the recipients.

name: SCA Armory (Devices and Badges)
description_book: How to design and register SCA-legal and period-appearing devices and badges for use in the SCA.

name: BoD Meet & Greet
description_book:
Come and meet members of the SCA's governing body, the Board of Directors. 
Here's your chance to "put faces to names".
description_web:
Come and meet members of the SCA's governing body, the Board of Directors. 
Here's your chance to "put faces to names" and ask that question you've always wondered about!

name: You Are What You Eat: Humoural Doctrine
description_book: An overview of the theory of balancing the human condition through food.
description_web: An overview of the theory of balancing the human condition through food.

name: Bridging the SCA Generation Gap
description_book: Are you new to navigating the SCA waters? Have you been around awhile and lost some of your SCA shine? Learn how the generations can help each other.
description_web: Are you new to navigating the SCA waters? Have you been around awhile and lost some of your SCA shine? Learn how the generations can help each other. This class is for any person looking to find their path or enjoy again the path they are on.

name: Distilling History: Cordial Making
description_book: 1st hour: History of distillation; 2nd hour: Beginning cordial-making technique and a tasting. **Must** be 21 or over to attend.
fee_itemization:
Distillation handout, 8 pages;
Cordial-making handout, 10 pages.

name: Tarts, Shells, and a Pie from the 1549 *Banchetti*
description_book: Tart of milk, eggs, sugar and ginger, pastry shells of eggs and cheese, & a pie of marzipan, pine nuts and raisins from the 1549 Italian *Banchetti*.

name: Prostitution in SCA Period
description_book: History of prostitution, from the late Roman era to 1600 AD. Topics include contraception, garb, law, and the organization of brothels.
description_web: A survey of the history of prostitution, from the late Roman era to 1600 AD. We will be covering such topics as the formation of red light districts, brothel management, contraception, municipal laws, church law, and the garb and identification of a prostitute within this time period.

name: Bellatrix System: Two Sword
description_book: The techniques and strategy of the Bellatrix system of fighting with the two-sword style. Unarmored class. Appropriate for all levels of proficiency.
description_web: The class teaches the techniques and strategy of the Bellatrix system of fighting with the two-sword style. The class is appropriate for authorized fighters at all levels of proficiency. The class is taught unarmored. Students must bring two swords, and preferably a shield.

name: Beginner Dance: Branles C
description_book: Never danced before? No problem! Start with basic steps and patterns, and then learn fun branles from 16th-century France.
description_web: Never danced before? No problem! This class will start with basic steps and patterns, and then introduce you to fun branles from 16th-century France.

name: Queen's Tea - East Kingdom Royal
description_book: Queen's Tea at East Kingdom Royal. (No Heirs and only one retainer, please.)
description_web: Queen's Tea at East Kingdom Royal. (No Heirs and only one retainer, please.)

location: Guild of Limners (Opposite the Big Cooper Store (Old Barn))
name: Got Them Copper Ink Blues or Greens?
description_book: How to make true transparent copper-acetate inks, covering the spectrum from blue-black to bright green. Other inkmakers invited to join in.
description_web: Despite claims to the contrary by alleged 'experts', the period illuminator had access to inks ranging from dark blue to bright green, and all shades in between, using commonly available goods. Vinegar and copper or brass (and time and patience) make the powder that can become a true transparent ink, something that "burns" its way permanently into parchment, paper or papyrus. These may change color with time, but will last a good century or two.
fee_itemization: Some inks MAY be available for purchase, entirely OPTIONAL; samples free

name: Belly Dance Basics with Hadia!
description_book: Learn M.E. belly dance movements, techniques, muscle isolations, and combinations. Classes are for beginners to masters. Men and women are welcome!
description_web: Learn Middle Eastern belly dance movements, techniques, muscle isolations, combinations, and presentations. We will gain strength, balance, flexibility, stamina, and coordination as we learn body awareness and basic movements, organize dance patterns, learn to improvise, and use mini-combos for any form of belly dance. Loose clothing is necessary; dance shoes, pads or bare feet, but no street shoes. Hip scarves, shimmy belts, full skirts, etc., are optional and helpful for movement awareness. Men and women are welcome in this fun class for the beginner as well as dancers who desire a review of basic belly dance movements and technique.

name: Pennsic Children's Choir: Open Rehearsal
description_book: Pennsic Children's Choir is open to children up to age 11 who love to sing. We will be performing as part of the Thursday Known World Choirs Concert.
description_web: The Pennsic Children's Choir is open to children up to age 11 who love to sing. We will be performing as part of the Known World Choirs Concert on Thursday evening of War Week. (Dress rehearsal Thursday afternoon, 8/7, in the PAT; details TBA during regular rehearsals.) More information can be found here: https://sites.google.com/site/kwcpennsicchoir/home/pennsic-choir/pennsic-children-s-choir

name: PA Series: Middle Eastern & World Dance Exhibition
description_book: Our exhibition returns for our 19th year to delight and amaze! A perfect afternoon show for all ages!
description_web: Our exhibition returns for our 19th year to delight and amaze! A perfect afternoon show for all ages!

name: *Kumihimo* Basics
description_book: *Kumihimo*: cord braiding on a disk.
description_web: Kumihimo: cord braiding on a disk. Make a basic round cord. Disk and string provided; take your work home with you.

name: Beginner Dumbek Technique
description_book: This class covers everything you need to know to get comfortable with your dumbek. We will cover basic rhythms. Come on by! Don't be shy!
description_web: This class covers everything you need to know to get comfortable with your dumbek. We will cover basic rhythms. Come on by! Don't be shy!

name: Crakynge Merie Notes
description_book: Wolcum Somer--let's sing!  Come try your skill at ornamenting tunes, or even improvising countermelodies, in the Ars Antiqua style of our forebears.

name: Period Flat Breads and Pastries Without an Oven
description_book: A discussion and demonstration of period flat breads and pastries that can be made in a frying pan over the fire.
description_web: A discussion and demonstration of period flat breads and pastries that can be made in a frying pan over the fire. Sources include *al-Warraq* (10th C), the *Ain i Akbar* (16th-C Mughal), *Manuscrito Anónimo* (Andalusian 13th C) and Froissart.

name: Heraldic Customer Service
description_book: Working with submitters to help them get their name and device ideas into registerable forms that are legal under SCA rules.

name: Known World Embroiderers' Meet and Greet
description_book: The Keepers of Athena's Thimble (the East Kingdom needlework guild) invites all embroiderers to gather and share our love of our art.
description_web:
This year marks the 30th year of existence for the East Kingdom's needlework guild: the Keepers of Athena's Thimble. To mark this milestone, we are looking to celebrate our guild and embroidery in the SCA as a whole. We would like to invite all embroiderers of the Known World to come and share our appreciation of our art. Come just to chat, or bring items to display, questions to ask, or resources to share.  
Light beverages and desserts/snacks to share are welcome, but not necessary.

name: Easy Origami
description_book: Easy origami class for all ages!

name: The Very New Persona
description_book: You're brand, spanking new, and you don't know who you want to be? No worries! I'll talk through good starting points, and then we just chat. Relax!
