We'll be talking about using online translation web sites, dictionaries, and many other tools that can help you to understand and use foreign language resources. While we will briefly touch on pictographic languages like Chinese and Japanese, our focus will be on languages written with alphabets.

name: Introduction to Monumental Brasses
description_book: An introduction to monumental brasses which will cover history of brasses, art and craftsmanship, types, historic workshops, evolution, rubbings.
description_web: An introduction to monumental brasses which will cover history of brasses, art and craftsmanship, types, historic workshops, evolution, rubbings.

instructor: Mistress Arwen Evaine ferch Rhys ap Gwy
name: Traditional Norwegian Brewing
description_book: Ale and beer...the joy of life! We will trace the evolution and brewing techniques used in rural Norway from the earliest records. Recipes included.
description_web: Ale and beer: the joy of life! If one has bread, one also has beer, rich in vitamin B. We will explore the entire process from malting the grain to taking the first sip. Recipes, folklore, the tools used, brewing charms, and more will also be presented.

name: Bardic Coaching
description_book: Performers present a three- to five-minute piece and receive personal feedback with the object of increasing effectiveness.
description_web: Performers present a three- to five-minute piece and receive personal feedback with the object of increasing effectiveness. Any type of performance is acceptable.

name: The *Draugar*: The Undead in Icelandic Sagas
description_book: The Walking Dead in the Sagas. An overview and discussion of revenants in Icelandic medieval literature.

name: Dancing at the Villa: *Amoroso* by the Book
description_book: Join us at the beautiful Casa Bardicci to learn two versions of a fun and elegant 15th-century Italian dance: *Amoroso*.
description_web: Join us at the beautiful Casa Bardicci to learn two versions of a fun and elegant 15th-century Italian dance: *Amoroso*.

name: *Youkai*: Japanese Ghosts, Demons, and Monsters
description_book: A survey of supernatural Japan including gods, demons, monsters, and other supernatural beings.
description_web: A survey of pre-modern Japanese beliefs, including gods, demons, monsters and other supernatural beings. Beginning with the native gods of the *Kojiki* we'll stroll through Japanese supernatural history and touch on Japan’s encounters with Buddhism and Christianity.

name: Three-Couple English Country Dance
description_book: See just how creative Playford could be when you learn these dances for three couples! Dancers of all levels welcome.
description_web: See just how creative Playford could be when you learn these dances for three couples! Dances taught will be *Adson's Saraband, Scotch Cap* and *Old Mole*. Dancers of all levels welcome.

name: Multiplayer Table Games
description_book: Four- and seven-player backgammon will be taught depending on attendance. We will review rules and variations, then provide time to play.
description_web: Four- and seven-player backgammon will be taught depending on attendance. We will review rules and variations, then provide time to play.

instructor: Viscountess Kamiilah al Sudanii um Zoom
name: Intermediate Middle Eastern Dance Combos
description_book: Kamiilah will be teaching some of her favorite combinations of movements, and her own style of lead-and-follow dance! If we have time, we will zill!
description_web: Kamiilah is the fearless leader of modern dance troupe RockaBelly, and is ready to share her sassy lead-and-follow combos with all of you! If we have time, we will also learn zill patterns specific to the movements.

name: Ten-ish More Songs Everyone in the SCA Could Know
description_book: Ten (for sufficiently large values of ten) more cool songs that have something to say about life in the SCA. We'll sing through them together.
description_web: Ten (for sufficiently large values of ten) more cool songs that have something to say about life in these Current Middle Ages. We'll sing through them together.

name: Pennsic Technical Theater: Lights, Stage, Action!
description_book: Come and learn about the behind-the-scenes tech theater of the Performing Arts Tent: building the stage, rigging curtains, running lights, and more!

name: Lucet Basics
description_book: Make a square cord and a two-color cord.
description_web: Make a square cord and a two-color cord. Classroom loaner lucets available or bring your own. No fee. String provided.

name: Battle of Hastings
description_book: Choose a side - defend the Saxons, or join attacking Norman forces - and use your strength of arms to help decide the day.
description_web:
The year 1066 was a turning point in history, and at our Hastings Battle, you will have the chance to rewrite history! The valor and skill of the warriors on each side will determine the outcome.
Choose a side - defend the Saxons, or join attacking Norman forces - and use your strength of arms to help decide the day. This is a special rules melee. We've attempted to make this event a time for fighters to showcase their beautiful mid-period kits in an atmosphere recreating the feel of battles in the 11th century.
Rules:
1) A combatant may count the first strike they receive against mail armor as light.
2) In general, any form of armor that is documentable to the Battle of Hastings period and region is acceptable. If you have specific questions, please ask via email: olafharaldson@gmail.com.
3) General rules: No exposed plastic (plastic gauntlets OK), no exposed duct tape, no exposed modern sports gear, no exposed modern logos, no blatantly modern footwear.
4) Helms: Spangen or conical construction preferred. No closed faced helms of any type, and no blatantly 12th century+ helms.
5) Torso: Anything documentable to the period. Mail has an advantage, but a padded or even plain tunic is documentable as well. We are not forbidding lamellar… but we aren’t encouraging it either. The intent of the battle is to highlight documentable Hastings-age kits. Lamellar will not be given the ability to take the first shot to the body as light.
6) Limb armor: Greaves and vambraces may be exposed, all other limb armor should be hidden. Spaulders must be covered if worn. Body armour should be under your maille or tunic.
7) Gauntlets: Any are acceptable (even plastic); this is a safety factor which supersedes historical practice.
8) Shields: Round or kite only. No later period designs (heater, etc.).
9) Weapons: Primary weapons should be spear, axe, great axe, sword, seax. Thrown weapons (javelins, axes) are OK. Combat archery OK. No weapons that are undocumentable to the place and time.
10) Force commanders require one extra mortal wound to kill. I will be needing a Harald and a William… if you are interested in playing either part, and have a kit you think is appropriate, email olafharaldson@gmail.com .
11) Tape is not used as a marker for sides; fighters will use battle cries to tell friend from foe.
12) Engagement is 360 degrees once "lay on" is called. Yes, this means you may be struck from behind.
Victory Conditions:
Best three of five battles. Victory is achieved either by destroying the enemy force, or by killing the enemy leader (routing the force he commands).
Participants are asked to bring some small token as "loot"; the side losing three of five battles will give someone on the other side their "loot" token. This should not be an expensive item, but rather a token of victory on the field that day appropriate to your station.

name: Beginning Engraving
description_book: Hands-on class. Intro to tools, first cuts, graver control, hammer use.
description_web: Hands-on class. Intro to tools, first cuts, graver control. Student will learn both hand-held and hammer-struck engraving.

name: Atlantian 5-Man Melée
description_book: A Pennsic tradition. Bring your best 5-man fencing team and compete against the Known World. No more than two martial high orders per team.
description_web:
A Pennsic tradition. Bring your best 5-man fencing team and compete against the Known World. No more than two martial high orders per team. (This includes MoD, Chiv, BR, DS, MoB, OGR, and WS).
We will split the field into at least 4 fields to run separate Round Robins to advance the top 2 teams into a single elimination finale.
    DFB will be in effect.
    Knee walking **to engagement** will be in effect.
    No RBG or combat archery
    Have a team name, or our MoLs will name you.
    If you don't have a team we will find you a team.

name: Calligraphy 101
description_book: For teens through adult. We'll discuss the basics of calligraphy in the Scribal Arts. Some basic hands will be discussed with time to practice.
description_web: For teens through adult. We'll discuss the basics of calligraphy in the Scribal Arts. Some basic hands will be discussed with time to try your hand at a hand. No experience is necessary.

name: Drawing with a Proportional Scale
description_book: A low tech option for plotting and enlarging the illuminations you see in books onto your scroll page and improving your drawing skills.
description_web: So you've learned to draw a straight line with a ruler, great! But are you still intimidated by free-hand drawing? Are you inspired by period illumination art, but not sure how to get it on your scroll? The proportional scale is the low tech answer to improving your drawing skills. Learn how this tool can help you enlarge/reduce and plot out illuminated elements such as framing and architecture, flowers, animals and people, directly from your favorite source books all without a scanner, Photoshop software or a light box. This class is hands-on! Tools will be available for use during class.

name: Gardening for Beginners
description_book: Do you want to garden? Learn to grow your own food and herbs. We will discuss site choice, soils, sun, pollinators, pests, and more.
description_web: Do you want to garden, but don't know how? This class will cover the basics of how to grow your own food and herbs. We will discuss site choice, soils, sun, pollinators, pests, and more.

name: Beginning Wire Weaving
description_book: Students will learn to make intricate chains in the manner of the Vikings and other cultures, without need for heat or complicated tools.
description_web:
This class will teach beginning students to make intricate chains in the manner of the Vikings and other ancient cultures, without the need for heat or complicated tools. With the techniques presented, you will learn to create items like the ones found in Viking burials and treasure hoards across the Nordic countries dating from the 9th century to the late 12th century. 

Wire chains made in this fashion have also been discovered in the British Isles (875 AD) and in the Roman, Greek and Byzantine civilizations from the 4th century BC to the 1st century AD. Timeless items can be created that are still beautiful and wearable today. 

If you have needle-nose pliers and wire cutters, please bring them. If you need glasses for close or small work, please bring them. The fee for the class includes the materials needed to complete the leather cord necklace. To view this unique jewelry, please visit www.AncientWire.com/book.htm.

name: Drawn Work Handkerchief Make-and-Take
description_book: A hands-on, instructional class on drawn work, specifically the hemstitch, seen in German, Italian, and English Renaissance clothing and accessories.
description_web: A hands-on, instructional class on drawn work, specifically the hemstitch, seen in German, Italian, and English Renaissance clothing and accessories. Participants will create their own handkerchief with a drawn work hem, and learn how to make more elaborate drawn work designs on their own. Materials available for 10 people ($1 fee requested), or bring your own medium-weight, white linen (12" x 12"). Free handouts available for 25.

name: Introduction to 14th-Century German Brickstitch
description_book: Intro to 14-15th-C German brickstitch. The first hour is hands-on learning; the second is open discussion with my references and research.
description_web: A basic introduction to a simple counted-thread technique used in 14-15th-century Germany. In the first hour the class will cover the basic stitches, and work on a project to take away to finish. In remaining time there will be an open discussion of the design features and history, and lots of pictures to look at. Fee includes handout and materials. The number of kits is limited, but the class is open to all (or as many as will fit).
fee_itemization: Covers the cost of materials for the embroidery kit

name: Beyond Thunderdome
description_book: Tournaments hold a special place in SCA culture. Come learn how math and SCA culture create the structures and rules of how we run tournaments.

name: The *Bovo-Bukh*: Intro to Yiddish Satire
description_book: Rediscover a tale that was widely read between the 16th and 19th century. No Yiddish language skills required.
description_web: Rediscover a tale that was widely read between the 16th and 19th century but forgotten today. Be prepared for beautiful queens, hero wolf men, wicked monks and cruel sultans. The *Bovo-Bukh* is a product of contact between Jews and the chivalric stories of the wider non-Jewish world. No Yiddish language skills required.

name: Bellatrix System: Single-Hip Return
description_book: Very powerful sword technique; allows combinations with full-force strikes on each count; unarmored class for all levels of proficiency.
description_web: The class teaches the Single-Hip Return, one of the essential and most powerful offensive techniques of the Bellatrix method of fighting with sword and shield. It allows the fighter to use combinations, with full-force strikes on each count, instead of every other count. The class is appropriate for authorized fighters at all levels of proficiency. The class is taught unarmored. Students must bring a sword and a shield.

name: Dancing at the Villa: *Petite Rose* and *Lauro*
description_book: Join us at the beautiful Casa Bardicci to learn two fun and elegant 15th-century Italian dances: *Petite Rose* and *Lauro*.

name: Beginner Dance: Absolute Beginner C
description_book: Never danced before? This is the class for you! We’ll start from the very basics and soon you'll be on your way to the ball!

name: Pennsic Children's Choir: Open Rehearsal
description_book: Pennsic Children's Choir is open to children up to age 11 who love to sing. We will be performing as part of the Thursday Known World Choirs Concert.
description_web: The Pennsic Children's Choir is open to children up to age 11 who love to sing. We will be performing as part of the Known World Choirs Concert on Thursday evening of War Week. (Dress rehearsal Thursday afternoon, 8/7, in the PAT; details TBA during regular rehearsals.) More information can be found here: https://sites.google.com/site/kwcpennsicchoir/home/pennsic-choir/pennsic-children-s-choir

name: PA Series: Knowne World Pennsic Harp Celebration
description_book: Come celebrate the harp! Harpers of the Known World will display the wonders of the instrument we love. Open to all harpers of the Known World!
description_web: Come celebrate the harp! Harpers of the Known World will display the wonders of the instrument we love. Open to all harpers of the Known World! Audience and non-performing harpers welcome.

name: Beginner Dumbek Technique
description_book: This class covers everything you need to know to get comfortable with your dumbek. We will cover basic rhythms. Come on by! Don't be shy!
description_web: This class covers everything you need to know to get comfortable with your dumbek. We will cover basic rhythms. Come on by! Don't be shy!

name: Cutting a Quill Pen
description_book: Learn how to take a plain feather and turn it into an instrument of writing. Sharp knives will be used; ages 10-14 need parental supervision.
fee_itemization: For a quill to take home. No fee for those who bring their own quill to cut.

name: Recreating the English Woman's "Gabled" Hood
description_book: This unique hat evolved in 1500-1550 as depicted on brasses, effigies, and portraits. What shapes did it take? What materials? How can we recreate it?
description_web: During the reign of Elizabeth of York, Henry VIII's mother, a bonnet-style unique to English women appeared. Its exact shape - initially a sharply angled peak over the forehead and heavy black veil brightened only by a strip of ornately decorated fabric - evolved over the subsequent 50 years, but remained fashionable, as evidenced by the monumental brasses and carved stone effigies preserved in English churches. We will examine the shape of this distinctive bonnet and theorize about the materials and construction methods necessary to recreate it.

name: Enjoying A&S Competitions as Entrant or Judge
description_book: Learn how to increase your success as an entrant, understand how judging works, and discover ways to make both sides of the experience more enjoyable!
description_web: A&S Competitions can be scary places both for entrants **and** for judges. Come learn some ways to make both sides of the experience more enjoyable! We will first examine ways to increase your success as an entrant and then discuss how judging works to dispel the mysteries and increase the **fun**!

name: Sprang: Basics and Beyond
description_book: Open to beginners and to all who would like to expand to new techniques as well.
description_web: Learn a new thread manipulation skill! Open to beginners and to all who would like to expand to new techniques as well.

name: Spinning Clinic
description_book: Are you dissatisfied with the yarn you make, interested in spinning a different grist (thickness) or a multiple ply technique? Bring tools and fiber.

name: Knitting in the 16th Century: An Overview
description_book: Not only is hand-knitting period, the 16th century has a wealth of items to choose from. We'll look at a wide range of caps, gloves, and hosen.
description_web: Not only is hand-knitting period, the 16th century has a wealth of items to choose from. We'll look at a wide range of caps, gloves, and hosen. Interested in Eleanora of Toledo's stockings? I wrote the pattern!
fee_itemization: I have a handout with color illustrations & extensive bibliography.

name: *Marudai* for Beginners (Also *Kumihimo*)
description_book: *Kumihimo* on a *marudai* stand for beginners. Braiding on traditional Japanese stand. Stands available for purchase.
description_web: *Kumihimo* on a *marudai* stand for beginners. Learn to braid beginning patterns on the traditional Japanese stand. Stands available for purchase from instructor for $120.00.
fee_itemization:
5.00 for class and handout
3.0 for handout only
120.00 if you choose to purchase stand

name: Bardic Collegium #3: Feedback: Getting and Giving
description_book: Discussion of the finer points and perils of critique: how to offer it and request it in a good way, so that we all benefit from the experience.
description_web: One of the greatest challenges to growing as a performer is getting feedback to help you learn where and how to improve. Join us in the Collegium today to discuss the finer points and perils of critique: how to offer it and request it in a good way, so that we all benefit from the experience.

name: Viking Women in Russia
description_book: How did Varangian women dress? Were they Norse or Slav? Join me for a discussion about female graves found in Eastern Europe and Russia.
description_web: Please join me for a discussion about female graves found in western Russia. We will be focusing on the 2006 Pskov Dig as well as graves from Gnezdovo and Kiev. Further discussion of how we can incorporate grave-find information into our SCA wardrobe.

name: Nigel's Fire-Starting Class
description_book: You too can start a fire with flint and steel. We will explore the history of fire and how to start a fire with flint and steel. You will make fire.
description_web: Formerly titled “How to Start a Fire Like a Moderately Intelligent Saxon”. Yes, you too can start a fire with flint and steel like a Saxon, Roman, Viking, or any other civilized culture in the Middle Ages. Includes history of fire and the flint-and-steel mechanics of starting a fire. Hands-on class: you will start a fire. You must be at least 14 years old and have your parents' or wife’s permission.

name: *Bushido*: the Japanese Path of Honor
description_book: Discussion of the virtues of *Bushido*, and walking the path in daily life.
description_web: Discussion of the virtues of *Bushido*, and walking the path in daily life.

name: Bellatrix System: Teardrop Return
description_book: A very powerful sword technique, providing very rapid, powerful combinations. Unarmored class; appropriate for all levels of proficiency.
description_web: The class teaches the Teardrop Return, one of the essential and most powerful offensive techniques of the Bellatrix method of fighting with sword and shield. It provides the fighter with the ability to use very rapid combinations of full-force strikes. The class is appropriate for authorized fighters at all levels of proficiency. The class is taught unarmored. Students must bring a sword and a shield.

name: Dancing at the Villa: A 15th-Century Ball
description_book: Join the School of Europe Dance for a 15th-century Italian Ball at Casa Bardicci. Don't miss this opportunity to dance in the villa by the lake!

name: Beginner Dance: English Country C
description_book: Never danced before? No problem! This class will start with basic steps and patterns, and then teach simple English Country Dances.

name: Children's Water Battle
description_book: Assault the Fort! The Children's Water Battle is open to everyone 6 - 12. Bring your own water weapons (no catapults). Dress for mess. Water provided.
description_web: Assault the Fort! The Children's Water Battle is open to everyone 6 - 12. Bring your own water weapons (squirt guns, water balloons, etc. No catapults; they hurt!). Dress for mess and mud. Water provided. Each participant must be in the charge of a responsible adult. Treasure provided to each participant. Extra marshals are always wanted; marshals do not necessarily get wet. Actual battle for children starts at 3 pm.

name: Period Card Games: Tarot
description_book: Do you like to play cards? Come learn to play this late-period card game which uses a 78-card deck.
description_web: Looking for something to pass the time at events? Do you like to play cards? Come learn to play this late-period card game which uses a 78-card Tarot deck

name: Pennsic Period Novelty Shoots
description_book: Come test your skill on the Pennsic Period Novelty Shoots.
description_web: Come test your skill on the Pennsic Period Novelty Shoots on Wednesday, August 5, from 5 pm until 7 pm.

name: Advanced *Repoussé* and Chasing
description_book: Intro to pitch block working and forming, plus tool and hammer use. Produce a copper letter amulet.
description_web: Intro to pitch block working and forming, plus tool and hammer use. Produce a copper letter amulet.

name: Belly *Raqs* Yoga
description_book: Take your dance technique to the next level with this yoga belly fusion workout. Bring a yoga mat.
description_web: Take your dance technique to the next level with this yoga belly fusion workout. Uses anatomy to increase Middle Eastern dance technique. Bring a yoga mat.

name: Pennsic Youth Choir: Open Rehearsal
description_book: The Pennsic Youth Choir is open to ages 12 - 18 to learn period vocal music and performing as part of the Known World Choirs Concert.
description_web: The Pennsic Youth Choir Choir is open to youth ages 12 - 18 who enjoy learning and singing period vocal music *a cappella*. We will be performing as part of the Known World Choirs Concert on Thursday evening of War Week. (Dress rehearsal Thursday afternoon, 8/7, in the PAT; details TBA during regular rehearsals.) More information can be found here:  https://sites.google.com/site/kwcpennsicchoir/home/pennsic-choir/pennsic-youth-choir

name: *Kumihimo* Basics
description_book: *Kumihimo*: cord braiding on a disk.
description_web: Kumihimo: cord braiding on a disk. Make a basic round cord. Disk and string provided; take your work home with you.

name: Deed of Culture: Trading in the East
description_book: This is a historical re-enactment event where Viking traders traveling down the rivers of the east will meet with Moslem traders.
description_web: This is a historical re-enactment event where Viking traders traveling down the rivers of the east will meet with Moslem traders. Historical forms of hospitality will be explored, as well as an actual trading endeavor between the Viking and Moslem traders. Participants will be in the best re-enactment garb possible and will stay in character throughout the event.

name: Ten-Man Unbelted Melee Tournament
description_book: Squires are allowed (not considered belted). Teams register by kingdom or household. Round robin-style depending on number of teams entering.
description_web: Ten-man unbelted melee tournament. Squires are allowed (not considered belted). Teams register by kingdom or household. Round robin-style depending on number of teams entering.

name: Thrown Weapons Champions War Point
description_book: Thrown Weapons Champions War Point.

name: Knowne Worlde Ladies of the Rose Tournament
description_book: Each Rose will sponsor one unbelted heavy fighter and one non-White Scarf duellist. The tourney will be run in a Bedford points-style. 1 pm sign-in.
description_web:
Sign in table opens at 1 pm. 
Roses, Diamonds, Edelweiss, etc., are welcome to be a part of the tourney as are all sitting Queens and Princesses, both Heirs and Territorials who are not yet members of the Orders.
Each Rose will sponsor one unbelted heavy fighter and one non-White Scarf (or White Scarf equivalent) duellist; i.e., they cannot be the recipient of your kingdom’s highest level rapier award.   
The tourney will be run in a Bedford points-style to maximize the number of bouts for the fighters.
The tourney will be run to Atlantian/Eastern standards.

name: Empire of the Sun Battle
description_book: Japanese tournament and battle.
description_web: Japanese tournament and battle.

name: Afternoon Youth Combat
description_book: Afternoon Youth Combat
description_web: Afternoon Youth Combat

name: Beginner Russian Calligraphy
description_book: The basics of medieval Russian calligraphy. Learn the basics of writing the Old Church Slavonic alphabet.
description_web: The basics of medieval Russian calligraphy. Learn the basics of writing the Old Church Slavonic alphabet. There will also be a handout for Russian-style English alphabet. The hands-on portion of the class is limited to 15 people. Please bring your calligraphy supplies if you have them. I will have a limited amount of loaner nibs and/or markers and paper.

name: Knowne World Equestrian Meeting
description_book: Calling all equestrians! Join us for discussion about equestrian activities in the SCA. What's new, what's happening, and who's involved.

name: Quick and Easy Handmade Largesse
description_book: A discussion about largesse: why we should give it, why you should make it, and what options are out there. We will make a couple of examples.
description_web: A discussion about largesse: why we should give it, why you should make it, and what options are out there. We will make a couple of examples.
fee_itemization: Wire, beads, findings, ribbon, felt, thread

name: Gluten-Free Recipes from Period Sources
description_book: Discuss gluten-free recipes from medieval cookbooks using period ingredients and substitutions. Food samples may be available!
description_web: Discuss gluten-free recipes from medieval cookbooks, using period ingredients and substitutions. Food samples may be available!

name: Garbing the Full-Sized Goddess
description_book: Historic fashions that favored women who weren't 'missing no meals' and instructions on how to create flattering garb for the larger lady.
description_web: In current fashion, we all know that thin is in. However, that wasn't always the case. This class will look at various historic periods when the ideal of beauty was ladies who weren't 'missing no meals'. The second half of the class will be instruction on how to create flattering garb for the larger lady.

name: Evolution of Black Powder Arms from 1320-1600
description_book: History and development of black powder arms from 1320-1600. This is a **non**-shooting lecture/discussion class covering period firearm technology.
description_web: History and development of black powder arms from 1320-1600. This is a **non**-shooting lecture/discussion class covering period firearm technology. Handouts for all classes: http://www.3fgburner.net/#info.

name: Advanced Henna Body Art
description_book: We will focus on period exemplars, a survey of modern styles and where they came from, and suiting your henna to your persona.
fee_itemization: $5 per student for a henna cone; this is my mundane bulk rate.

name: Very Basic Naalbinding
description_book: Introduction to naalbinding. For those with no prior experience. I will demonstrate a simple naalbinding stitch and discuss the basic techniques.
description_web: Introduction to naalbinding. For those with no prior experience. Naalbinding is a craft which creates a stretchy fabric by using a large sewing needle and yarn. This predates knitting and is found in a variety of medieval cultures. I will demonstrate a simple naalbinding stitch and discuss the basic techniques.

name: Research Tools for the Independent Scholar
description_book: Fast-paced introduction to free, low cost, or easily available online resources for assisting with your documentation and research.
description_web: You may or may not have a university library at your disposal, but if you want to tackle in-depth historical/material culture research, there are an expanding number of tools and tricks out there to help you find and manage resources. A long time reference librarian and researcher will cram her favorites into this session. Most are free, some are low cost or available through many libraries. Audience participation welcome.

name: *Kosode* Construction
description_book: An essential garment in every *nihonjin* wardrobe! We’ll discuss construction of this Japanese garment, based on a Tokyo National Museum example.
description_web: An essential garment in every *nihonjin* wardrobe! We’ll discuss construction of this Japanese garment, based on a Tokyo National Museum example. The predecessor to the kimono, the *kosode* was worn by both men and women throughout most of Japanese history. A visual, step-by-step example of its construction will be presented. Extra time is allotted for consultations. Please bring along your own materials, if you would like assistance starting your pattern. If you have questions prior to the class, please contact me at yamamura.kitsune@gmail.com.
fee_itemization: Handout of class outline with garment instructions.

name: Intermediate English Country Dances
description_book: Three dances from Playford 1: *Grimstock, Hyde Park, Goddesses*. Fun to do, and fun to watch. There is a bit more to these.
description_web: This class will present three English country dances from the first edition of the Playford dance manual: *Grimstock, Hyde Park*, and *Goddesses*. They are fun to do and fun to watch. There is a bit more to these.

name: Known World Players: Open Auditions, Pennsic 45
description_book: The Known World Players is seeking actors to audition for Pennsic 45's production of Ben Jonson’s riotous Elizabethan comedy, *The Alchemist*.
description_web: The Known World Players is seeking actors to audition for next year’s production of Ben Jonson’s riotous Elizabethan comedy of cons and swindlers, *The Alchemist*. Women and men of teen age and up are welcome. Audition material will be provided.

name: Rehearsal (Closed): KWC Chorulus Pennsicus
description_book: Closed Rehearsals, by Audition Only.
description_web:
Closed Rehearsals by Audition Only; FYI Only. Director, Lord Cailin mac Andreis.
Chorulus Pennsicus information available here: https://sites.google.com/site/kwcpennsicchoir/home/pennsic-choir/chorulus-pennsicus

name: Telling Stories as Your Persona
description_book: How to tell stories in a way that creates the illusion of a period story being told to a period audience, along with a discussion of sources.
description_web: How to tell stories in a way that creates the illusion of a period story being told to a period audience, along with a discussion of sources.

name: Rapier Instructors' Roundtable
description_book: In this open roundtable discussion, we'll cover topics such as how to structure more efficient rapier practices and create worthwhile classes.
description_web: Open to all, but specifically targeted toward rapier instructors, this roundtable forum will focus on discussing and exchanging strategies for training fencers, running more efficient practices, and structuring special interest classes. A list of topics for discussion will be provided, but instructors will be encouraged to bring their questions, concerns, and ideas to the table. This activity will be lightly moderated in order that conversation remain on topic and productive, but will otherwise remain open to all constructive participation.

name: Arabic  101
description_book: To have knowledge on the very basic foundations of the Arabic language.

name: Ninja: Truth from Shadows
description_book: Dare you look into the shadows of history to find the truth? Come to discover both the legends and real history of Japan's famed assassins. New info!
description_web: Dare you look into the shadows of history to find the truth? Come to discuss and discover both legends and the real history of Japan's famed spies and assassins. This class will examine the romanticized image of the Ninja and discuss the actual history of the world's most famous spies.

name: 14th-Century Alliterative Poetry
description_book: Join the "Alliterative Revival"! Learn about the "Alliterative Long Line" - a high medieval poetic style with its roots in Anglo-Saxon poetry.
description_web: Chaucer wasn’t the only game in town for poetry in the 14th century. Join the "Alliterative Revival"! The “Alliterative Long Line” was a poetry style evocative of Anglo-Saxon verse, but with the distinctive imagery of the 14th century. We will discuss how to create the alliterative long line that appears in many poems from this period, as well as how to blend it with rhyming poetry such as in “Sir Gawain and the Green Knight”.

name: Conquest of the Americas
description_book: This course examines the cultural and social organization of pre-Conquest Iberia, Mesoamerica, Brazil, Andean Highlands and West Africa.
description_web: This course examines the cultural and social organization of pre-Conquest Iberia, Mesoamerica, Brazil, Andean Highlands and West Africa. It explores the multiple interpretations of the Conquest through the eyes of Spanish conquistadors, their Indian allies, Incas, Mexicans, Tainos, Mayas, Tupis, Guarani and West Africans, and analyzes the multi-ethnic institutional foundation of New Spain, Brazil and Peru which was governed as an unequal partnership between Europeans and indigenous elites.

name: Known World Beekeepers Gathering
description_book: Join fellow beekeepers to swap tips and tales from the field. Please bring a sample of your own honey to share.

name: *Seppuku*: Salvation Through the Door of Pain.
description_book: A discussion of the ritual and use of ceremonial suicide within period.
description_web: A discussion of the ritual and use of ceremonial suicide within period.

name: Mentor Chirurgeon Meeting
description_book: Mentor Chirurgeon Meeting.

name: Afternoon Yoga: Bring a Partner If You've Got One!
description_book: Partner yoga can be a way of advancing your practice, having a great workout with a friend, or meeting a new one if willing. Singles welcome.
description_web: Partner yoga can be a way of advancing your practice, having a great workout with a friend, or meeting a new one if willing. Singles welcome. Bring a yoga strap or belt, as well as a mat or towel for each participant. Yoga can help us through the rigors of war--regardless of our activities. Please dress for modesty. Children may attend with a parent/guardian if they both participate.

name: Tulstin Troubadours in Concert!

description_web: Tulstin Troubadours in concert on harp, hurdy gurdy, bowed psaltery, and more!  Professional musicians Tulstin Troubadours (Apryl Knight/Aibreán Póirtéir, Mark the Harper, and Demaris) are excited to present their first performance at the Pennsic stage. They will share songs from their albums. Look for harp, pan flute, hurdy gurdy, bowed psaltery, guitar, fife, flute, and any other instruments they can work into the show!

name: From Bees to Booze (Part 1)
description_book: Mead Making 101: Preparation, selection of materials, and records. Make your first batch of mead. Take home a 1-gallon batch home with you!
description_web:
This class will be broken into three sections: preparation, selection of materials, and record keeping.

The preparation section will cover what materials are required, what equipment is essential vs. just convenient, as well an extensive "what not to do" list.

The selection of materials section: This section will cover where to get your honeys, how to source your fruit, how to score bargains or barter, as well as examples of which honeys blend well with one another and in what ratios.

And finally, we'll work on record keeping - simply suggestions on how to develop your own recipes.

Please bring notebook and pen/paper. Handouts can be written on, but it is not advised.

Each student will be asked to place their name in for a drawing at this class for a complete beginners brewing kit from MIdwest Brewing Supply.  1 kit given per class.
fee_itemization:
Jugs+Airlocks $15
Yeast Packets $4 (2 types of yeast available.)
8 oz honey $10
1 Gal distilled water $1

name: Anglo-Saxon Context: Franks Carolingia Merovingia
description_book: Neighboring cultures inform us about the Anglo-Saxons. We'll focus on the Merovingian, Carolingian, and other Frankish interactions with England.
description_web: To understand Anglo-Saxons we need to understand the people with whom they interacted, what came before and after. This series of workshops looks at the surrounding cultures through the lens of their interaction with the Anglo-Saxons. This workshop focuses on the Merovingian, Carolingian, Holy Roman Empire, and other Frankish kingdoms, and how that interaction impacted the Anglo-Saxons.

description_web: Wire weaving, bead wrapping and more.

description_web: Part 3: New foam loom is taught with new braid structures. Square loom used.

name: Counted Work Not Displayed at the Met

description_web: The Metropolitan Museum has interesting embroideries not displayed to the public, but I was able to photograph some, including a few reverse sides. Since the Met does not allow copies of the photos to be given out, the handout will include some charts instead. These items and fragments sometimes have interesting differences from those the public sees.

name: The Bayeux Tapestry
description_book: This class will touch on all aspects of the tapestry. History, construction and hints to show how anyone can do a tapestry.
description_web: This class will touch on all aspects of the tapestry. History, construction and hints to show how anyone can do a tapestry or a small piece of it.

description_web: A brief overview of five extant textiles from *Altenburg an der Lahn* Convent.  Looking at German linen on linen white work embroidery, its techniques and uses.  Followed by a hands-on tutorial and take-home project using chain and interwoven herringbone stitches.
fee_itemization: kit with take home project - linen cloth, thread and needles for a project utilizing the stitches learned in class.

name: Historical Uses of Poisons
description_book: A rundown of the weaponization of poisons in history garnered from various resources.
description_web: A review of the weaponization of poisonous plants (and two rocks) as recorded in history. A summary garnered from various resources, the compilation paints a unique picture of warfare and weaponization techniques from several cultures.

name: Adult Doll Meet
description_book: This class is geared towards adults that collect or want to collect dolls. Please bring your favorite doll to the meet.
description_web: This class is geared towards adults that collect or want to collect dolls. Please bring your favorite doll, as we will be making something special for them. Adults only because doll hobbies can be expensive.

name: Anglo Saxon Vessel
description_book: Make an Anglo Saxon vessel, decorated with clay stamps.
description_web: Make an Anglo Saxon vessel and decorate it with clay stamps, to be fired after Pennsic and mailed to you.

name: The Cathars
description_book: We examine such questions as "Who were the Cathars and what did they believe?  What impact did they have on history?"
description_web: The subject of numerous popular fiction novels and conspiracy theories, the Cathars were a religious sect from the medieval period. Declared heretics, they were the subject of intense persecution by the Roman Catholic Church. This class will examine such questions as "Who were the Cathars and what did they believe?  What impact did they have on history?"

name: If Looks Could Kill: Evil Eye Amulets
description_book: The history of amulets used against the Evil Eye through many cultures and time periods.
description_web: The history of amulets used against the Evil Eye through many cultures and time periods. Discussion of the amulet types plus scholars' deductions of why those amulets are the size, shape or color and style. Class for adults only. Reason: Some amulets are phallic in nature. Some discussion of male and female anatomy. Photos and objects of a phallic nature.

name: Gathering of the Louds
description_book: Shawms, sackbuts and curtals - oh my! The traditional gathering of loud instruments for group ensemble playing continues. Not for beginners....
description_web: Shawms, sackbuts and curtals - oh my! The traditional gathering of loud instruments for group ensemble playing continues. Not for beginners.... Bring music if you have any ensemble pieces you might like to try. Bring a chair.

name: Advanced Beginning Reed Basket-Making
description_book: Learn to weave a reed basket. Complete and take your basket with you.
description_web: Weave a reed basket from beginning to end and take your basket with you. Learn techniques for using round reeds to construct baskets as well as the history of reed basket making.

name: Children's Dance: Miscellaneous
description_book: It's never too early to learn to dance! Come learn dances fun for all ages. (Any youth in attendance require a responsible adult present.)

description_web: Learn how to create a Middle Eastern dance for performance. This class will teach you the steps for simple dance creation. Please come prepared to dance. Strong beginners or above.

description_web: Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and weave an inkle strip. Classroom loaner looms available or bring your own.

description_web: If you passed kindergarten art class, you can draw a 14th-century French scroll. This class will break down the elements and have you leaving confident and ready to illuminate.

name: Heralds and Scribes - Oh My!
description_book: Learn how a herald and scribe team work together to make both of their jobs easier by making scroll creation and court run a bit smoother.
description_web: In this class you will get to pick the brain of one half of a herald/scribe partnership. Learn the lessons we learned from working separately and how we overcame obstacles. This not only made our jobs easier but helped to create a smoother process, thus avoid making mistakes.

name: 14th-Century Purse Embellishments
description_book: A survey of embellishment and embroidery styles and techniques for purses of the 14th century.

description_book: Drawing on historic artwork, this class will provide an overview of *cholis* followed by pattern construction demonstrations for two different styles.
description_web: Drawing on historic artwork, this class will provide an overview of a selection of women's *choli*/upper body garments, covering a broad range of times and places within medieval India. Documentation gained from historic artwork will be discussed followed by a demonstration of pattern construction to ensure a well-fitting and comfortable garment.

name: Plagues of Europe: Really, There Was More Than One
description_book: Focuses on the types of plagues, their origins, biological mechanisms, means of transmission and long term impact on the affected populations.
description_web: Measles, small pox, bubonic plague and leprosy each had a devastating impact on the affected population physically, psychologically, spiritually, and economically. This class focuses on the origins, biological mechanisms, means of transmission and long term impact on the affected populations. When early man lived in relatively isolated groups, contact between individuals was infrequent and short-lived diseases (for either the disease or the host) were not able to spread by direct contact or through intermediaries such as rats, mosquitoes, etc. As people began to live closer together in towns, later in cities, and when sanitation became more of a threat to health, transmission of diseases became easier and more common. Resistant individuals lived and the less-resistant died, thus selectively increasing resistance in the population as a whole. The gradually declining death toll seen in recurrences of a particular plague was due to an increase in resistance within the population due to several factors. Modern medical investigations indicate that the same genetic makeup that allowed some people to survive or avoid bubonic plague are the same genetic makeup that allows some people be HIV positive and not develop AIDS.
fee_itemization: Printed handouts of 16-18 pages includes some color pages

name: Share the Love: Tokens of Appreciation
description_book: Share ideas for tokens/largesse to give to those who inspire you. Students encouraged to bring examples of tokens they have given or received.
description_web: Share ideas for tokens/largesse to give to those who inspire you. Students encouraged to bring examples of tokens they have given or received.

name: Elizabethan Pronunciation
description_book: Early Modern English pronunciation reveals “new” rhymes and puns in literature and songs of the period. Come and hear for yourself!
description_web: In this overview of Early Modern English pronunciation trends, we will hear how rhymes and puns emerge from period literature when originally pronounced, and we’ll touch briefly on Tudor singing practices as relating to treatment of the language. Come and hear how “raising” rhymes with “reason!”

instructor: Lady Angharad verch Glyndwr O Llang

description_book: Basics on design/recreation of jewelry including closures, spacing, double/triple strands, scalloping, extra adornments, fixing broken items.
description_web: Basics on design or recreation of jewelry including closures, spacing, double/triple strands, achieving scalloping, adding extra adornments, fixing a broken item, making a floating bead necklace, dropping a knot where you want it.
fee_itemization: Kit with wire, string, beads, trinkets, closures

name: Advanced Equestrian Activities
description_book: An over-view of the newest equestrian activities to be practiced in the SCA.
description_web:
This class is an over-view of the newest equestrian activities to be practiced in the 
SCA. These activities are currently experimental and several Kingdoms are participating. We will cover Wood Jousting, Mounted to Ground Combat and Additional Simulators for Mounted Combat. The activities will be described and their over-all effect of the equestrian program will be discussed.

name: Digitizing and Translating 16th-Century Dance
description_book: I've been working for 20 years to digitize everything related to 16th-century dance, to make reconstruction easier. Come hear about it!

name: Warping a Warp-Weighted Loom
description_book: Warp-weighted looms can be imposingly large and strange. Let's learn how to warp one on a smaller and more human scale.
description_web: A full-size warp-weighted loom, as built in period, can be imposingly large and strange. We're going to learn how to warp one on a smaller and more human scale. We'll be working in pairs, with space for up to 12 people working hands-on. We'll have a follow-up class with hands-on practice weaving on the warp we've created.

name: Introduction to *Go*
description_book: A basic introduction to the Japanese game of *Go*.
description_web: A basic introduction to the Japanese game of *Go*.

name: Spinners Anonymous, a.k.a Spinning for Cat-Herders
description_book: All spinners welcome to trade tips, learn technique and practice supported and drop spinning, with stone or clay whorl spindles; child-friendly camp.
description_web: Wanted to take a spinning class, but couldn't find a sitter? Made it to that class, but want more practice with an experienced spinner? All spinners of all levels are invited to take part in this practicum on using the medieval spindle with clay or stone whorls for supported and drop spinning. Bring your own or use mine!  Spindles, whorls, wool and hand distaffs available. Cotton and flax spinning may also be discussed if there is an interest. Children are welcome to come play with mine while you play with fiber! Located in cool, shaded E-28 block.

name: Storytelling Academy
description_book: Explore genres, tools, styles, and uses of storytelling. Cultural and medieval approaches, applications, performance coaching. New topics each day.
description_web: During this nine-day academy, students will gain knowledge about the history and techniques for storytelling both in the SCA and the modern world. Students may attend individual sessions or all of the academy. There will be guest teachers and time for students to practice and receive feedback. The academy will culminate in a student performance. No classes are repeated. The focus is on comfort, nurturing, and honing skills within the students’ capabilities. All levels are welcome. Students may pick up a class outline at the academy space, Minerva’s Spindle 158, where classes will also be listed on the message board. Seating is limited; feel free to bring your own chair.

name: Singing in Foreign Tongues 101
description_book: Period music for singers, in languages other than modern English. Resources and advice for singing, say, Latin drinking songs around your campfire.
description_web: Previously 'But Mom, I don't want to sing in English!'. Period music for singers to encourage the singing of random Latin drinking songs, among others, around your campfire. Not just for bards! Let's all sing in Catalan! We will review the big sources for songs ( *Carmina Burana*, *Cantigas de Santa Maria*, *Llibre Vermell de Montserrat*, etc.), sing a few, and discuss helpful hints to your success.

name: Weed Walk
description_book: Wild plant identification. Wear walking shoes and hat; leave from Univ. Point. Different teachers on different days; walk with us more than once!
description_web: Cooper's Lake abounds with medicinal and food plants that were used by various primitive and medieval cultures. Learn to identify them during a walk around the campsite. The walk will take place rain or shine. Please wear sturdy shoes and a hat. Meet at University Point for the start of the class. We have three wonderful new teachers this year, enabling us to offer this class more times!

name: A Droll Challenge: Itty Bitty People
description_book: For the moderately experienced scribe who finds creating drolleries a challenge. Please bring your own materials.
description_web: When creating your scrolls, do you find yourself choosing the style without pictures of people or other creatures because you just can't get them to look right? Or, perhaps, you haven't even tried because you never got past stick figure drawing. Allow me to share my tricks of the trade and maybe, just maybe, help you take that next step into the art form that we love. (Please bring your own paper, pencils, and gouache.)
fee_itemization: Donations for handouts would be most appreciated!

name: Rehearsal (Closed): Pennsic *Commedia* All Stars
description_book: Space in use.
description_web: Space in use.

name: Archery Populace War Point

description_web: All archers young and old are encouraged to come and lend their support to their kingdom's efforts, and to display their skill at archery. There will be three challenging populace shoots to test skills. Each Kingdom will be competing to earn the three War Points for each shoot.

name: *Zidian* and *Cidian*: Chinese Dictionaries
description_book: Brief history of Chinese dictionaries, explanation of how they work, hands-on practice in using them. Chinese language useful but not needed.
description_web: A brief history of Chinese dictionaries, an explanation of how they work and hands-on practice in how to use them. Chinese language experience useful but not required. Bring characters you've been struggling with, since I'm going to have a number of dictionaries on hand. *Kanji* and *hanja* also welcome, although meanings may vary from the Chinese usage.

name: Veil Pins, Hair Pins and Hair Twisties, Oh My!
description_book: Learn how to make glass-headed veil pins, hair pins and glass hair twisties. Must wear closed-toed shoes and long sleeves.
description_web: Lear how to make glass-headed veil pins, hair pins and glass hair twisties. You will have the opportunity to make five veil pins, one hair pin and a hair twistie. Please bring your own corsage pins if you would like to make more!

name: Edge Your Veil
description_book: Veil edges from the simple rolled edge to ruffles and beads. Learn some "how-tos". Practice rolled edges on a cup cover.
description_web: Veils were on almost every woman's head in period and they had a variety of different edges. From a simple rolled edge, we will do the "perfect rolled hem" and explore a variety of other, more complicated edges. Practice rolled edges on a cup cover.
fee_itemization: Kit to include silk or linen, needle, thread and beads

name: A Lace *Sauntor Brod*
