description_web: This is an advanced one-person fingerloop braid from the Tollemache manuscript. It makes a flat braid with a lovely pattern of X-shapes and diamonds. As this is an advanced braid, students should already be comfortable with making basic fingerloop braids on their own.
fee_itemization: The fee is for string to make one braid.

name: Irish Woman's Dilemma: What Do I Wear?
description_book: An intro to clothing that an Irish Woman would wear. Spans from about 500 to 1600.
description_web: Many want to have an Irish persona because Ireland has a rich and interesting history, beautiful music and stories, and complex and interesting art. Yet, when I went to try and make my persona more historically accurate in dress, I found a dearth of concrete evidence and little research of the subject. I decided to find as many sources as I could, compile what I found, and try to present a reasonable approximation of what the Irish would have worn throughout our period. This class will give an overview from early to late period on what I believe a typical Irish woman would have worn, as well as provide a list of resources for you to explore on your own. Note: I will be updating this class with new information so it is probably valuable to take it again even if you have already taken it!
fee_itemization: Cost to offset printing cost of handout, will likely be 10+pages

name: Basic Period Ballads
description_book: Focuses on a small repertoire of period ballads from the British Isles. We will also explore elements of period ballads.
description_web: Learn some period ballads for your next bardic circle or your random stroll through the market place. Students will be provided with a small repertoire of ballads in the class handout (lyrics and sheet music). Recordings of ballads taught in the class and a collection of over 200 period songs will be available for purchase ($10 each).

name: German Saxon Gown
description_book: The construction techniques and layers I used to create the iconic German Saxon Gown of the 1520s
description_web: The construction techniques and layers I used to create the iconic German Saxon Gown of the 1520s from skin out.

name: Magic as a Performing Art
description_book: Introduction to magic by professional magician. Ethics and theory of magic. Three period tricks taught. Class sworn to secrecy.
description_web: Theory and practice of magic as a performance art, taught by a professional magician. We will cover three period tricks from Scot’s *Discoverie of Witchcraft*, 1584, for close-up, parlor, and stage. The class will be sworn to secrecy and real working methods will be taught.

name: Tools of the Flame
description_book: Discussion course designed to aid the beginning beadworker. Includes the tools, equipment and materials needed to begin making glass beads.
description_web: Discussion course designed to aid the beginning beadworker. We will discuss the tools, equipment and materials needed to begin making glass beads. Perfect for someone who may be thinking of flamework as a hobby, but unsure of the tools needed and their costs.

name: Harp Techniques
description_book: Historical info and techniques: Improve strength, speed, tone, musicality. Useful for all harpers, beginner to advanced. Chairs may not be available
description_web: Techniques to improve strength, speed, tone and musicality. Historical information about harps, the men and women who played them, and their music. Useful for all harpers, complete beginner to advanced. Learn how to get more out of your instrument and practice time, as well as practical approaches to performing. This is one of a 3-part course. We will build on information from each class, but students are not required to attend all three. Feel free to contact teacher in advance if you know you'll miss one. Chairs may not be available. Please bring chairs/harpstands if possible.
fee_itemization: Exercises for use in class, during Pennsic, and afterward. Reading music, counting, fingering, etc.

name: Italian 2 Cs
description_book: Learn *Chirintana* and *Colonnese* which are examples of the country and courtly traditions in 15th-century Italy.

name: Beyond Lucet Basics
description_book: Variations, loops, and monkey wrenches.
description_web: Starts with a basic refresher class for everyone. We then proceed to variations, loops, and monkey wrenches. Classroom loaner lucets available or bring your own. String provided.

name: Ansteorran Rapier Tourney
description_book: The annual Ansteorran rapier tourney. Format will be double elimination. HRM Antigone requests that all entrants bring their best weapon style.

name: Intro to 6-on-2 Chainmail
description_book: This type of chainmail was prevalent in period across multiple cultures. All materials provided but bring two pairs of pliers.
description_web: Intro class for 6-on-2 chainmail prevalent throughout period across multiple cultures. All materials necessary to complete class project provided but bring two pairs of standard box nose pliers if you have them. Tools are available for those who don't have them on a first-come first-served basis.
fee_itemization: Sufficient hand-turned & cut aluminum rings, 12ga 5/8 in diameter, to complete class project.

name: *Saz* Workshop
description_book: Workshop for beginner and experienced *saz* players.
description_web: Basic techniques and melodies for beginners. Traditional long-neck and short-neck playing techniques. Experienced *saz* players are encouraged to share insights, techniques, and more complex melodies.

name: Armoured Woods Battle
description_book: 75-minute resurrection battle, running north-south, lower and upper woods allowed. Three banners.
description_web:
75-minute resurrection battle, running north-south, lower and upper woods allowed.
** Army that is trailing in points determines their resurrection zone after the rapier heroic champions. **
• There will be two resurrection zones. (One on each side in the lower woods.) Sides will start in their own resurrection areas.
• No fighting within 20 yards of the resurrection zone. Troops may deploy up to 20 yards into the woods from resurrection zones.
• No fighting on the extreme embankments.
• All holds local, except for medical.
• West road is dead / EMS only.
• The Crowns (or representative) will verify the positions of the banners 30 minutes prior to the battle.
• One point will be awarded per banner at the end of the battle.
• No combat archery, no siege.

name: Insults in Old Norse-Icelandic Literature
description_book: How to insult your friends, enemies, or the gods while starting interesting blood-feuds. An overview of the use of insults in the Elder Edda and Sagas

name: On the Evolution of Jewish Names
description_book: This class traces the evolution of Jewish names from the simple names in the Bible to the modern form of Given Name and Surname.
description_web: This class traces the evolution of Jewish names from the simple names in the Bible, through the Babylonian Diaspora, the Greco-Roman and Talmudic period, and the Middle Ages (European and Arabic forms) to the modern form of Given Name and Surname. Name forms in a number of times and cultures will be discussed. The course is intended to be useful to both heralds dealing with clients and to those interested in creating their own period persona name.
fee_itemization: The fee represents the cost of printing the 18-page handout.

name: Recreating Anglo-Saxon Glass Beads
description_book: Class begins with an overview of resources and information on Anglo-Saxon glass beads. We will then spend time recreating a few beads.
description_web:
This class will begin with an overview of resources and information on Anglo-Saxon glass beads. I will review different bead types and information about how necklace styles changed over time during the Anglo-Saxon period. I will bring some of my own projects and documentation to share with the class in the hopes of encouraging students to take up some Anglo-Saxon-related recreation projects. During the second half of the class we will spend some time recreating a few Anglo-Saxon beads. 
I only have 4 lampworking kits, but anyone is invited to attend to listen/watch. Please feel free to bring your own lampworking kit if you want to participate in the hands-on portion of the class. I will work with students to pick beads to recreate based on the skill level of the students and the class as a whole, but attendees should (at the very least) know how to make and shape a basic bead. More experienced lampworkers are encouraged to help out during the hands-on portion of the class and to bring any Anglo-Saxon-related resources and projects to share with the group.

name: History of Hops
description_book: Learn about the history of hops, where they grew, how they were used, and when they became a "necessary" ingredient in brewing.
description_web: While hops are ubiquitous in modern beer brewing, that wasn't always the case. In fact, there were laws to prevent non-hop brewing pubsters from beating up hop-brewing pubsters in 15th-century England. Learn about the history of hops in Europe, where they grew, how they were used, and when they became a "necessary" ingredient in brewing. Hopless beer will be available for tasting for those 21 and older for $1.

name: Women and Medicine Before 1650: An Introduction
description_book: Basic introduction: Evidence of women in period theory and practice of medicine as practitioners and patients. Sex will be mentioned.
description_web: What evidence is there regarding pre-1650 medicine and women in medical theory? Women as medical practitioners? Women as patients? The practice of midwifery, obstetrics and gynecology? Women as medical attendants, etc? This outline touches on what we do know, some historiographic myths, and where to find out more. Primarily focused on mainland European history. Attendee discussion welcome. Age of discretion warning: gender, sex, and gynecology will be discussed.

name: Advanced Viking Knitting: Roundtable
description_book: This is a roundtable on Advanced Viking Knitting. Prior experience with Basic Viking Knitting is required.
description_web: This is a roundtable on Advanced Viking Knitting. Prior experience with Basic Viking Knitting is required.

name: Event Finances: Before, During and After
description_book: From budget to gate to the event report: A practical discussion of event finances, based on Chapter 9 of the *Local Exchequer Handbook*.

name: Construction of a Florentine Sottana for Beginners
description_book: Using Margo Anderson’s "Italian Renaissance Lady’s Wardrobe" pattern, we will cover techniques for this pattern, and modifications for authenticity.
description_web:
This class will cover how to use Margo Anderson’s "Italian Renaissance Lady’s Wardrobe" pattern to construct a Florentine *Sottana*. This class is appropriate for those who are new to 16th-century Italian fashion, or are otherwise unable to draft/drape their own pattern. We will cover techniques for working with this pattern, tips based on my experience using both this pattern and custom-drafted patterns, and ways to make this pattern more period correct.
NOTE: Purchase of pattern prior to class is not necessary; however, you can contact the instructor by email at kataryn AT kitsclothingcollection DOT com for instructions on how to receive a discount on your purchase of this pattern from margospatterns DOT com.

name: English Ball
description_book: Mostly dances from Playford with some Inns of Court and Gresley. All will have been taught previously but each will be reviewed beforehand.
description_web: We will do mostly dances from Playford with some Inns of Court and Gresley. All will have been taught previously at the War but each dance will be reviewed on the floor before we start dancing. There will be a variety of difficulty levels to keep all interested.

location: Denys the Decadent (Denys the Decadent's Camp)
name: 12-Step Meetings
description_book: 12-step meeting open to all recovery programs. AA, NA, OA, GA, SA, Alanon, etc.
description_web: Open meeting; all are welcome. 12-step meeting open to all recovery programs: AA, NA, OA, GA, SA, Alanon, etc.

name: Beginning *Repoussé* and Chasing
description_book: Hands-on class; will make a copper foil rose.
description_web: Hands-on class; will make a copper foil rose.

name: Come and Get Your Fill
description_book: Take your doumbek rhythms to the next level! This class focuses on playing "fills" and filled versions of popular Middle Eastern rhythms.
description_web:
Take your *darbuka*/doumbek rhythms to the next level! This intermediate class will help you begin to play filled versions of popular Middle Eastern rhythms. Then you will learn to play fills in between phrases/patterns to help you add even more style and texture to your playing.

Knowledge of basic Middle Eastern rhythms (i.e., *maqsoum, malfuf, ayoub, saidi*) and intermediate *darbuka* playing experience/technique are strongly recommended.

name: Mini-Bardic Madness
description_book: If you can't come to Bardic Madness, it can come to you. The challenges for one Fyt of Madness are at http://tilted-windmill.com/mini_madness.html.
description_web: Heard about Bardic Madness, but been unable to attend? Now's your chance. We will be answering one Fyt of Madness at Pennsic. The challenges for it can be found at http://tilted-windmill.com/mini_madness.html. This is an excellent opportunity for new and experienced performers alike. Gentles wishing to participate as a supportive audience are most welcome to attend.

name: Rehearsal (Closed): KWC Dress Rehearsal
description_book: Space in use.
description_web: Space in use.

name: Intermediate Middle Eastern Drumming: 7/8 and 10/8
description_book: Add to your drumming repertoire: rhythms played in 7/8 and 10/8. "Samai", "Curcuna", "Laz", and variations are covered. Beginners welcome.

name: Scribal Bootcamp
description_book: Hands-on instruction and practice making an SCA-style scroll start to finish, working closely with an experienced scribe from concept to completion.
description_web: Hands-on instruction and practice making an SCA-style scroll from start to finish, working closely with an experienced scribe from concept and wording to calligraphy, drawing and painting, to completion. This is a class for beginners (with some small experience) to intermediate scribes looking to improve their skills at putting pencil, paint and ink to paper. Class size will be limited! Please sign up at Æthelmearc hospitality the morning of class.

name: A Stick Up Their A&S
description_book: A history of puppetry from the Greeks to the Elizabethans.
description_web: A historical look at the forms of puppetry used throughout the different cultures and time periods represented by the SCA. Handout includes puppetry vocabulary and a timeline.

name: Introduction to Kingdom-Level Commenting in OSCAR
description_book: This class is intended for beginner-level heralds to learn the basics of positive and helpful in-kingdom commenting in OSCAR.
description_web:
This class is intended for beginner-level heralds to learn the basics of positive and helpful in-kingdom commenting in OSCAR. Learn who to contact about getting into the commentary system, best practices for commentary, and how to not be That Person in an online commentary discussion.

This class does not cover Laurel-level commentary.

name: Woodworking Hand Tools
description_book: Demonstration of what simple hand tools and hand-made jigs you need to start period woodworking.
description_web: In this class I will show what simple hand tools you need to start period woodworking. I will also touch on simple jigs you can make for holding wood.

name: SCA Pinners: A Pinterest-Users Roundtable
description_book: Do you use Pinterest in your SCA research? Would you like to? Come meet other Pinners face-to-face to discuss tips, tricks, organization, and more.
description_web: Do you use Pinterest in your SCA research? Would you like to? Come meet other Pinners face-to-face to discuss tips, tricks, organization, and more. This roundtable is sponsored by, but not limited to, members of the SCA Pinners Facebook group.

name: The Very New Persona
description_book: You're brand, spanking new, and you don't know who you want to be? No worries! I'll talk through good starting points, and then we just chat. Relax!
description_web: You're brand, spanking new, and you don't know who or what you want to be? No worries! I'll talk through common considerations and good starting points for information. After we go through the basics, we just chat about our thoughts. Relax! It's not supposed to be work!

name: The Oxburgh Hangings
description_book: An overview of embroidered wall hangings associated with Mary, Queen of Scots, including the glimpse they offer into Elizabethan history and culture.
description_web: The Oxburgh Hangings, embroidered by two of the most exciting women in Elizabethan-era England, provide a rich and detailed glimpse into their lives and the culture of the day. But they also offer an enigmatic mystery regarding their creation.  Whether you are interested in embroidery, Elizabethan culture, or doing historical detective work, this class has something for you!

name: Intro to Free Embroidery
description_book: Hands-on kit class. Learn to sew outlines, filling techniques and decorative stitches. No experience whatsoever required!
description_web: This is an introduction to decorative embroidery done in the "free embroidery style" (which means not counted work). Each student will get a piece of fabric with a design printed on it, floss, a needle and a hoop. If you have scissors or your own hoop (4-6"), please bring them. If you need reading glasses, please also bring those. Stitches covered include back stitch, chain stitch, reverse chain, split stitch, satin stitch, fly stitch, lazy daisy and, if we are feeling adventurous, french knots. No experience whatsoever required!
fee_itemization: Kit includes: fabric, floss, needle, and wooden hoop.

name: Death Becomes Her
description_book: An in-depth look at the death culture of Europe during 1300 to 1500 based on the study of *The Danse Macabre des Femmes*, fr. 995.

name: Secrets in Messages
description_book: Survey of cryptography in historical period: Egyptian through Renaissance.
fee_itemization: To cover printing cost of a 10-page handout

name: Seeds in the Heart: Writing Japanese Poetry
description_book: A participatory exploration of Japanese poetics with poetic forms from the early classical period to the development of *tanka, haikai*, and *hokku*.
description_web: A participatory exploration of Japanese poetics. Includes Japanese poetry from the early classical period to the development of *tanka, haikai, hokku*, and *renga*. We will consider both formal poetic forms and less formal poetry. Learn about the role of *kigo, kiriji*, and *makurakotoba*. Participants will have an opportunity to experiment with creating their own poetry. Please bring writing materials.

name: Card-Weaving Basics
description_book: Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and, using cards, you will weave a trim strip.
description_web: Warp a loom and weave a small strap or trim piece. Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and weave a trim strip. Classroom loaner looms available or bring your own. Fee covers string and cards; take your work home with you.

name: Heckler's Tourney
description_book: Throwers compete, audience heckles them to make them laugh. Award given to best thrower and best hecklers.
description_web: Throwers compete one at a time while the audience heckles to make them laugh. Challenge to the thrower: try to throw straight while gritting your teeth. Challenge to hecklers: make them laugh (PG rated) and not be obnoxious. Award given to best thrower and best heckler.

name: Beginning Engraving
description_book: Hands-on class. Intro to tools, first cuts, graver control, hammer use.
description_web: Hands-on class. Intro to tools, first cuts, graver control. Student will learn both hand-held and hammer-struck engraving.

name: Belly *Raqs* Yoga
description_book: Take your technique to the next level with this yoga and technique fusion workout.  For strong beginners and up. Bring water and a yoga mat.
description_web: Take your technique to the next level with this yoga and technique fusion workout.  For strong beginners and up. Bring water and a yoga mat.

name: Standing Around with Your Thumb Up Their A&S
description_book: The anatomy, design and construction of period puppets.
description_web: A survey of the design of period puppets including historical techniques versus more modern construction. Will also include references on where and how to start building your own first set of period puppets.

name: Intermediate Gardening
description_book: Want to learn more about gardening? This class will continue where "Gardening for Beginners" left off: earthworms, composting, adaptation, and more.
description_web: If you know a few things about gardening, but feel you could learn some more, come and stop by. This class will continue where "Gardening for Beginners" left off. We will cover earthworm issues, plant adaptation, composting ratios, and more.

name: Beekeeping 101
description_book: So you want to start keeping bees. We've been through it and will tell you what to do, what not to do, and give you a few hard won tips.
description_web: So you want to start keeping bees. We've been through it and will tell you what to do, what not to do, and give you a few hard won tips.We will have equipment (but no bees) for you to play.

name: Beginning Glass Bead Making
description_book: Join us to learn how to make glass beads. This class is a hands-on, beginning course.
description_web: Join us to learn how to make glass beads using a hot head propane fueled torch. We will discuss how these beads were made in period and their significance. This is a hands-on class and all materials and equipment will be provided for use during this class. Required: hair pulled back; closed toe shoes; clothing appropriate for working with a flame, i.e., no hanging sleeves or bodice parts.

instructor: Mistress Arwen Evaine ferch Rhys ap Gwy
name: Traditional Norse Medical Practices
description_book: Collecting, storing, and preparation techniques of herbs and other medicinals, some dating back to saga times.
description_web: Medicine in Norway was surprisingly sophisticated back into saga times, compared with the Continent. We will look at the herbs/roots/barks/berries/fungi, etc., used in traditional healing, including preparation and administration of salves, syrups, teas and washes, poultices, and lots more. Magical healing will also be presented, as well as diseases and other health problems as known at the time.

name: The Fairy Tale and Legend Workshop
description_book: Will review period instances and sources of fairy tales and legends, and show how to re-construct tales which could have been told in period.
description_web: We will go briefly over the history and definitions of fairy tales and legends, instances of fairy tales in period, how to look for period sources of both, and how to identify and use motifs to construct/reconstruct tales which could have been told/recorded in period. The participants in the workshop will construct a fairy tale and a legend.

name: Ministerials: AoA for Service
description_book: The ministerials were Holy Roman folks who got and held arms by virtue of their usefulness as administrators. Learn more about these overlooked folks.
description_web: Many assume that one received and held noble rank because of their use in war, or for holding lands. Not necessarily true! The ministerials were Holy Roman folks who got and held arms by virtue of their usefulness as administrators of empires, duchies and all. Learn more about these overlooked folks and how a non-combatant SCAdian can be just as fitting and proper as a noble as any fighter.
fee_itemization: One handout of notes plus bibliography

name: Sisters in Arms: Women in Combat in Late Period
description_book: Learn about some of the many women who took up arms in the 14th and 15th centuries.
description_web: Learn about some of the many women who took up arms in the 14th and 15th centuries -- their roles, their reasons, and their styles.

name: Silversmithing
description_book: Students will make a pendant using cabochon semi-precious stones, sterling silver sheet and wire. Techniques include forming, hard soldering, finish.
description_web: Students will make a pendant using cabochon semi-precious stones which would have been available in period, and sterling silver sheet and wire. The processes include forming, silver soldering, and finishing and bezel setting
fee_itemization: Stones, silver sheet, bezel wire, loop wire, sol and custom cut stones (all vary in price by piece) but an average of $40 for all combined.

name: *Banchetti*: Herb Pie, Almond Pie and Fruit Pies
description_book: Herb pie (spinach, grapes, and figs), almond pie (wheat starch and raisins), and pies of grape, dates, and dried plums from the 1549 *Banchetti*.
description_web: Herb pie with spinach, grapes, and figs, an almond pie with wheat starch and raisins, and pies of grape, dates, and dried plums from the 1549 *Banchetti*.

name: Medieval Food Myths
description_book: Ever get sick of the old myth about people using spices because they were serving rotting meat? Then this is the class for you.
description_web: Ever get sick of the old myth about people using spices because they were serving rotting meat? Then this is the class for you.`

name: Beginner Dance: Review by Request
description_book: Having trouble remembering a dance you learned earlier? This is the place to be! We'll go back over any dance and maybe also teach you something new.

name: Ten-ish Anthems Everyone in the SCA Could Know
description_book: Ten (for sufficiently large values of ten) SCA anthems from around the Known World. We'll sing through them together.

name: Echoes of the Dumbek
description_book: Mark of Orluk Oasis will play a rhythm or phrase and the class repeats. Students may have a chance to "call" a phrase or rhythm if they wish.
description_web: Mark of Orluk Oasis will play a rhythm or phrase and the class repeats. Students may have a chance to "call" a phrase or rhythm if they wish.

name: Rapier Woods Battle
description_book: 65-minute resurrection battle (+/- 8 minutes). Three banners. Army trailing in points after Rapier Heroic chooses resurrection point the night before.
description_web:
65-minute resurrection battle (plus or minus 8 minutes). 
• Army that is trailing in points after the Rapier Heroic Champions on Wednesday determines their resurrection zone the night before.
• There will be two resurrection points (one on each side in the lower woods). Sides will start in their own resurrection areas.
• The Crowns (or representative) will verify the positions of the three banners 30 minutes prior to the battle.
• One point will be awarded per banner at the end of the battle to the side that has had possession at the majority of the time checks. If a banner's possession is evenly split, zero points will be awarded for that banner.
• Time checks will occur at semi-random times (+/- 8 minutes from 20, 40, and 65 minutes). The exact times for the checks will be determined before the battle by the MIC and kept secret.
• All holds local, save EMS holds. EMS holds, and only EMS holds, will stop the clock.
• RBGs will NOT be used.
• Death From Behind is allowed.

name: PA Afternoon Series: Storytelling Exhibition
description_book: An amazing afternoon display featuring a variety of storytellers from around the Known World!
description_web: An amazing afternoon display featuring a variety of storytellers from around the Known World!

name: *Commedia*: How to Write a Period Play
description_book: Traditional *commedia* didn't use scripts but brief outline summaries called scenarios. Learn the general plot lines and how you can write them.
description_web: *Commedia dell'Arte* has been called "the actor's theatre" because of its improvisation and lack of scripts. But it can also be "the writer's theatre". Learn about the brief outline summaries of the plot called scenarios, the general structure of a typical plot and how it can be molded into new forms, and how to write a brand new 16th-century play yourself - which we'll try doing! We'll also cover some of the more obscure plots from period troupes.

name: Conversational Russian
description_book: Covers the Russian alphabet and basic modern-day Russian conversational phrases, plus words and phrases more related to the SCA.
description_web: The class will cover the Russian alphabet and basic modern-day Russian conversational phrases, responses and questions. After that, we will go over words and phrases more related to the SCA which can be used to flavor one’s persona. There will be time reserved at the end of the class for questions.

name: Myths: Aztecs, Mayas and Incas
description_book: This is an introduction to the ancient civilizations of Mesoamerica and South America.
description_web:
This class is an introduction to the ancient civilizations of Mesoamerica and South America. However, it is not merely a survey of New World prehistoric cultures, but rather a discussion of current models pertaining to the rise of archaic states, the development of art and writing, and the cyclical nature of 
political power. Ultimately, the class will impart an anthropological framework for understanding social transformations over the last 3000 years in that 
area of the world we now call Latin America.

name: Medieval Beekeeper's Year
description_book: What needed to been done to maintain apiaries? This is a survey class about preparation, tending, harvesting, and overwintering bees in period.
description_web: What did the medieval beekeeper need to do in order to maintain their apiaries? This is a survey class about preparation, tending, harvesting, and overwintering bees in period. Handout is calendar.

name: Piracy in the SCA Era
description_book: Discussion about piracy, from its origins to the death of Queen Elizabeth. We go into piracy, privateers, famous pirates, political influence.
description_web: This class will talk about piracy from its origins to the death of Queen Elizabeth. We go into piracy, privateers, famous pirates, political influence. Includes European as well as Far Eastern.

name: How to Create a 16th-Century Venetian Dress
description_book: How to create the basic underbust dress pattern that can be used for a variety of classes in the early 16th century of Venice.
description_web: Want to learn different ways to create a period-looking early 16th-century Italian dress?  I will show how to drape your own pattern as well as explain how to use some popular commercial patterns to achieve the 1500's Venetian look.
fee_itemization: $3 for paper print outs with directions and additional information

name: Bardic Collegium #4: Sources of Inspiration
description_book: Have you heard a great song that inspires you to write another? Seen or heard something amazing and want to write about it? ...let's talk.
description_web: Have you heard a great song that inspires you to write another? Seen or heard something amazing and want to write about it? Written a song and discovered that your great tune was actually someone else's? Me too! Come to the Collegium today...let's talk.

name: Richard III, Death and  Discovery
description_book: In 2012 the mortal remains of King Richard III were discovered under a car park in Leicester. This is about his death, discovery and re-interment .
description_web: Return of the King. In 2012 the mortal remains of the last warrior King of England to die in battle were discovered under a car park in Leicester. This is about the king's death, discovery and re-interment .

name: Buttons: Woven in the Diagonal Ottoman Style
description_book: Learn to make the diagonally-woven buttons often found on Ottoman kaftans. Note: There is a lot of manual dexterity and patience needed.
description_web: Many Ottoman buttons are threads woven on the diagonal over an oval or cylindrical wooden base. Come learn to make these Ottoman-style buttons. Note that there is a lot of manual dexterity and patience needed! These buttons are not easy to make. There will be a limit of 10 kits.
fee_itemization: kit includes needle, wax, floss, and bead bases to make several buttons.

name: Tablet Weavers' Tea
description_book: A social gathering for tablet weavers of all levels to show off current work, see projects from other people, and schmooze.

name: Bellatrix System: Wraps
description_book: A bio-mechanically safe "wrap", and complementary techniques. Unarmored class appropriate for all levels of proficiency.
description_web: The class teaches the Bellatrix version of the "wrap", which provides powerful wraps from various angles, while maintaining bio-mechanical safety. The class will touch on several techniques that appear to be a wrap until late in the swing. The class is appropriate for authorized fighters at all levels of proficiency. The class is taught unarmored. Students must bring a sword and a shield.

name: Beginner Dance: Review by Request
description_book: Having trouble remembering a dance you learned earlier? This is the place to be! We'll go back over any dance and maybe also teach you something new.

name: Youth Armored Castle Battle
description_book: Participants must have been at a minimum of one full session at the Youth List.
description_web: Youth Castle Battle: Participants must have been at a minimum of one full session at the Youth List.

name: Advanced Engraving
description_book: The continuation of the work begun in the beginning class. Hand-engraving on copper plate. Letters and design work.
description_web: The continuation of the work begun in the beginning class. Hand-engraving on copper plate. Letters and design work.

name: Fast Archery, Toxic Arrows: Lars Andersen & Beyond
description_book: Learn to perform and understand various techniques of speed shooting from a student (& consultant) of Lars Andersen with a lecture on arrow poisons.
description_web:
Arrows Quick and Venomous: Speed Shooting and Archer's Poisons
We've all seen the videos... some of us love them, some of us hate them... so here is your chance to learn how to use the techniques shown by someone who learned from Lars Andersen himself. The class will cover various styles of speed shooting for both target and combat archery. It will involve some history but more instruction in the speed shooting section, plus some instruction but more history regarding arrow poisons. Hopefully, the class will help expand your understanding of historical archery and help you apply it to your own archery.

People of all levels are welcome, especially those who have never shot a bow before. Folks with no habits may find it easier to apply these techniques than those who already have muscle memory regarding archery. 

Please bring whatever gloves, bows, and/or arrows you may have; a willingness to share will be appreciated. Strong preference for bows with no shelves.
fee_itemization: 5 dollars handout, 10 dollars for materials with estimated room for about 30 students per class

name: Reading from Facsimile
description_book: Bring your instruments and we'll play through some 16th-century music in facsimile. Get ready to read in C clefs!

name: Afternoon Youth Combat
description_book: Afternoon Youth Combat
description_web: Afternoon Youth Combat

name: *Murrine* and Canes...
description_book: Join us as we learn how to make various types of period *murrine* or "cane"  This is an advanced lampworking class.
description_web: In this class we will learn how to make many different kinds of "cane" which can be cut up to make *murrine*. This will then be applied to beads. We will be using period methods to create our cane. This is a hands-on class and all materials and equipment will be provided for use during this class. Required: hair pulled back; closed toe shoes; clothing appropriate for working with a flame, i.e., no hanging sleeves or bodice parts.

name: ISIS Wings
description_book: Ancient belly dance myth meets contemporary pizzazz with ISIS wings! Wear your wings and learn Egyptian-style belly dance routines. All welcome!
description_web: Ancient belly dance myth meets contemporary pizzazz with ISIS wings. Wear your wings and foot wear! You will learn Egyptian-style belly dance routines with wings and also improvise with wings. At the end of class we will float and fly the streets and hills of Pennsic on our Fabulous Wings. Traveling musicians welcome!

name: *Zibaldone da Canal*: The Book of a 14th-C Trader
description_book: The daily life of a 14th-century man, geared towards the fun and insightful bits that animate. Also a great look at a contemporary view on Islam.
description_web: A look into the daily life of a 14th-century merchant named Canal, through diary and ledger, geared towards the fun and insightful bits that bring him to life. Watch him fail at learning algebra. Learn how he feels about Islam. You may never get a better look at the personal thoughts of someone who lived 600 years ago.

name: Engineering the Dream: SCA Event Planning
description_book: Discussion of the nuts and bolts of event planning: site selection, budgeting, activities, schedules and staffing to help people design fun events.
description_web: Discussion of the nuts and bolts of event planning: site selection, budgeting, activities, schedules and staffing to help design fun events. Plan on 1 to 1.5 hours depending on the amount of discussion and Q&A. Master Gunnar has served as an event steward for local, kingdom and Known World events.

name: Exchequer 101
description_book: Were you told, “Just put expense A on line 15 – it’s easy!”? Have you ever been confused by SCA financial reports? Would you like to understand them?

name: Make Your Own Drawstring Bag
description_book: Using period methods, hand sew your very own drawstring bag. Everything needed to complete your very own bag. Please bring scissors.
description_web: Using period stitches, you will learn to hand sew your own drawstring bag. All materials will be provided for you as well as a handout with instructions. If you have scissors, please bring them to the class. I will provide enough materials for up to 50 people per session.
fee_itemization: A total of 100 kits and handouts will be available at no cost.  (50 per class)

name: thing.pennsicuniversity.org: Hiss & Purr
description_book: Third year! Everyone, instructor or not, come say what you liked, disliked, and would like to see in this system for next year.

name: Beehives in Period
description_book: Did you know there are seven documented styles of hives? Learn about straw, cork, wicker, and wood hives. This is a survey class. Color handout.
description_web: Did you know there are seven documented styles of hives? Learn about straw, cork, wicker, and four styles of wood hives. This is a survey class. Extensive color handout.

name: Planning a Feast
description_book: How to design a menu, figure out how much to cook, plan logistics, and everything else you need to consider to ensure a successful feast.

name: Burn the Coloring Pages, Toss Out the Foam Crowns!
description_book: Fun, hands-on youth activity ideas. This is an **adult class** on how to run activities.
description_web: Fun, hands-on activity ideas for running a youth point that shares knowledge about medieval life and/or life in our Society. If there is time, we will also cover "How to Run 'It Takes My Child to Raze a Village'". There is an optional $5 fee if you want to actually make and take samples. My book will be available for an as-yet-to-be-determined fee. (Have to calculate printing and binding costs for this year.)
fee_itemization: Not required, but if you want to make and take samples, you can pay the fee.

name: Funny Little Cordial
description_book: Properties of humors in brewing. Covers the classification of medieval beverages and how to create a cordial based on a desired humor. Over 21 only.
description_web: A look into the properties of humors in brewing. Medieval food and drinks were chosen and arranged based on their “humors”, a classification system of hot to cold, and moist to dry that was thought to influence one's temperament and health. Class covers the classification of typical medieval beverages such as ales, beers, wines and mead as well as how to create a personalized cordial based on a desired humor. Over 21 only.

name: 4th Annual Known World Courtesan Social
description_book: An informal "meet n' greet", open to anyone interested in courtesan history from around the world or playing a courtesan persona.
description_web: An informal "meet n' greet", open to anyone interested in courtesan history from around the world or playing a courtesan persona.

name: Photographers' Roundtable
description_book: Want to take better SCA photos? Want to talk shop with other photographers? Come hang out for a chat. No topic too big, no camera too small.

name: Viking Age Feast Gear: Archeological Evidence
description_book: A survey of feast gear and cookware options from among the archaeological finds of the Old Norse World. 43-page handout is available.
description_web: A survey of feast gear and cookware options from among the archaeological finds of the Old Norse World. We will look at items from Birka, Gotland, Oseberg, York, and other sites. 43-page handout is available.

name: Penta Pentamere: Five Dances You Should Know
description_book: The Baronies of Pentamere want to share their favorite dances: *Petite Rose, Montarde Bransle, Grene Gynger, Black Alman*, and *Rufty Tufty*.
description_web: The Baronies of Pentamere want to share their favorite dances: *Petite Rose, Montarde Bransle, Grene Gynger, Black Alman*, and *Rufty Tufty*.

name: A Brief History of the Hammered Dulcimer
description_book: An introduction to the dulcimer with a little hands-on activity if time allows.
description_web: A brief introduction to the hammered dulcimer from its origins to its final fade from grace in the eyes of the nobility. There will be hands-on activity if time allows.

name: *Kumihimo* Basics
description_book: *Kumihimo*: cord braiding on a disk.
description_web: Kumihimo: cord braiding on a disk. Make a basic round cord. Disk and string provided; take your work home with you.

name: Dwarves vs Giants
description_book: This is a series of combats and melées between fighters five and a half feet and under and fighters six and a quarter feet and over.

name: Throwback Thursday Épée/Foil Tournament
description_book: Remember when? Celebrate Throwback Thursday with foils and épées. Round-robin will seed single-elimination final bracket. Start 45 min after woods.
description_web: Remember when? Come and celebrate Throwback Thursday with a foil/épée tournament. Round-robin will seed single-elimination final bracket. Tournament will start 45 minutes after the conclusion of the rapier woods battle.

name: Telling Time with Richard II
description_book: The theory and use of a simple time-keeping device called a Horary Quadrant, in particular one based on several associated with King Richard II.
description_web: The theory and use of a simple time-keeping device called a Horary Quadrant, in particular one based on several associated with King Richard II. This class will give the historical context for the horary quadrant and provide extensive hands-on, practical experience in using it.
fee_itemization: Covers the cost of handout and an example quadrant for each student

name: Basic Hand Sewing
description_book: Learn period methods of seaming and hemming, fabric traits, and how to reduce thread wear and tangling. Fabric, thread, needles supplied.
description_web: Learn period methods of seaming and hemming, fabric traits, and how to reduce thread wear and tangling. Fabric, thread, and needles will be supplied. Please bring scissors if you have them. This course is appropriate for adults, and for children the parents consider old enough to handle the needles safely. For children under 10, it would be helpful to have the parent present.
fee_itemization:
5 pages @ .10 page
materials include fabric, needles, and thread

name: Arabic  101
description_book: To have knowledge on the very basic foundations of the Arabic language.

name: Reinventing the Wheel
description_book: Why do we do things in the SCA the way we do them, and how could we do them differently? How can we stress the "Creative" part of our name?
description_web: Why do we do things in the SCA the way we do them, and how could we do them differently? How can we stress the "Creative" part of our name in the structure and planning of our events? Come prepared for active discussion and brainstorming!

name: Responsible Performing in the SCA
description_book: Serve your own dreams of performing to adoring crowds in balance with serving the event.
description_web: Learn the balance between being a spotlight hog and waiting to be invited to perform. Learn to work with event staff, Royalty, and Baronage to schedule when and where your performance will enhance the event. You may be brilliant, but don’t risk grandstanding even by mistake.

name: East Kingdom College of Performers
description_book: EKCP annual meeting: nominations for officers, meet and greet, discussion of events and activities.

name: *RúnValdr*
description_book: In period, runes were very rarely used for divination, but there are many examples of runes being used for magic. A modern system for rune magick.
description_web: In period, runes were very rarely used for divination, but there are many examples of runes being used for magic. This is a system that shows, for example, how to use Norse or Anglo-Saxon runes to hear even at distance, or to awaken inanimate objects. This is a system of energy manipulation using runes and another set of symbols. This workshop introduces the symbols and what each of them is used for, and includes the attunement. It does *not* include introduction to runes. You may take this workshop without knowing the runes, but you will need to learn them to be able to use this system. You will be able to use this technique immediately.

name: European Sword Dancing
description_book: An overview of hilt and point sword dances in period, and a chance to learn a more modern, though quite similar, version.
description_web: An overview of hilt and point sword dances in period, and a chance to learn a more modern, though quite similar, version.
fee_itemization: Handout. Materials are limited because I only have 12 "swords" to dance with.

name: Trimaris Court
description_book: Trimaris Court at Trimaris Royal camp.
description_web: Trimaris Court at Trimaris Royal camp.

name: Storytelling Academy Student Performance
description_book: The student performance of Minerva’s Spindle's Storytelling nine-day academy.
description_web: The student performance of Minerva’s Spindle's Storytelling nine-day academy from Minerva’s Spindle, 158. During the nine-day academy, students gained knowledge about the history and techniques for storytelling both in the SCA and the modern world.

name: Geometric Garment Construction
description_book: We'll discuss how clothing can be constructed from simple geometric shapes, based on extant garments from various parts of SCA period.
description_web: This class will discuss how clothing can be constructed from simple geometric shapes, based on extant garments from various parts of SCA period. Strategies for fitting and sizing to the individual will be discussed.

name: From Bees to Booze (Advanced)
description_book:
Mead 303: Prepare for Competition.

A hybrid Instruction/Forum format.  Not really for beginners, but open to all.
description_web: This class is meant for those wishing to produce a product for competition, whether they're going for Populace Choice, or being judged by their peers. We will cover some of the documentation required, some suggestions for aging and refining your brew and, after working through some of the basics, we'll open it up into a forum to pool and share experiences and knowledge.

name: Herjolfesnes Gowns: A 20th-Century Perspective
description_book: Adapting modern commercial women's dress patterns to make a Herjolfesnes-style gown, late 13th C to early 14th C.
description_web: I will assist people to adapt a modern commercial dress pattern into a pattern for a gown in the style of Herjolfsnes gown G.38 or G.39. I will show you how to alter the modern pattern and then you can trace all pattern pieces onto plain white paper I will provide. There will also be a handout with some historical details and finishing suggestions.
fee_itemization: To cover the cost of patterns, pens and paper.

name: Pimp My Wine
description_book: Learn how to "Pimp My Wine" and turn everyday wine into a period-style hypocras full of spice and yumminess. Tastings so bring ID. Age 21 and over.
description_web: Just like "Pimp My Ride" takes an ordinary old car and turns it into a masterpiece, this class will show you how to turn your normal everyday wine into a period-style hypocras full of spice and yumminess. Alcoholic and non-alcoholic version will be available for sample during the class so please remember your ID. Age 21 and over.

name: Anglo-Saxon Context: Scandinavia ("Vikings")
description_book: Neighboring cultures inform us about the Anglo-Saxons. We'll focus on the the Scandinavian cultures and their interactions with England.
description_web: To understand Anglo-Saxons we need to understand the people with whom they interacted, what came before and after. This series of workshops looks at the surrounding cultures through the lens of their interaction with the Anglo-Saxons. This workshop focuses on the Scandinavian cultures. It is too easy to consider them simply as the Vikings, either raiding the coasts, or inhabiting the Danelaw (or in the 11th century, ruling England). We'll try to differentiate between Norse and Danes; how they, from Vendel to Icelandic periods, dealt with the English.

name: *Tanka* Competition
description_book: A friendly competition of the composition of *tanka* poetry patterned after the traditional contests.
description_web: A friendly competition of the composition of *tanka* poetry patterned after the traditional contests.

name: Rehearsal (Closed) KWC Pre-Performance Warm Ups
description_book: (Closed Rehearsal) Pre-performance warm-ups and line-up in European Dance Tent for the Known World Choir performance in PAT at 6:30 pm.

name: Kingdom of Ealdormere Royal Court
description_book: Kingdom of Ealdormere Royal Court
description_web: Kingdom of Ealdormere Royal Court

name: Ansteorran Court
description_book: TRM Sven and Antigone invite one and all to Ansteorra's court at Pennsic.

name: Known World Choirs Performance
description_book: The Known World Choirs will perform an extravaganza of medieval and Renaissance choral music, including the reign of François I of France.
description_web:
Show time: 6:30 - 8:15pm
The Pennsic Choirs, consisting of the Pennsic Choir, the select choir Chorulus Pennsicus, the Youth Choir, and the Children's Choir, will perform an extravaganza of medieval and Renaissance choral music. The Pennsic Choirs' concert will focus on music from the reign of François I of France, whose coronation was held 500 years ago.

name: Viking Age Textile Tools: Archeological Evidence
description_book: A survey of Viking Age textile tools found in Norse and neighboring sites; 45-page handout.
description_web: A survey of Viking Age textile tools found in Norse and neighboring sites. We will look at cards, combs, looms, loom weights, shears, shuttles, skein-winders, smoothing stones, spindles, and whorls. We will cover Birka, Coppergate, Dublin, Hedeby, Lund, Novgorod, Oseberg, Ribe, and other finds. 45-page handout is available.

name: Known World Players' Annual Meeting
description_book: KWPs' annual meeting. Company members and newcomers alike are invited to hear officer reports and discuss KWPs future.
description_web: The Known World Players' annual Guild meeting. Company members and newcomers alike are invited to come share ideas about the company's future, hear officers' annual reports, and discuss future productions.

name: Bedtime Stories for Children
description_book: Nightly telling of stories for children.
description_web: 7 pm nightly: Stories and fables for children. All are welcome to attend; must have adult escort.

name: *Muhekian*: The Taste of Tea
description_book: Enjoy the taste of tea under the night sky. Please wear Japanese or loose-fitting clothes with white socks or *tabi*, and bring a fan if you have one.
description_web: Enjoy the taste of tea under the night sky. Please wear Japanese or loose-fitting clothing with white socks or *tabi*, and bring a fan if you have one. Please do not wear any jewelry or weapons in the tea room.
fee_itemization: cost of tea and sweets - 12 per sitting.

name: Calontir Royal Court
description_book: Calontir Royal Court at Calontir Royal Camp.
description_web: Calontir Royal Court at Calontir Royal Camp.

name: Atlatl Battle
description_book: This will be an Atlatl battle on the battlefield near the castle.

name: A Night with Knights
description_book: We invite members of the Chivalry from all kingdoms to get in armor and come to the youth list! Give our young fighters the benefit of your expertise.
description_web: We invite members of the Chivalry from all kingdoms to get in armor and come to the youth list! You can give our young fighters the benefit of your expertise. Sparring between adults and youths will be allowed under these special training conditions. All weapons, calibration and conventions will be as per Youth Combat rules. Parents/guardians are advised that allowing your child to participate shall be understood as permission for this type of training.

name: "The Book of Delights": A 12th-Century Tale
description_book: Performance of a 12th-century tale ("The Book of Delights") by Mar Yaakov HaMizrachi at the Amphitheater.
description_web: Storyteller Mar Yaakov HaMizrachi will perform an adaptation of *Sefer Hashashuim,* "The Book of Delights," a 12th-century tale by Yosef Zabara. Are women praiseworthy or a bane to their husbands? Zabara illustrates through this tale of a cunning fox, a foolish leopard and the leopard's wise wife that it is better to trust your true love than the flattery of friends.

name: Middle Kingdom Royal Court
description_book: Middle Kingdom Royal Court
description_web: Middle Kingdom Royal Court

name: Nutmegs & Ginger
description_book: Nutmegs & Ginger presents ʺRum, Beer, Ale, Wine: Songs of Spice and Viceʺ. Come join us for an hour of lively songs and earthy humor!
description_web: Nutmegs & Ginger presents ʺRum, Beer, Ale, Wine: Songs of Spice and Vice,ʺ a program of period and near-period music performed with voices and instruments.  Come join us for an hour of lively songs and earthy humor! *Some material may be inappropriate for children under 12.*

name: Calontir Kingdom Party
description_book: Calontir Kingdom Party at Calontir Royal Camp.
description_web: Calontir Kingdom Party at Calontir Royal Camp.

name: Clan Blue Feather Encampment Party
description_book: We'll have booze, snacks and entertainment; you bring yourselves and have a good time.
description_web: The annual party. We'll have booze, snacks and entertainment; you bring yourselves and have a good time.

name: The Dean's Favorites
description_book: Come help the newest Laurel of dance celebrate with a few of her favorite dances.

name: Known World Party
description_book: The Known World Party is a Venetian Carnivale! Come out after Midrealm Court to the New Barn for food, fun and entertainment!

name: Pennsic *Commedia* All Stars
description_book: A *commedia dell'arte*-style play by a troupe brought together at Pennsic with actors and supporters from throughout the Known World!
description_web:
A play in the style of 16th-century Italian *Commedia dell' Arte* by a troupe brought together at Pennsic with actors and supporters from throughout the Known World!
*Some material may be inappropriate for children under 12.*

name: Bellatrix: Individual Session
description_book: Individuals or small groups with Duke Paul, covering any martial topic. **Contact Duke Paul** at paul@bellatrix.org **to schedule** date/time.
description_web: **Time/date not firm.** One to two hours with Duke Paul for individuals or small groups, covering any martial topic. **Contact Duke Paul** at paul@bellatrix.org to **schedule actual date/time**.

name: *Études* 1 and 2 for Single Sword (Fencing)
description_book: For all levels and teachers. Drills focus on form, balance, movement and coordination. *Études* for drill; elements from drill used to work in groups.
description_web: For beginner and intermediate fencers and those who teach them. These drills will focus on form, balance, movement and coordination. *Étude*1 (first week) is more linear; *Étude* 2 (second week) adds off line/lateral movement. Emphasis will be on learning the *études* for home drill, as well as taking elements out of the drill for more focused work in groups.

name: Youth Combat
description_book: Morning Youth Combat Session
description_web: Morning Youth Combat Session

name: Rehearsal (Closed): KWP
description_book: Space in use.
description_web: Space in use.

name: Archery Populace War Point
description_book: Archery Populace War Point
description_web: All archers young and old are encouraged to come and lend their support to their kingdom's efforts, and to display their skill at archery. There will be three challenging populace shoots to test skills. Each Kingdom will be competing to earn the three War Points for each shoot.

name: Beaded Flowers
description_book: Make a miniature tea rose in the style of the beaded flowers of 15th-century Venice.

name: Children's Doll Meet
description_book: Open to children ages 3-18 years of age. Please bring your favorite doll to the class, as you will be making something for your doll.
description_web: Open to children ages 3-18 years of age. Please bring your favorite doll to the class, as we will be making something for them. All dolls are welcome: ball jointed, cloth, plastic, porcelain, anime.

name: Dance Floor Break Down
description_book: Come out and help us break down the dance floor.

name: East Kingdom Rapier Tournament
description_book: East Kingdom Pennsic Rapier Tournament! Tournament plan will be a round-robin followed by a double-elimination. Open to all fencers.
description_web: Welcome back to the East Kingdom Pennsic Rapier Tournament! Tournament plan will be a round-robin followed by a double-elimination. Efforts will be made to balance out round-robins. Come show your skill as this tournament returns to the fold. Tournament is open to all qualified fencers from all kingdoms.

name: From Fiber to Garb
description_book: We will discuss fiber, prep, yarn and cloth-making choices in different periods and locations. Emphasis will be on techniques and fiber sources.
description_web: We will discuss fiber, prep, yarn and cloth-making choices in different periods and locations. Emphasis will be on available techniques and fiber sources. Examples will be provided, but please bring your own to share.

name: *Eboshi* Hats and *Tabi* Shoes
description_book: If you wish to dress head to toe as a nobleman of medieval Japan, you may wish to cover your head with an *eboshi* and your feet with *tabi*.
description_web: If you wish to dress head to toe as a nobleman of medieval Japan, you may wish to cover your head with an *eboshi* and your feet with *tabi*. Multiple patterns and methods of creating each will be discussed.

name: Courtesy and Intellectual Property for Bards
description_book: An intermediate-level look at courtesy, copyright, intellectual property, and attribution for the Bardic Arts in writing and performance.
description_web: An intermediate level look at courtesy, copyright, and intellectual property for the Bardic Arts in writing and performance, including why correct attribution is important. Will also discuss how this applies to 'filking', parody, derivative works, licenses, various usage rights, and royalties.

name: Basic Feast Planning
description_book: Are you experienced at planning feasts? Need to brush up? Then come and review with an experienced feast steward.
description_web: Are you experienced at planning feasts? Need to brush up? Then come and review with an experienced feast steward.

name: Weaving on a Warp-Weighted Loom
description_book: Warp-weighted looms can be large and strange. Let's learn how to weave on one on a smaller scale. (Follow-up to "Warping" class. Others welcome!)
description_web: A full-size warp-weighted loom, as built in period, can be imposingly large and strange. We're going to learn how to weave on one on a smaller and more human scale. Using the warp we created in the previous class, we'll be working in pairs, learning how to weave a tabby weave, with discussions on working with more complex weaves. We'll have space for up to 12 people working hands-on. This is a follow-up class for the "Warping a Warp-Weighted Loom" class.

name: Armoured Field Battle
description_book: Three battles to last fighter. One point per battle. Line up on standard sides. CA and siege in first and third battles.
description_web:
Three battles to last fighter. One point per battle. Line up on standard sides. CA and siege in 1st & 3rd battles. Field Battles will be fought in an East-West orientation on a 600' x 600' field. 
• Starting lines to be 100 feet from the edge of field.
• Reset time between battles is 15 minutes.
• Combat archery and Siege in first and third battles. Tubular ammo maybe gleaned, no re-inspection of fiberglass shafts between battles. 
• All holds to be general and kept to a minimum.

name: Medieval Music Notation: Introduction
description_book: Read lots of examples in facsimile, discussing problems as they arise. Bring melody instruments you play fluently, e.g., recorder, fiddle, voice.
description_web:
Reading medieval music in modern notation imposes modern notions of measure, phrasing, and tonality. Reading it in the original notation allows us to get closer to the composer's intentions and the head-space of a medieval performer, and can help achieve those elusive, magical “medieval moments”. We'll spend most of the class reading examples, discussing problems as they arise.  F, G, and C clefs in various places, long note values, unbarred music, C.O.P. ligatures, *musica ficta*, and perhaps “minor coloration". 

Bring melody instruments you play fluently, such as recorder, gamba, fiddle, voice (if you have good pitch memory), etc. If you have multiple sizes of your instrument, please bring them (e.g., SATB recorders).

Each session of the class will use different examples, so feel free to attend both.

name: Weed Walk
description_book: Wild plant identification. Wear walking shoes and hat; leave from Univ. Point. Different teachers on different days; walk with us more than once!
description_web: Cooper's Lake abounds with medicinal and food plants that were used by various primitive and medieval cultures. Learn to identify them during a walk around the campsite. The walk will take place rain or shine. Please wear sturdy shoes and a hat. Meet at University Point for the start of the class. We have three wonderful new teachers this year, enabling us to offer this class more times!

name: The Market Wallet: A Form of Period Luggage
description_book: The market wallet is an alternative to the shoulder bag in use from Anglo-Saxon to 19th-C Europe. Construction and period evidence will be discussed.

name: Sonnet More Like Shakespeare
description_book: A look at five areas where Shakespeare bent and sometimes broke the "rules" you've been taught about Shakespearian sonnets, and made better sonnets.
description_web: A look at the techniques Shakespeare used in his sonnets that go against what you're usually taught about Shakespearian sonnets. Five things he did you're probably not doing.

name: Basic *Ka-Kha-Ga-Gha*
description_book: Written forms, pronunciations, and usage of *Devanagari* script used by Hindi, Sanskrit and other Indic languages.
description_web:
Written forms, pronunciations, and usage of *Devanagari* script used by Hindi and other North Indian languages. While the focus of this class is on Hindi usage, the characters and pronunciation are nearly identical for others. There will be examples in Hindi.
1st hour: Basic characters and pronunciation.
2nd hour: Vowels and half-letters; more if time and student interest allow.

name: Intro to 6-on-2 Chainmail
description_book: This type of chainmail was prevalent in period across multiple cultures. All materials provided but bring two pairs of pliers.
description_web: Intro class for 6-on-2 chainmail prevalent throughout period across multiple cultures. All materials necessary to complete class project provided but bring two pairs of standard box nose pliers if you have them. Tools are available for those who don't have them on a first-come first-served basis.
fee_itemization: Sufficient hand-turned & cut aluminum rings, 12ga 5/8 in diameter, to complete class project.

name: A Sleeping Pen Awakened
description_book: Women's literacy between 1400-1600 was a much contested (and complicated) concept. This class examines how women interacted with texts.
description_web: Literacy does not mean the same thing today that it meant 500 years ago, and this change is more complicated when gender enters the picture. This class will examine women's literacy between 1400-1600. Class will examine women who wrote, men and women who wrote about women writing, and the distinction between women reading and women writing.

name: What Makes a God? Key Aspects in Myth
description_book: The underlying lessons of pre-Christian Norse and Irish myth are conveyed through the gods' associations and character traits.

name: Bardic Next Steps
description_book: You've taken all the Bardic 101 courses here. What's next? I dunno. So, a discussion on what sort of Bardic 201 classes people want to see taught.
description_web: You've taken all the various Bardic 101 courses that are available. What's next? Excellent question. I don't think anyone has a good answer to that right now. This will be a roundtable discussion to figure out what sort of Bardic 201/301 classes people would like to see being taught.

name: Tunics Through Time
description_book: The t-tunic was the essential garment of the Middle Ages. See how easy, practical changes in fit, shape, drape and decoration make the difference!
description_web: The "t-tunic" was the essential garment construction for more than a millennium, but fashions shift and change. Learn how simple changes in fit, shape, drape and, of course, embellishment can make the difference between Norse or Norman, Byzantine or bliaut, Celtic or cotehardie!

name: Pennsic Marshal Staff After Action Review
description_book: A brief meeting to wrap up and review the week's marshal activities.
description_web: A brief meeting to wrap up and review the week's marshal activities.

name: Writing *Commedia dell'Arte* Scenarios
description_book: Quick and practical way to create period plausible *commedia* scenarios for your troupe: for practice, SCA event, or Pennsic performance!
description_web: Quick and practical way to create period plausible *commedia* scenarios for your troupe: for practice, SCA event, or Pennsic performance! We will define a basic structure of a *commedia* play, identify the main characters and their functions, and learn to construct the scenarios that highlight the strengths of your troupe, whatever size and/or composition!

name: Rehearsal (Closed) - Youth *Commedia* Dress
description_book: Space in use.

name: Period *Commedia* Performed for Modern Audiences
description_book: Making a period *commedia* scenario from 1611 work for a modern audience
description_web: Case studies of *commedia* scenarios from 1611, “The Fake Magician” and “He Who Was Believed Dead”, tweaked and performed successfully for modern audiences. See what’s necessary for filling in the gaps left by Flamino Scala and adjusting for modern tastes.

name: Rapier Field Battle
description_book: Three battles to last fighter. One point per battle. Death From Behind allowed.    RBGs **not** allowed. Start lines consistent with Armoured Battles.
description_web:
Three battles to last fighter. One point per battle. There will be a 15-minute water break between battles. 
• Death From Behind is allowed. 
• All holds are general and kept to a minimum 
• RBGs will **not** be used 
• Orientation and start lines consistent  with Armored Battles 
• One friendship battle to be fought after the third War Point battle.

name: Medieval Music Notation: Intermediate
description_book: Ligatures and perfection, for those comfortable with the basic class. Bring melody instruments you play fluently.
description_web:
For those already comfortable with long note values, unbarred music, *musica ficta*, and clefs other than treble and bass. We'll learn some more advanced stuff: ligatures for combinations of *breves* and *longas*, and the weird world of triple meter, where the same note-head can mean several different durations in the same piece depending on context. Bring melody instruments (recorder, harp, fiddle, lute, etc.) that you play fluently. Voice is OK if you have good pitch sense. If recorder, bring several sizes (e.g., SATB) if possible.

Each session will use different examples, so feel free to attend both and get extra reading practice!

name: Making *Commedia* Happen in the SCA: A Roundtable
description_book: Bringing *commedia dell’ arte* to life in the SCA is a complex challenge few have accomplished.Talk to them here about what worked and didn't.
description_web: Come hear from *commedia* veterans about what worked and what didn’t in an organized discussion covering recruiting and keeping a troupe together, costuming and masks, writing scenarios, finding documentation, participating in A&S fairs, working with event staff for performance space, and where in the world to start.

name: Bardic Arts In Your Persona
description_book: How to use period works for inspiration or adaptation to fit your SCA persona and bardic repertoire, whether in song, storytelling, or poetry.
description_web: Discussion on how to adapt period works to fit your personal SCA persona and bardic repertoire, from using period sources as inspiration for original pieces (song, poetry, and/or storytelling) to transliterating, abridging, and "re-poeticizing" period works for the modern ear.

name: Known World Players: Open Auditions, Pennsic 45
description_book: The Known World Players is seeking actors to audition for Pennsic 45's production of Ben Jonson’s riotous Elizabethan comedy, *The Alchemist*.
description_web: The Known World Players is seeking actors to audition for next year’s production of Ben Jonson’s riotous Elizabethan comedy of cons and swindlers, *The Alchemist*. Women and men of teen age and up are welcome. Audition material will be provided.

name: Strike: Ampitheater
description_book: Strike the Amphitheater and Rehearsal Tent: remove signs, re-stack chairs, clean up any trash and other properties left from PA classes and events.
description_web: Strike the Amphitheater and Rehearsal Tent: remove signs, re-stack chairs, and clean up any trash and other properties left from PA classes and events. Return properties to the Performing Arts Tent backstage area for loading onto the storage trailer after the final performance ends on the night of 8/8.

name: Bardic Collegium #5: Sharing Your Muse
description_book: Back due to popular demand: Are you working on a piece that just won't go anywhere? Bards of all levels of experience - come share your muse!
description_web: Back due to popular demand: Are you working on a piece that just won't go anywhere? Need an idea to connect your beginning and end? Or maybe a great ending? Bards of all levels of experience - come share your muse with others. Just because she won't co-operate with you today doesn't mean she's left show biz! (She may need a change of pace, too!)

name: Strike: Rehearsal Tent
description_book: Strike the Amphitheater and Rehearsal Tent: remove signs, re-stack chairs, clean up any trash and other properties left from PA classes and events.
description_web: Strike the Amphitheater and Rehearsal Tent: Remove signs, re-stack chairs, and clean up any trash and other properties left from PA classes and events. Return properties to the Performing Arts Tent backstage area for loading onto the storage trailer after the final performance ends on the night of 8/8.

name: Closing Ceremonies - After Final Battle
description_book: Closing Ceremonies - After Final Battle, in front of Fort or in Great Hall if raining.
description_web: Closing Ceremonies - After Final Battle, in front of Fort or in Great Hall if raining.

name: Pennsic Youth *Commedia* Performance
description_book: This is the performance following a week of workshops and classes for youth in Pennsic *Commedia*. Come enjoy the show!
description_web: This is the performance following a week of workshops and classes for youth in Pennsic *Commedia*. Come enjoy the show!  (Youth *Commedia* Classes: Sunday - Thursday, 9-10 am, in the Amphitheater.)

name: Anglo-Saxon Context: the Normans
description_book: Neighboring cultures inform us about the Anglo-Saxons. We'll focus on the Norman/Saxon cultural conflict that created Medieval England.
description_web: To understand Anglo-Saxons we need to understand the people with whom they interacted, what came before and after. This series of workshops looks at the surrounding cultures through the lens of their interaction with the Anglo-Saxons. The infamous problems that arose after the Norman Conquest went beyond the accommodations needed in the Danelaw or even under the rule of Cnut. We'll look at the Norman/Saxon cultural conflict that only gradually resolved to create Medieval England.

name: A Cycle of Norse Myths
description_book: A cycle of Norse myths from the Creation of the World to Ragnarok. All told by storytelling Laurel Mistress Dervila ni Leanon.
description_web: Mistress Dervila ni Leanon will be performing a cycle of Norse myths from the Creation of the World to Ragnarok. Come hear why Thor dressed up as a bride, how the evil wolf Fenris was bound, how Mjolnir was created, how the beautiful Freya convinced Loki the trickster to become a mother, and more! *Some Material may be inappropriate for children under 12*.

name: KWP Performance: Backstage Overflow
description_book: (Space in use - KWP Performance: Backstage Overflow)

name: Youth Combat Reindeer Games
description_book: An evening of games and snacks for youth fighters, marshals, parents and alumni. Some of these combat games are for all ages.
description_web: An evening of games and snacks for youth fighters, marshals, parents and alumni. Some of these combat games are for all ages. Some games have very light contact with *boffer*-style weapons. Please bring head and hand protection. Other games such as "Angel of Life/Angel of Death", "Combat Red Rover", and "Zombies" require full armor.

name: Youth Combat Alumni Tourney
description_book: Open to all Adult Authorized Graduates of the YC Program. Various singles and melée activities.
description_web: Open to all Adult Authorized Graduates of the YC Program. Tourney format to be determined. Various singles and melée activities.

name: Known World Players: Merchant of Venice
description_book: Join Antonio, Bassanio, Shylock, Portia and Nerissa in Shakespeare’s classic, “The Merchant of Venice” on the Pennsic stage.
description_web: Join the Known World Players as they bring Shakespeare’s classic, “The Merchant of Venice” to the Pennsic stage. This classic is thought to have been written between 1596 and 1598 and contains many memorable speeches and characterizations. Join Antonio, Bassanio, Shylock, Portia and Nerissa in this classic by the Bard. Curtain will go up at 8:00 PM on Friday, August 8th.

name: Strike: Performing Arts after Final Performance
description_book: Strike the Performing Arts Tent: restack chairs and tables; remove, store backstage and house lights, the stage, curtains and other PA properties.
description_web: Strike the Performing Arts Tent after the final performance ends: restack chairs and tables, remove and store backstage and house lights, take apart and store the stage decks and tops, take down and store the curtains, backdrop, signs, and return all PA Properties to the storage trailer. Bring cordless drills and hand tools.
